quotes.text: Teach thy tongue to say 'I do not know', and thou shalt progress.
quotes.author: Maimonides

quotes.text: I just stick my tongue out because I hate smiling in pictures. It's so awkward. It looks so cheesy.
quotes.author: Miley Cyrus

quotes.text: Fire and swords are slow engines of destruction, compared to the tongue of a Gossip.
quotes.author: Richard Steele

quotes.text: You can change your world by changing your words... Remember, death and life are in the power of the tongue.
quotes.author: Joel Osteen

quotes.text: I learnt to sing in Bengali, my mother tongue, then went on to sing in Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Gujarati and every possible Indian language.
quotes.author: Shreya Ghoshal

quotes.text: Meditation is the tongue of the soul and the language of our spirit.
quotes.author: Jeremy Taylor

quotes.text: The martyr cannot be dishonored. Every lash inflicted is a tongue of fame; every prison a more illustrious abode.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Swollen in head, weak in legs, sharp in tongue but empty in belly.
quotes.author: Mao Zedong

quotes.text: We should tell our kids to just have fun, participate and not get bent on winning or losing. But every coach, when they say that, they say it tongue in cheek, 'Don't worry about winning': If you win I'll get you ice cream, but if you lose I'm going to pout in the car.
quotes.author: Bode Miller

quotes.text: Give me the ready hand rather than the ready tongue.
quotes.author: Cesare Pavese

quotes.text: I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it.
quotes.author: Flannery O'Connor

quotes.text: All parts of the human body get tired eventually - except the tongue.
quotes.author: Konrad Adenauer

quotes.text: The pen is the tongue of the mind.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.text: I wanted a name I could shape the music towards. I was going to Miami quite a lot at the time, speaking a lot of Spanish with my friends from Cuba - 'Lana Del Rey' reminded us of the glamour of the seaside. It sounded gorgeous coming off the tip of the tongue.
quotes.author: Lana Del Rey

quotes.text: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, 'It might have been'.
quotes.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quotes.text: A black person grows up in this country - and in many places - knowing that racism will be as familiar as salt to the tongue. Also, it can be as dangerous as too much salt. I think that you must struggle for betterment for yourself and for everyone.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: If it's very painful for you to criticize your friends - you're safe in doing it. But if you take the slightest pleasure in it, that's the time to hold your tongue.
quotes.author: Alice Miller

quotes.text: Listen! Clam up your mouth and be silent like an oyster shell, for that tongue of yours is the enemy of the soul, my friend. When the lips are silent, the heart has a hundred tongues.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Study a foreign language if you have opportunity to do so. You may never be called to a land where that language is spoken, but the study will have given you a better understanding of your own tongue or of another tongue you may be asked to acquire.
quotes.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.text: The tongue may be employed about, and made to serve all the purposes of vice, in tempting and deceiving, in perjury and injustice.
quotes.author: Joseph Butler

quotes.text: Foreign languages was the only thing that interested me when I was at school, so playing in another language... it is quite demanding because if it is not your mother tongue, you are missing some connotations and some emotional depth of certain things.
quotes.author: Tom Wlaschiha

quotes.text: When I was younger, I was terrified to express anger because it would often kick-start a horrible reaction in the men in my life. So I bit my tongue. I was left to painstakingly deal with the aftermath of my avoidance later in life, in therapy or through the lyrics of my songs.
quotes.author: Alanis Morissette

quotes.text: When men and woman die, as poets sung, his heart's the last part moves, her last, the tongue.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: There are accents in the eye which are not on the tongue, and more tales come from pale lips than can enter an ear. It is both the grandeur and the pain of the remoter moods that they avoid the pathway of sound.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.text: Give thy thoughts no tongue.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: A quote is just a tattoo on the tongue.
quotes.author: William F. DeVault

quotes.text: If the tongue had not been framed for articulation, man would still be a beast in the forest.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: There is a silence, the child of love, which expresses everything, and proclaims more loudly than the tongue is able to do.
quotes.author: William Drummond

quotes.text: I've certainly had to bite my tongue on occasion and live to fight another day, so to speak, on certain things. But when you're new and fresh, you come out and think, 'I don't want to screw my chance up, so I'll go along with what everybody else does.'
quotes.author: Joe Nichols

quotes.text: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.text: There is nothing that so much gratifies an ill tongue as when it finds an angry heart.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.text: Talk about your negative experiences with the father, with your girlfriends. Not with your children. And bite your tongue when it comes to diminishing, denying, dismissing, name-calling.
quotes.author: Iyanla Vanzant

quotes.text: A tart temper never mellows with age, and a sharp tongue is the only edged tool that grows keener with constant use.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.text: Prayer requires more of the heart than of the tongue.
quotes.author: Adam Clarke

quotes.text: I avoid talking before the youth of the age as I would dancing before them: for if one's tongue don't move in the steps of the day, and thinks to please by its old graces, it is only an object of ridicule.
quotes.author: Horace Walpole

quotes.text: Love's tongue is in his eyes.
quotes.author: John Fletcher

quotes.text: Muhammad Ali - he was a magnificent fighter and he was an icon... Every head must bow, every knee must bend, every tongue must confess, thou art the greatest, the greatest of all time, Muhammad, Muhammad Ali.
quotes.author: Don King

quotes.text: I am convinced that the best service a retired general can perform is to turn in his tongue along with his suit and to mothball his opinions.
quotes.author: Omar N. Bradley

quotes.text: Even Helen Keller, who was born blind and deaf, could see God. No doubt, in her silent darkness, every fragrant flower, every ray of the warm sun, every taste that touched her tongue told her that there was a God who created all things. Jodie Foster shouldn't therefore be surprised that people are surprised that she's an atheist.
quotes.author: Ray Comfort

quotes.text: The most dangerous word in any human tongue is the word for brother. It's inflammatory.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.text: I am a candid interview and I have a dark and dry sense of humor - a very Canadian sense of humor and I am only learning now stupidly that you can't read tongue. When I say something funny in a newspaper and I meant it to be funny, it doesn't read that way.
quotes.author: Michael Buble

quotes.text: Do not consider it proof just because it is written in books, for a liar who will deceive with his tongue will not hesitate to do the same with his pen.
quotes.author: Maimonides

quotes.text: You remember that my great vision came to me when I was only nine years old, and you have seen that I was not much good for anything until after I had performed the horse dance near the mouth of the Tongue River during my eighteenth summer.
quotes.author: Black Elk

quotes.text: The gracious, eternal God permits the spirit to green and bloom and to bring forth the most marvelous fruit, surpassing anything a tongue can express and a heart conceive.
quotes.author: Johannes Tauler

quotes.text: I prefer a kiss that is so much more than just a tongue in your mouth.
quotes.author: Katherine Heigl

quotes.text: Men are born with two eyes, but with one tongue, in order that they should see twice as much as they say.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.text: My maternal grandmother made fantastic ox tongue with velvety roasted potatoes. She cooked sweet red cabbage and lovely cauliflower with butter and bread crumbs.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: Ambition drove many men to become false; to have one thought locked in the breast, another ready on the tongue.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.text: I want to make wines that harmonize with food - wines that almost hug your tongue with gentleness.
quotes.author: Robert Mondavi

quotes.text: I will speak with a straight tongue.
quotes.author: Chief Joseph

quotes.text: Hermione uses all these big long tongue twister words. I don't know what she's going on about half the time!
quotes.author: Emma Watson

quotes.text: Great joy, especially after a sudden change of circumstances, is apt to be silent, and dwells rather in the heart than on the tongue.
quotes.author: Henry Fielding

quotes.text: If my tongue were trained to measures, I would sing a stirring song.
quotes.author: Paul Tillich

quotes.text: If you watch Olivier's interviews, he has this reptilian tongue; it seems too big for his mouth. My pursuit of that became distracting, so I let it go. The thrill was finding the right pair of glasses.
quotes.author: Julian Sands

quotes.text: He that will write well in any tongue, must follow this counsel of Aristotle, to speak as the common people do, to think as wise men do: and so should every man understand him, and the judgment of wise men allow him.
quotes.author: Roger Ascham

quotes.text: Fighting is essentially a masculine idea; a woman's weapon is her tongue.
quotes.author: Hermione Gingold

quotes.text: There's a fraudulent root element of comedy in that we say things night after night as though they are rolling effortlessly from the brain and off the tongue, when in fact they are crafted over weeks and months and years.
quotes.author: Doug Stanhope

quotes.text: 'Morsel' is a perfect word. Forming those six letters on the lips and tongue prompts an instantaneous physiological reaction. The mouth waters. The lips purse.
quotes.author: Shawn Amos

quotes.text: That other saying, I'm a part of all that I have met, I think that would have to begin with my wonderful parents back in Atlanta when I was a youngster five years old I was tongue tied.
quotes.author: Ernie Harwell

quotes.text: The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
quotes.author: Bob Hope

quotes.text: A wise man should have money in his head, but not in his heart.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.text: Money has never made man happy, nor will it, there is nothing in its nature to produce happiness. The more of it one has the more one wants.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: A little thought and a little kindness are often worth more than a great deal of money.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.text: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: The lack of money is the root of all evil.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: Wealth is the ability to fully experience life.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Real riches are the riches possessed inside.
quotes.author: B. C. Forbes

quotes.text: Alimony is like buying hay for a dead horse.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: The problem is not that people are taxed too little, the problem is that government spends too much.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.text: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: All I ask is the chance to prove that money can't make me happy.
quotes.author: Spike Milligan

quotes.text: When I was young I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old I know that it is.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Money cannot buy peace of mind. It cannot heal ruptured relationships, or build meaning into a life that has none.
quotes.author: Richard M. DeVos

quotes.text: Let us not be satisfied with just giving money. Money is not enough, money can be got, but they need your hearts to love them. So, spread your love everywhere you go.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: The American Republic will endure until the day Congress discovers that it can bribe the public with the public's money.
quotes.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quotes.text: The most efficient labor-saving device is still money.
quotes.author: Franklin P. Jones

quotes.text: The hardest thing to understand in the world is the income tax.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: A penny saved is a penny earned.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I am happy to make money. I want to make more money, make more music, eat Big Macs and drink Budweisers.
quotes.author: Kid Rock

quotes.text: Money is to my social existence what health is to my body.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.text: Lack of money is the root of all evil.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: If you can count your money, you don't have a billion dollars.
quotes.author: J. Paul Getty

quotes.text: A billion here, a billion there, and pretty soon you're talking about real money.
quotes.author: Everett Dirksen

quotes.text: Where large sums of money are concerned, it is advisable to trust nobody.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.text: There is a gigantic difference between earning a great deal of money and being rich.
quotes.author: Marlene Dietrich

quotes.text: Friends and acquaintances are the surest passport to fortune.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.text: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.text: It's easier to force feed people than it is to give 'em what they want. It makes more money.
quotes.author: Merle Haggard

quotes.text: No complaint... is more common than that of a scarcity of money.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.text: Most men love money and security more, and creation and construction less, as they get older.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.text: It's all about the money.
quotes.author: Joseph Jackson

quotes.text: A bank is a place where they lend you an umbrella in fair weather and ask for it back when it begins to rain.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Money makes your life easier. If you're lucky to have it, you're lucky.
quotes.author: Robert De Niro

quotes.text: Bottom line is, I didn't return to Apple to make a fortune. I've been very lucky in my life and already have one. When I was 25, my net worth was $100 million or so. I decided then that I wasn't going to let it ruin my life. There's no way you could ever spend it all, and I don't view wealth as something that validates my intelligence.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.text: If American men are obsessed with money, American women are obsessed with weight. The men talk of gain, the women talk of loss, and I do not know which talk is the more boring.
quotes.author: Marya Mannes

quotes.text: Don't judge me. I made a lot of money.
quotes.author: Samantha Bee

quotes.text: Thirteen thousand dollars a year is not enough to raise a family. That's not enough to pay your bills and save for their future. That's barely enough to provide for even the most basic needs.
quotes.author: Thomas Carper

quotes.text: My pride fell with my fortunes.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: If saving money is wrong, I don't want to be right!
quotes.author: William Shatner

quotes.text: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.text: I don't think business news is just for old white men with money.
quotes.author: Neil Cavuto

quotes.text: He that is of the opinion money will do everything may well be suspected of doing everything for money.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: No one's ever achieved financial fitness with a January resolution that's abandoned by February.
quotes.author: Suze Orman

quotes.text: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.text: It is not the creation of wealth that is wrong, but the love of money for its own sake.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.text: I have always been afraid of banks.
quotes.author: Andrew Jackson

quotes.text: Here's how I think of my money - as soldiers - I send them out to war everyday. I want them to take prisoners and come home, so there's more of them.
quotes.author: Kevin O'Leary

quotes.text: Men make counterfeit money; in many more cases, money makes counterfeit men.
quotes.author: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.text: Money is a strange business. People who haven't got it aim it strongly. People who have are full of troubles.
quotes.author: Ayrton Senna

quotes.text: The importance of money flows from it being a link between the present and the future.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.text: I've looked after my money. As I started working around my third birthday, my first check went straight to the bank.
quotes.author: Samantha Barks

quotes.text: A fool and his money are soon parted.
quotes.author: Thomas Tusser

quotes.text: Sometimes your best investments are the ones you don't make.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.text: A man in debt is so far a slave.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: So you think that money is the root of all evil. Have you ever asked what is the root of all money?
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.text: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
quotes.author: W. C. Fields

quotes.text: Greed is not a financial issue. It's a heart issue.
quotes.author: Andy Stanley

quotes.text: If I have enough money to eat I'm good.
quotes.author: Shia LaBeouf

quotes.text: There's no such thing as a free lunch.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.text: I am fiercely loyal to those willing to put their money where my mouth is.
quotes.author: Paul Harvey

quotes.text: If we command our wealth, we shall be rich and free; if our wealth commands us, we are poor indeed.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.text: Many people are in the dark when it comes to money, and I'm going to turn on the lights.
quotes.author: Suze Orman

quotes.text: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.text: Money is better than poverty, if only for financial reasons.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: My goal wasn't to make a ton of money. It was to build good computers.
quotes.author: Steve Wozniak

quotes.text: As human beings, we're very materialistic and have all this stuff - furs and cars and diamonds and money.
quotes.author: Smokey Robinson

quotes.text: Money can't buy love, but it improves your bargaining position.
quotes.author: Christopher Marlowe

quotes.text: It doesn't matter about money; having it, not having it. Or having clothes, or not having them. You're still left alone with yourself in the end.
quotes.author: Billy Idol

quotes.text: After a certain point, money is meaningless. It ceases to be the goal. The game is what counts.
quotes.author: Aristotle Onassis

quotes.text: Never confuse the size of your paycheck with the size of your talent.
quotes.author: Marlon Brando

quotes.text: In its famous paradox, the equation of money and excrement, psychoanalysis becomes the first science to state what common sense and the poets have long known - that the essence of money is in its absolute worthlessness.
quotes.author: Norman O. Brown

quotes.text: A man with money is no match against a man on a mission.
quotes.author: Doyle Brunson

quotes.text: Honesty is the best policy - when there is money in it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: Recession is when a neighbor loses his job. Depression is when you lose yours.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.text: Money: power at its most liquid.
quotes.author: Mason Cooley

quotes.text: The creditor hath a better memory than the debtor.
quotes.author: James Howell

quotes.text: All my life I knew that there was all the money you could want out there. All you have to do is go after it.
quotes.author: Curtis Carlson

quotes.text: Don't cry because it's over. Smile because it happened.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: When a father gives to his son, both laugh; when a son gives to his father, both cry.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry; to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: You left and I cried tears of blood. My sorrow grows. Its not just that You left. But when You left my eyes went with You. Now, how will I cry?
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all peoples cry, laugh, eat, worry, and die, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: If you laugh, you think, and you cry, that's a full day. That's a heck of a day. You do that seven days a week, you're going to have something special.
quotes.author: Jim Valvano

quotes.text: When peoples care for you and cry for you, they can straighten out your soul.
quotes.author: Langston Hughes

quotes.text: All the powers in the universe are already ours. It is we who have put our hands before our eyes and cry that it is dark.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.text: I cry for a lot of good things that happen. I cry a lot, okay?
quotes.author: Meghan Trainor

quotes.text: I cry all the time - at work, at the shrink's, with my lady. 'The Notebook' killed me. 'Up' destroyed me.
quotes.author: Chris Pine

quotes.text: I cry a lot when I feel empathy. I can feel heartbroken by life, and I cry quite easily, sometimes for no reason. It's healthy, I think.
quotes.author: Bat for Lashes

quotes.text: I was always a drama queen. I remember playing in the kitchen, trying to get my mom to think I was dead and call the police. When she didn't, I would cry. I was always theatrical. I don't think any of my relatives are surprised.
quotes.author: Amy Lee

quotes.text: When I have to cry, I think about my love life. When I have to laugh, I think about my love life.
quotes.author: Glenda Jackson

quotes.text: If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.text: The one thing that kept our family together was the music. The only thing that our family would share emotionally was to have our dad cry over something the kids did with music.
quotes.author: Dennis Wilson

quotes.text: If you cry over a guy, then your friends can't date him. It can't even be considered.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: My favorite movies are movies that I go in and I leave deeply affected. Whether I laugh really hard or whether I cry really hard, I just want to feel really affected in that moment.
quotes.author: Shailene Woodley

quotes.text: I love the theater as much as music, and the whole idea of getting across to an audience and making them laugh, making them cry - just making them feel - is paramount to me.
quotes.author: Stephen Sondheim

quotes.text: Nature says women are human beings, men have made religions to deny it. Nature says women are human beings, men cry out no!
quotes.author: Taslima Nasrin

quotes.text: Never cry over spilt milk, because it may have been poisoned.
quotes.author: W. C. Fields

quotes.text: I grew up with classical music when I was a ballet dancer. Now when I have to prepare an emotional scene, to cry or whatever, I listen to sonatas. Vivaldi and stuff. It's just beautiful to me.
quotes.author: Diane Kruger

quotes.text: My entire soul is a cry, and all my work is a commentary on that cry.
quotes.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quotes.text: When I got married in 1991, I had never been to a wedding, so I didn't know that my wedding was tacky. I didn't know that I was getting married in a quinceanera dress, because there was nobody there to cry over me and tell me I look like a fool.
quotes.author: Niecy Nash

quotes.text: I started playing poker in 2003 during my pregnancy, to distract myself from my awful morning sickness. For months all I did was cry and play Texas Hold'em.
quotes.author: Cheryl Hines

quotes.text: It's all about the director for me; we have to click. It's a trust thing. I'll say I'm ready to let down my walls. I'll cry for you as long as you need. But you're going to have to hug me afterwards.
quotes.author: Juno Temple

quotes.text: It is not whether you really cry. It's whether the audience thinks you are crying.
quotes.author: Ingrid Bergman

quotes.text: People have hearts, they have kids, they get jobs, they get sick, they cry, they dance. They live, they love, and they die. And that matters.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Warren

quotes.text: You only cry for help if you believe there is help to cry for.
quotes.author: Wentworth Miller

quotes.text: Sweat, sweat, sweat! Work and sweat, cry and sweat, pray and sweat!
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.text: I started rapping since, like, 14. But I've been obsessed with rap from when I was 11. I heard 'Baby Don't Cry,' I'll never forget.
quotes.author: Iggy Azalea

quotes.text: You can cry, ain't no shame in it.
quotes.author: Will Smith

quotes.text: Usually when people are sad, they don't do anything. They just cry over their condition. But when they get angry, they bring about a change.
quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

quotes.text: I keep reminding people that an editorial in rhyme is not a song. A good song makes you laugh, it makes you cry, it makes you think.
quotes.author: Pete Seeger

quotes.text: Listen to the cry of a woman in labor at the hour of giving birth - look at the dying man's struggle at his last extremity, and then tell me whether something that begins and ends thus could be intended for enjoyment.
quotes.author: Soren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: The Antichrist will be the infernal prince again for the third and last time... so many evils shall be committed by the means of Satan, the infernal Prince, that almost the entire world shall be found undone and desolate. Before these events happen, many rare birds will cry in the air, 'Now! Now!' and sometime later will vanish.
quotes.author: Nostradamus

quotes.text: It is women who love horror. Gloat over it. Feed on it. Are nourished by it. Shudder and cling and cry out-and come back for more.
quotes.author: Bela Lugosi

quotes.text: If you've got to my age, you've probably had your heart broken many times. So it's not that difficult to unpack a bit of grief from some little corner of your heart and cry over it.
quotes.author: Emma Thompson

quotes.text: Christmas carols always brought tears to my eyes. I also cry at weddings. I should have cried at a couple of my own.
quotes.author: Ethel Merman

quotes.text: Any beast can cry over the misfortunes of its own child. It takes a mensch to weep for others' children.
quotes.author: Sam Levenson

quotes.text: The dead cannot cry out for justice. It is a duty of the living to do so for them.
quotes.author: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.text: Make them laugh, make them cry, and hack to laughter. What do people go to the theatre for? An emotional exercise. I am a servant of the people. I have never forgotten that.
quotes.author: Mary Pickford

quotes.text: It opens the lungs, washes the countenance, exercises the eyes, and softens down the temper; so cry away.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Year after year, we see a new crop of musicians who do their best to look tough in lipstick and makeup. Maybe it's a cry for help, an admission of their strong feminine side, or the realization that they don't look so good any other way. Whatever the reason, makeup is as rock n' roll as a Marshall stack.
quotes.author: Shawn Amos

quotes.text: It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, more vengeance, more desolation. War is hell.
quotes.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quotes.text: I've always said it's interesting to watch devils cry when angels want to stab you in the back. I like that mixture.
quotes.author: Norman Reedus

quotes.text: I can see in your eyes, I can see in your faces, I can see you cry. But what I want to say, there's no reason to cry. Do not, in the name of peace, go in the streets and riot.
quotes.author: George Weah

quotes.text: Every third person in the world is a drama queen. And crying 'victim,' especially when you're not really a victim in any real way, feels good. It feels good to cry victim if you're not one.
quotes.author: John McWhorter

quotes.text: Nobody can make me cry in public. I'll punch them first before they make my mascara smear.
quotes.author: Sandra Bullock

quotes.text: Let others lead small lives, but not you. Let others argue over small things, but not you. Let others cry over small hurts, but not you. Let others leave their future in someone else's hands, but not you.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: I think what is British about me is my feelings and awareness of others and their situations. English people are always known to be well mannered and cold but we are not cold - we don't interfere in your situation. If we are heartbroken, we don't scream in your face with tears - we go home and cry on our own.
quotes.author: Michael Caine

quotes.text: I'd rather laugh with the sinners than cry with the saints - the sinners are much more fun.
quotes.author: Billy Joel

quotes.text: You cry and you scream and you stomp your feet and you shout. You say, 'You know what? I'm giving up, I don't care.' And then you go to bed and you wake up and it's a brand new day, and you pick yourself back up again.
quotes.author: Nicole Scherzinger

quotes.text: And I have to work so hard at talking positively to myself. If I don't, it's just real hard to get through the day, and I'll get really down, and just want to cry. My whole body language changes. I get more slumped over.
quotes.author: Delta Burke

quotes.text: Every renaissance comes to the world with a cry, the cry of the human spirit to be free.
quotes.author: Anne Sullivan

quotes.text: I cry out for order and find it only in art.
quotes.author: Helen Hayes

quotes.text: We need international support so that our people live a life of normality, of dignity, of liberty and freedom. I hope that our cry for freedom may be heard.
quotes.author: Mahmoud Abbas

quotes.text: Truth is the cry of all, but the game of few.
quotes.author: George Berkeley

quotes.text: Making children cry for a photographer can be considered mean. But I would say that making children laugh and show off their jeans for an apparel ad is just as exploitative and less natural. Toddlers' natural state, like, 30 percent of the time, is crying, and it doesn't indicate pain or suffering.
quotes.author: Jill Greenberg

quotes.text: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: Now I will say this to every sinner, though he should think himself to be the worst sinner who ever lived: cry to the Lord and seek Him while He may be found. A throne of grace is a place fitted for you. By simple faith, go to your Savior, for He is the throne of grace.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.text: The key is to get to know people and trust them to be who they are. Instead, we trust people to be who we want them to be - and when they're not, we cry.
quotes.author: David Duchovny

quotes.text: And I remember going to the record studio and there was a park across the street and I'd see all the children playing and I would cry because it would make me sad that I would have to work instead.
quotes.author: Michael Jackson

quotes.text: Nobody deserves your tears, but whoever deserves them will not make you cry.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quotes.text: When we are born we cry that we are come to this great stage of fools.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: I'm very sensitive and I'm quite a soft person, and I cry a lot when things upset me.
quotes.author: Leona Lewis

quotes.text: I think when the full horror of being fifty hits you, you should stay home and have a good cry.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.text: I don't like looking back. I'm always constantly looking forward. I'm not the one to sort of sit and cry over spilt milk. I'm too busy looking for the next cow.
quotes.author: Gordon Ramsay

quotes.text: Beware of men who cry. It's true that men who cry are sensitive to and in touch with feelings, but the only feelings they tend to be sensitive to and in touch with are their own.
quotes.author: Nora Ephron

quotes.text: Young people can be disruptive and screw up classes. But even if they are being a pain in the arse it's a cry for help - they don't feel like they are being listened to.
quotes.author: Jamie Oliver

quotes.text: Whenever death may surprise us, let it be welcome if our battle cry has reached even one receptive ear and another hand reaches out to take up our arms.
quotes.author: Che Guevara

quotes.text: If I cry, it's because I'm very angry and I can't do anything about it because I've run into a dead end. That's when the tears would come down.
quotes.author: Rihanna

quotes.text: I am tired and sick of war. Its glory is all moonshine. It is only those who have neither fired a shot nor heard the shrieks and groans of the wounded who cry aloud for blood, for vengeance, for desolation. War is hell.
quotes.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quotes.text: You'll never have any trouble with Mr. T, I'm just a big, calm teddy bear kind of guy. Mr. T ain't ashamed to cry. When I go out and I meet people who are suffering and they come and talk to me, Mr. T cries, Mr. T who could break a man's jaw with his fist.
quotes.author: Mr. T

quotes.text: I'm worth more dead than alive. Don't cry for me after I'm gone; cry for me now.
quotes.author: Marlene Dietrich

quotes.text: I had a few dating disasters along the way with girls cheating on me. One girl was the inspiration for me singing 'Cry Me A River' on 'The X Factor.' That was my payback to her because she was unfaithful.
quotes.author: Liam Payne

quotes.text: I can't hurt any more than I've been hurt, I can't cry any more than I've cried. I've been to the highest of highs and lowest of lows, so one day I'm going to find my middle ground and be happy.
quotes.author: Cheryl Cole

quotes.text: Somebody help me, tell me where to go from here cause even Thugs cry, but do the Lord care?
quotes.author: Tupac Shakur

quotes.text: When kids hit one year old, it's like hanging out with a miniature drunk. You have to hold onto them. They bump into things. They laugh and cry. They urinate. They vomit.
quotes.author: Johnny Depp

quotes.text: Nature never said to me: Do not be poor; still less did she say: Be rich; her cry to me was always: Be independent.
quotes.author: Nicolas Chamfort

quotes.text: Instead of getting hard ourselves and trying to compete, women should try and give their best qualities to men - bring them softness, teach them how to cry.
quotes.author: Joan Baez

quotes.text: Some days are just bad days, that's all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day, that's just the way it is!
quotes.author: Dita Von Teese

quotes.text: Tears come from the heart and not from the brain.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.text: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not wear it on their sleeves, but it's there if you look deep.
quotes.author: Taraji P. Henson

quotes.text: The word 'happiness' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: To have felt too much is to end in feeling nothing.
quotes.author: Dorothy Thompson

quotes.text: There is a sacredness in tears. They are not the mark of weakness, but of power. They speak more eloquently than ten thousand tongues. They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition, and of unspeakable love.
quotes.author: Washington Irving

quotes.text: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger, rage, fear, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.
quotes.author: Kevin Bacon

quotes.text: Nothing is more sad than the death of an illusion.
quotes.author: Arthur Koestler

quotes.text: First, accept sadness. Realize that without losing, winning isn't so great.
quotes.author: Alyssa Milano

quotes.text: Make the most of your regrets; never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Affliction comes to us, not to make us sad but sober; not to make us sorry but wise.
quotes.author: H. G. Wells

quotes.text: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: There is no sadder sight than a young pessimist.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: We never taste a perfect joy; our happiest successes are mixed with sadness.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille

quotes.text: You left and I cried tears of blood. My sorrow grows. Its not just that You left. But when You left my eyes went with You. Now, how will I cry?
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: Crying is cleansing. There's a reason for tears, happiness or sadness.
quotes.author: Dionne Warwick

quotes.text: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.text: It is sadder to find the past again and find it inadequate to the present than it is to have it elude you and remain forever a harmonious conception of memory.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.text: Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.
quotes.author: Franz Schubert

quotes.text: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: Dying is only one thing to be sad over... Living unhappily is something else.
quotes.author: Morrie Schwartz

quotes.text: The rose and the thorn, and sorrow and gladness are linked together.
quotes.author: Saadi

quotes.text: Experiencing sadness and anger can make you feel more creative, and by being creative, you can get beyond your pain or negativity.
quotes.author: Yoko Ono

quotes.text: If my world were to cave in tomorrow, I would look back on all the pleasures, excitements and worthwhilenesses I have been lucky enough to have had. Not the sadness, not my miscarriages or my father leaving home, but the joy of everything else. It will have been enough.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.text: You get used to sadness, growing up in the mountains, I guess.
quotes.author: Loretta Lynn

quotes.text: Sorrows are like thunderclouds, in the distance they look black, over our heads scarcely gray.
quotes.author: Jean Paul

quotes.text: A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
quotes.author: Jean Racine

quotes.text: It's a sad man my friend who's livin' in his own skin and can't stand the company.
quotes.author: Bruce Springsteen

quotes.text: I do believe that if you haven't learnt about sadness, you cannot appreciate happiness.
quotes.author: Nana Mouskouri

quotes.text: When sparrows build and the leaves break forth, My old sorrow wakes and cries.
quotes.author: Jean Ingelow

quotes.text: Melancholy and sadness are the start of doubt... doubt is the beginning of despair; despair is the cruel beginning of the differing degrees of wickedness.
quotes.author: Comte de Lautreamont

quotes.text: When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.text: Sadness is a super important thing not to be ashamed about but to include in our lives. One of the bigger problems with sadness or depression is there's so much shame around it. If you have it you're a failure. You are felt as being very unattractive.
quotes.author: Mike Mills

quotes.text: Those who don't know how to weep with their whole heart, don't know how to laugh either.
quotes.author: Golda Meir

quotes.text: The tragedy of life is in what dies inside a man while he lives - the death of genuine feeling, the death of inspired response, the awareness that makes it possible to feel the pain or the glory of other men in yourself.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.text: Actually, the moment of victory is wonderful, but also sad. It means that your trip is ended.
quotes.author: Bill Toomey

quotes.text: Do not make best friends with a melancholy sad soul. They always are heavily loaded, and you must bear half.
quotes.author: Francois Fenelon

quotes.text: I've cried, and you'd think I'd be better for it, but the sadness just sleeps, and it stays in my spine the rest of my life.
quotes.author: Conor Oberst

quotes.text: They say it's better to bury your sadness in a graveyard or garden that waits for the spring to wake from its sleep and burst into green.
quotes.author: Conor Oberst

quotes.text: Why does the rest of the world put up with the hypocrisy, the need to put a happy face on sorrow, the need to keep on keeping on?... I don't know the answer, I know only that I can't.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quotes.text: We look before and after, And pine for what is not; Our sincerest laughter With some pain is fraught; Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: The sad truth is that most evil is done by people who never make up their minds to be good or evil.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.text: The excursion is the same when you go looking for your sorrow as when you go looking for your joy.
quotes.author: Eudora Welty

quotes.text: Isn't it sad to go to your grave without ever wondering why you were born? Who, with such a thought, would not spring from bed, eager to resume discovering the world and rejoicing to be part of it?
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.text: I seldom think about my limitations, and they never make me sad. Perhaps there is just a touch of yearning at times; but it is vague, like a breeze among flowers.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: My parents' divorce left me with a lot of sadness and pain and acting, and especially humour, was my way of dealing with all that.
quotes.author: Jennifer Aniston

quotes.text: In deep sadness there is no place for sentimentality.
quotes.author: William S. Burroughs

quotes.text: It is one of the most saddening things in life that, try as we may, we can never be certain of making people happy, whereas we can almost always be certain of making them unhappy.
quotes.author: Thomas Huxley

quotes.text: And I remember going to the record studio and there was a park across the street and I'd see all the children playing and I would cry because it would make me sad that I would have to work instead.
quotes.author: Michael Jackson

quotes.text: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
quotes.author: Jean de La Fontaine

quotes.text: I love my past, I love my present. I am not ashamed of what I have had, and I am not sad because I no longer have it.
quotes.author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

quotes.text: I had sadness for breakfast.
quotes.author: Andy Milonakis

quotes.text: Depression is the inability to construct a future.
quotes.author: Rollo May

quotes.text: For all sad words of tongue and pen, The saddest are these, 'It might have been'.
quotes.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quotes.text: Red is the ultimate cure for sadness.
quotes.author: Bill Blass

quotes.text: Tears are the summer showers to the soul.
quotes.author: Alfred Austin

quotes.text: If we could read the secret history of our enemies we should find in each man's life sorrow and suffering enough to disarm all hostility.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.text: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.text: One should either be sad or joyful. Contentment is a warm sty for eaters and sleepers.
quotes.author: Eugene O'Neill

quotes.text: When I seemed to be irritable or sad, my father would quote the learned Dr. Knight, and then say, 'Just go to sleep.' Like all smart aleck kids, I thought the advice was silly. But as I've grown older, I've realized just how smart Knight was.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.text: It doesn't hurt to feel sad from time to time.
quotes.author: Willie Nelson

quotes.text: If you don't know about pain and trouble, you're in sad shape. They make you appreciate life.
quotes.author: Evel Knievel

quotes.text: A teardrop on earth summons the King of heaven.
quotes.author: Charles R. Swindoll

quotes.text: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
quotes.author: Emily Bronte

quotes.text: Above all things let us never forget that mankind constitutes one great brotherhood; all born to encounter suffering and sorrow, and therefore bound to sympathize with each other.
quotes.author: Albert Pike

quotes.text: Oh, I am very weary, Though tears no longer flow; My eyes are tired of weeping, My heart is sick of woe.
quotes.author: Anne Bronte

quotes.text: Sadness is also a kind of defence.
quotes.author: Ivo Andric

quotes.text: Good humor is the health of the soul, sadness is its poison.
quotes.author: Philip Stanhope, 4th Earl of Chesterfield

quotes.text: We never taste happiness in perfection, our most fortunate successes are mixed with sadness.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille

quotes.text: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth, but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.text: The reason for the sadness of this modern age and the men who live in it is that it looks for the truth in everything and finds it.
quotes.author: Edmond de Goncourt

quotes.text: Every life has a measure of sorrow, and sometimes this is what awakens us.
quotes.author: Steven Tyler

quotes.text: One must not let oneself be overwhelmed by sadness.
quotes.author: Jackie Kennedy

quotes.text: Delicious tears! The heart's own dew.
quotes.author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quotes.text: Fear keeps us focused on the past or worried about the future. If we can acknowledge our fear, we can realize that right now we are okay. Right now, today, we are still alive, and our bodies are working marvelously. Our eyes can still see the beautiful sky. Our ears can still hear the voices of our loved ones.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu

quotes.text: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.
quotes.author: Dorothy Thompson

quotes.text: Fear stifles our thinking and actions. It creates indecisiveness that results in stagnation. I have known talented people who procrastinate indefinitely rather than risk failure. Lost opportunities cause erosion of confidence, and the downward spiral begins.
quotes.author: Charles Stanley

quotes.text: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.
quotes.author: H. P. Lovecraft

quotes.text: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.
quotes.author: Marilyn Ferguson

quotes.text: Thinking will not overcome fear but action will.
quotes.author: W. Clement Stone

quotes.text: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
quotes.author: Salvador Dali

quotes.text: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.text: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just; that his justice cannot sleep forever.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: My 'fear' is my substance, and probably the best part of me.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
quotes.author: Paul Sweeney

quotes.text: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his great surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't do.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: Tell us your phobias and we will tell you what you are afraid of.
quotes.author: Robert Benchley

quotes.text: What is needed, rather than running away or controlling or suppressing or any other resistance, is understanding fear; that means, watch it, learn about it, come directly into contact with it. We are to learn about fear, not how to escape from it.
quotes.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quotes.text: I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.text: Fear is the mother of foresight.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.text: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.text: Boldness is a mask for fear, however great.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.text: I may be compelled to face danger, but never fear it, and while our soldiers can stand and fight, I can stand and feed and nurse them.
quotes.author: Clara Barton

quotes.text: To pity distress is but human; to relieve it is Godlike.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.text: One had to take some action against fear when once it laid hold of one.
quotes.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quotes.text: A person's fears are lighter when the danger is at hand.
quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.text: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear; knowing what must be done does away with fear.
quotes.author: Rosa Parks

quotes.text: To fight fear, act. To increase fear - wait, put off postpone.
quotes.author: David Joseph Schwartz

quotes.text: We fear violence less than our own feelings. Personal, private, solitary pain is more terrifying than what anyone else can inflict.
quotes.author: Jim Morrison

quotes.text: I hasten to laugh at everything, for fear of being obliged to weep.
quotes.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

quotes.text: There are very few monsters who warrant the fear we have of them.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.text: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: I say I am stronger than fear.
quotes.author: Malala Yousafzai

quotes.text: I'm not at the point where I'd feel safe in a house alone. I would be really scared. I'm the kind of person that when I get up to go use the bathroom I have this big long hallway, and I just know someone's going to jump out and get me.
quotes.author: Britney Spears

quotes.text: We fear the thing we want the most.
quotes.author: Robert Anthony

quotes.text: There is no such thing as paranoia. Your worst fears can come true at any moment.
quotes.author: Hunter S. Thompson

quotes.text: If you let your fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct, your life will be safe, expedient and thin.
quotes.author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

quotes.text: So then learn to conquer your fear. This is the only art we have to master nowadays: to look at things without fear, and to fearlessly do right.
quotes.author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quotes.text: We should not fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future; men of discernment deal only with the present moment.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.text: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
quotes.author: Olive Schreiner

quotes.text: What is a fear of living? It's being preeminently afraid of dying. It is not doing what you came here to do, out of timidity and spinelessness. The antidote is to take full responsibility for yourself - for the time you take up and the space you occupy. If you don't know what you're here to do, then just do some good.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Having a child, that's always been my biggest fear. I want a child and I fear a child.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: Love is what we were born with. Fear is what we learned here.
quotes.author: Marianne Williamson

quotes.text: True nobility is exempt from fear.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.text: We simply attempt to be fearful when others are greedy and to be greedy only when others are fearful.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.text: Pick the day. Enjoy it - to the hilt. The day as it comes. People as they come... The past, I think, has helped me appreciate the present - and I don't want to spoil any of it by fretting about the future.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: To him who is in fear everything rustles.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: We lavish on animals the love we are afraid to show to people. They might not return it; or worse, they might.
quotes.author: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.text: The pleasures of love are always in proportion to our fears.
quotes.author: Stendhal

quotes.text: You are only afraid if you are not in harmony with yourself. People are afraid because they have never owned up to themselves.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

quotes.text: We should not be afraid to go into a new era, to leave the old beyond.
quotes.author: Zack Wamp

quotes.text: Sleep makes people calmer, more alert, less fearful - just plain happier, or so I see around me and in me. I am sure that if this great nation were to concentrate on getting more sleep, we would be a happier, more confident people, and that by itself would be a major achievement.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.text: There are things which a man is afraid to tell even to himself, and every decent man has a number of such things stored away in his mind.
quotes.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quotes.text: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.text: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.text: And the things that we fear are a weapon to be held against us.
quotes.author: Ian Rush

quotes.text: We consume our tomorrows fretting about our yesterdays.
quotes.author: Persius

quotes.text: Never be afraid to sit a while and think.
quotes.author: Lorraine Hansberry

quotes.text: Fear can be good when you're walking past an alley at night or when you need to check the locks on your doors before you go to bed, but it's not good when you have a goal and you're fearful of obstacles. We often get trapped by our fears, but anyone who has had success has failed before.
quotes.author: Queen Latifah

quotes.text: That man is prudent who neither hopes nor fears anything from the uncertain events of the future.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.text: I think fearless is having fears but jumping anyway.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: We are afraid of the enormity of the possible.
quotes.author: Emile M. Cioran

quotes.text: A lot of people live in fear because they haven't figured out how you're going to react when faced with a certain set of circumstances. I've come to terms with this by looking deeply into whatever makes me fearful - what are the key elements that get the hairs up on the back of my neck - and then figuring out what I can do about it.
quotes.author: Chris Hadfield

quotes.text: Some movie stars wear their sunglasses even in church. They're afraid God might recognize them and ask for autographs.
quotes.author: Fred Allen

quotes.text: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
quotes.author: Charles Kennedy

quotes.text: There are times when fear is good. It must keep its watchful place at the heart's controls.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.text: Hate is the consequence of fear; we fear something before we hate it; a child who fears noises becomes a man who hates noise.
quotes.author: Cyril Connolly

quotes.text: Prosperity is not without many fears and distastes; adversity not without many comforts and hopes.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Do what you fear and fear disappears.
quotes.author: David Joseph Schwartz

quotes.text: This is all you have. This is not a dry run. This is your life. If you want to fritter it away with your fears, then you will fritter it away, but you won't get it back later.
quotes.author: Laura Schlessinger

quotes.text: He will never have true friends who is afraid of making enemies.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.text: Grief has limits, whereas apprehension has none. For we grieve only for what we know has happened, but we fear all that possibly may happen.
quotes.author: Pliny the Elder

quotes.text: There is no passion so contagious as that of fear.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.text: Nothing gives a fearful man more courage than another's fear.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: Humble souls are fearful of their own strength.
quotes.author: William Gurnall

quotes.text: Always do what you are afraid to do.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The fear of becoming a 'has-been' keeps some people from becoming anything.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.text: I'm different, and my manner invites questions. I'm never afraid to answer.
quotes.author: Marlee Matlin

quotes.text: Roses are red, violets are blue, I'm schizophrenic, and so am I.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.text: America's veterans and troops serving abroad today fought hard to preserve our red, white and blue, from the Revolutionary War to today's Global War Against Terrorism, and Congress' action today is appropriate for one of our most sacred symbols.
quotes.author: Bill Shuster

quotes.text: When you look at the light bulb above you, you remember Thomas Alva Edison. When the telephone bell rings, you remember Alexander Graham Bell. Marie Curie was the first woman to win the Nobel Prize. When you see the blue sky, you think of Sir C.V. Raman.
quotes.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.text: If you're white and you're wrong, then you're wrong; if you're black and you're wrong, you're wrong. People are people. Black, blue, pink, green - God make no rules about color; only society make rules where my people suffer, and that why we must have redemption and redemption now.
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.text: One night, I lay awake for hours, just terrified. When the dawn finally came up - the comfortable blue sky, the familiar world returning - I could think of no other way to express my relief than through poetry. I made a decision there and then that it was what I wanted to do. Every time I pulled a wishbone, it was what I asked for.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: Cultures have long heard wisdom in non-human voices: Apollo, god of music, medicine and knowledge, came to Delphi in the form of a dolphin. But dolphins, which fill the oceans with blipping and chirping, and whales, which mew and caw in ultramarine jazz - a true rhapsody in blue - are hunted to the edge of silence.
quotes.author: Jay Griffiths

quotes.text: The Left despises Texas, with its stellar record of job growth; Texas, with its strong support for traditional marriage and the sanctity of life; Texas, the root of the conservative tree. Should the Left succeed in its attempt to turn Texas purple, America could turn permanently blue.
quotes.author: Ben Shapiro

quotes.text: There is no blue without yellow and without orange.
quotes.author: Vincent Van Gogh

quotes.text: I wish I had invented blue jeans. They have expression, modesty, sex appeal, simplicity - all I hope for in my clothes.
quotes.author: Yves Saint Laurent

quotes.text: I grew up in a predominantly Caucasian community, and most of my friends had blonde hair and blue eyes. So I was always straightening my hair, wearing colored contacts, and I never tanned, if I could help it.
quotes.author: Shay Mitchell

quotes.text: I like Dolce & Gabbana's fragrance Light Blue - it's my everyday perfume.
quotes.author: Natasha Poly

quotes.text: It suddenly struck me that that tiny pea, pretty and blue, was the Earth. I put up my thumb and shut one eye, and my thumb blotted out the planet Earth. I didn't feel like a giant. I felt very, very small.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: I don't know what my appeal is. I can see I've got blue eyes and don't look like the Hunchback of Notre Dame but I can't understand the fuss.
quotes.author: Rutger Hauer

quotes.text: I used to play too with a boy who played a saxophone. We didn't play no blues, we'd play a lot of love songs - 'Stardust', 'Blue Moon', 'Out Cold Again', 'Sophisticated Lady', 'Stars Fell On Alabama', a lot of different stuff.
quotes.author: David Edwards

quotes.text: When I look up and see the sun shining on the patch of white clouds up in the blue, I begin to think how it would feel to be up somewhere above it winging swiftly thought the clear air, watching the earth below, and the men on it, no bigger than ants.
quotes.author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quotes.text: I always had influences musically with punk, and then growing up, I dyed my hair every color. I did the dip-dye blue, before anybody was dip-dyeing their hair. And streaks of pinks and purples and whatnot.
quotes.author: Leigh Lezark

quotes.text: I wear black because I'm comfortable in it. But then in the summertime when it's hot I'm comfortable in light blue.
quotes.author: Johnny Cash

quotes.text: I looked along the San Juan Islands and the coast of California, but I couldn't find the palette of green, granite, and dark blue that you can only find in Maine.
quotes.author: Parker Stevenson

quotes.text: For my birthday this year, my girlfriends - who knew I'd just inherited my dad's turntable - gave me a carton of albums like 'Blue Kentucky Girl,' by Emmylou Harris, and 'Off the Wall,' by Michael Jackson. It's all stuff we grew up with. I mean, you can't have a music collection without Prince's 'Purple Rain' - it just can't be done!
quotes.author: Connie Britton

quotes.text: Visualize this thing that you want, see it, feel it, believe in it. Make your mental blue print, and begin to build.
quotes.author: Robert Collier

quotes.text: Blue is the male principle, stern and spiritual. Yellow the female principle, gentle, cheerful and sensual. Red is matter, brutal and heavy and always the colour which must be fought and vanquished by the other two.
quotes.author: Franz Marc

quotes.text: Whenever I gaze up at the moon, I feel like I'm on a time machine. I am back to that precious pinpoint of time, standing on the foreboding - yet beautiful - Sea of Tranquility. I could see our shining blue planet Earth poised in the darkness of space.
quotes.author: Buzz Aldrin

quotes.text: A quintessential experience is to raft the Rio Grande through the Blue Mountains, stopping off at waterfalls and having picnics of barbecued fish.
quotes.author: Ben Elliot

quotes.text: Postwar America was a very buttoned-up nation. Radio shows were run by censors, Presidents wore hats, ladies wore girdles. We came straight out of the blue - nobody was expecting anything like Martin and Lewis. A sexy guy and a monkey is how some people saw us.
quotes.author: Jerry Lewis

quotes.text: You can tell it's good if you light it and a blue flame comes up; that means it's good moonshine and it won't make you go blind.
quotes.author: Johnny Knoxville

quotes.text: Another thing that I don't like to do is show too much how it goes. I do it once in a blue moon. Sometimes there are lessons when I don't pick up a violin at all.
quotes.author: Itzhak Perlman

quotes.text: Only peril can bring the French together. One can't impose unity out of the blue on a country that has 265 different kinds of cheese.
quotes.author: Charles de Gaulle

quotes.text: I'm a wonderful editor. That's what I do best. I know exactly what I want. If I have to decide whether to wear the red dress or the blue dress or what should I have said, I am constantly changing my mind.
quotes.author: Barbara Walters

quotes.text: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.
quotes.author: e. e. cummings

quotes.text: Eric Schmidt looks innocent enough, with his watercolor blue eyes and his tiny office full of toys and his Google campus stocked with volleyball courts and unlocked bikes and wheat-grass shots and cereal dispensers and Haribo Gummi Bears and heated toilet seats and herb gardens and parking lots with cords hanging to plug in electric cars.
quotes.author: Maureen Dowd

quotes.text: I think as a Canadian hockey player, you go through it in your mind so many times, being able to stand on that blue line and hear your national anthem play and being a gold medal champion, you dream of that. And then to be able to accomplish that and actually win a gold medal and represent your country its an amazing feeling.
quotes.author: Sidney Crosby

quotes.text: And, for an instant, she stared directly into those soft blue eyes and knew, with an instinctive mammalian certainty, that the exceedingly rich were no longer even remotely human.
quotes.author: William Gibson

quotes.text: My father worked in the Post Office. A lot of double shifts. All his friends were in the same situation - truck drivers, taxi cab drivers, grocery clerks. Blue collar guys punching the clock and working long, hard hours. The thought that sustained them was the one at the center of the American dream.
quotes.author: Gary David Goldberg

quotes.text: My English was limited to vacationing and not really engaging with Americans. I knew 'shopping' and 'eating' English - I could say 'blue sweater,' 'creme brulee,' and 'Caesar salad,' - so I came here thinking I spoke English.
quotes.author: Salma Hayek

quotes.text: I will try to cram these paragraphs full of facts and give them a weight and shape no greater than that of a cloud of blue butterflies.
quotes.author: Brendan Gill

quotes.text: It's important to slow down, every now and then, for no other reason than to call someone to say 'Hi.' It doesn't have to be a long conversation. Just calling out of the blue does more to let someone know you still care about them than nearly anything else.
quotes.author: Simon Sinek

quotes.text: Our work for human dignity is often lonely, and almost always an uphill climb. At times, our efforts are misunderstood, and we are mistaken for the enemy. There has been a clear erosion of respect for U.N. blue and our impartiality.
quotes.author: Ban Ki-moon

quotes.text: You might be a redneck if... the blue book value of your truck goes up and down depending on how much gas it has in it.
quotes.author: Jeff Foxworthy

quotes.text: I often think to myself, at the end of an interesting life it's maybe not such a bad thing to spend your last days with your friends sitting by the blue, blue ocean reliving the story of your life while sitting in the dangerous sun.
quotes.author: Baz Luhrmann

quotes.text: Sun-bleached bones were most wonderful against the blue - that blue that will always be there as it is now after all man's destruction is finished.
quotes.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quotes.text: Tall, sandy blonde, with sort of blue eyes, skinny in places, fat in others. An average gal.
quotes.author: Uma Thurman

quotes.text: The old cathedrals are good, but the great blue dome that hangs over everything is better.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.text: Since the 1960s, mainstream media has searched out and co-opted the most authentic things it could find in youth culture, whether that was psychedelic culture, anti-war culture, blue jeans culture. Eventually heavy metal culture, rap culture, electronica - they'll look for it and then market it back to kids at the mall.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: I think I have something tonight that's not quite correct for evening wear. Blue suede shoes.
quotes.author: Elvis Presley

quotes.text: Fashion is mysterious, as a rule. Why are blue jeans a classic? You just hit on something that happens to be timeless and right.
quotes.author: Diane von Furstenberg

quotes.text: The whole world loves American movies, blue jeans, jazz and rock and roll. It is probably a better way to get to know our country than by what politicians or airline commercials represent.
quotes.author: Billy Joel

quotes.text: When you love a man, he becomes more than a body. His physical limbs expand, and his outline recedes, vanishes. He is rich and sweet and right. He is part of the world, the atmosphere, the blue sky and the blue water.
quotes.author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quotes.text: I'm married to a white man, and then my daughter came out looking like the whitest white child with blonde hair and blue eyes. And I'm like, 'Omigosh, now what am I going to do?' She has my mom's features and is lighter than my husband. And my boy is browner than I am. Brown eyes and really tan.
quotes.author: Karyn Parsons

quotes.text: All the armies of Europe, Asia and Africa combined, with all the treasure of the earth (our own excepted) in their military chest; with a Buonaparte for a commander, could not by force, take a drink from the Ohio, or make a track on the Blue Ridge, in a trial of a thousand years.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Growing up, I watched softball and U.S.A .softball, and that was my goal of being able to represent my country and wear the red, white, and blue out there, and I think it is one of the highest honors to be able to go out there and compete for your country, and it was something so very special, and it was everything I dreamt of and more.
quotes.author: Jennie Finch

quotes.text: The deeper the blue becomes, the more strongly it calls man towards the infinite, awakening in him a desire for the pure and, finally, for the supernatural... The brighter it becomes, the more it loses its sound, until it turns into silent stillness and becomes white.
quotes.author: Wassily Kandinsky

quotes.text: To see the earth as it truly is, small and blue in that eternal silence where it floats, is to see riders on the earth together, brothers on that bright loveliness in the eternal cold - brothers who know now they are truly brothers.
quotes.author: Archibald MacLeish

quotes.text: Blue jeans are the most beautiful things since the gondola.
quotes.author: Diana Vreeland

quotes.text: Life has loveliness to sell, all beautiful and splendid things, blue waves whitened on a cliff, soaring fire that sways and sings, and children's faces looking up, holding wonder like a cup.
quotes.author: Sara Teasdale

quotes.text: All through my life, I didn't really consider my eyes at all, and then I became an actress. It's great, I guess. They're just in my face, and one is green and one is blue. It's different, and I'm definitely a proponent of being different in any way you can in life, so I guess if you're born a bit different that's a good thing.
quotes.author: Alice Eve

quotes.text: If the sight of the blue skies fills you with joy, if a blade of grass springing up in the fields has power to move you, if the simple things of nature have a message that you understand, rejoice, for your soul is alive.
quotes.author: Eleonora Duse

quotes.text: Whenever I feel blue, I start breathing again.
quotes.author: L. Frank Baum

quotes.text: I live for those who love me, for those who know me true, for the heaven so blue above me, and the good that I can do.
quotes.author: George Linnaeus Banks

quotes.text: We worship an awesome God in the Blue States, and we don't like federal agents poking around our libraries in the Red States. We coach Little League in the Blue States and have gay friends in the Red States.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: Blue, green, grey, white, or black; smooth, ruffled, or mountainous; that ocean is not silent.
quotes.author: H. P. Lovecraft

quotes.text: Dark economic clouds are dissipating into an emerging blue sky of opportunity.
quotes.author: Rick Perry

quotes.text: No water, no life. No blue, no green.
quotes.author: Sylvia Earle

quotes.text: I was on the beach every summer. That was the pleasant part of my childhood because we were right by the sea. We'd take a picnic, and I'd spend hours in the water until I turned blue. You couldn't get me out of there.
quotes.author: Olga Kurylenko

quotes.text: As my mind can conceive of more good, the barriers and blocks dissolve. My life becomes full of little miracles popping up out of the blue.
quotes.author: Louise L. Hay

quotes.text: I'll never throw away my blue jeans.
quotes.author: Susan Ford

quotes.text: Good things are associated with blue, like clear days, more than singing the blues. Just the word 'blue' in the singular is full of optimism and positive connotation to most people.
quotes.author: David Carson

quotes.text: I would wear the blue overalls of the fieldworker and often wore round, rimless glasses known as Mazzawati teaglasses. I had a car, and I wore a chauffeur's cap with my overalls. The pose of chauffeur was convenient because I could travel under the pretext of driving my master's car.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: From the political angle, I'm trying to be apolitical if you will. I mean people say, 'Are you a red state or blue state?', I say, 'I'm purple.' I think there are great ideas on both sides of the aisle and neither side has cornered the market.
quotes.author: Brad Thor

quotes.text: Not a breath of air stirred over the free and open prairie; the clouds were like light piles of cotton; and where the blue sky was visible, it wore a hazy and languid aspect.
quotes.author: Francis Parkman

quotes.text: When you're in a fighter jet and there's a dark layer of clouds with just one blue hole with the sun going through it, you shoot for that hole. You go vertical into the light, and suddenly, instead of gray and dark, it's light and blue. You are totally connected with the elements. You are in another world.
quotes.author: Yves Rossy

quotes.text: If you're feeling blue, lock yourself in a room, stand in front of a mirror, and dance - and laugh at yourself and be sexy. Dance the silliest and ugliest you've ever danced. Make fun of yourself and try to recover your sense of humor.
quotes.author: Salma Hayek

quotes.text: When people are infected by my charm, they don't see my size. My piercing deep blue eyes are distracting.
quotes.author: Peter Dinklage

quotes.text: Why is it that scuba divers and surfers are some of the strongest advocates of ocean conservation? Because they've spent time in and around the ocean, and they've personally seen the beauty, the fragility, and even the degradation of our planet's blue heart.
quotes.author: Sylvia Earle

quotes.text: My dream date is a tall, dark, handsome, blue eyed man with a bubble butt who will whisk me away to Paris in a hot air balloon to wine me, dine me and.
quotes.author: Karen McDougal

quotes.text: A voyage to Europe in the summer of 1921 gave me the first opportunity of observing the wonderful blue opalescence of the Mediterranean Sea. It seemed not unlikely that the phenomenon owed its origin to the scattering of sunlight by the molecules of the water.
quotes.author: C. V. Raman

quotes.text: I wanted to write a book that talked about the emotions of children, which is the rainbow. We all have moods. We talk about being blue when we're sad, and being yellow when we're cowards, and when we're mad, we're red.
quotes.author: Dolly Parton

quotes.text: I'm in love with red. I think it's such a passionate color. Every flag of every country pretty much has red it it. It's power, there's no fence sitting with red. Either you love it or you don't. I think its blood and strength and life. I do love red. I love all colors. Great shades of blue, you find them in nature. They're all magic.
quotes.author: Bryan Batt

quotes.text: I love life. There's so much to learn and see all the time, and nothing nicer for me than to wake up, and the sky is blue.
quotes.author: Pattie Boyd

quotes.text: I wouldn't call myself a synaesthete in the sense that Nabokov was. But I'll talk about a sound as being cold blue or dark brown. For descriptive purposes, yes, I often see colors when I'm listening to music and think, 'Oh, there's not enough sort of yellowy stuff in here, or not enough white.'
quotes.author: Brian Eno

quotes.text: My mother and I were born in Mieres, Asturias, the most beautiful region you'll ever see in Europe and the home of Cabrales, a great blue cheese made in the Asturian mountains.
