quotes.text: Before he went to sleep, I told him a little story about a rabbit we saw run around the beach house we rented.
quotes.author: Dick Bruna

quotes.text: I'm going to do whatever interests me. Look, writing 'Rabbit Hole' came out of an interest in diversifying my portfolio, frankly.
quotes.author: David Lindsay-Abaire

quotes.text: The car is not a rabbit or a deer that jumps around in sweeping lines, but it is a man-made work of technology in need of an appropriate roadway.
quotes.author: Fritz Todt

quotes.text: When you don't have kids and you're in a Catholic family - one of my sisters had 10 children in 11 years - she's part rabbit - you feel kind of guilty about that. So, I want to do things for other people's children.
quotes.author: Marge Schott

quotes.text: From reading over the notes for each session it was apparent that there had been improvement by more or less regular steps from almost complete terror at sight of the rabbit to a completely positive response with no signs of disturbance.
quotes.author: Mary C. Jones

quotes.text: From the test situations which were used to reveal fears, it was found that Peter showed even more marked fear responses to the rabbit than to the rat.
quotes.author: Mary C. Jones

quotes.text: New situations requiring closer contact with the rabbit had been gradually introduced and the degree to which these situations were avoided, tolerated, or welcomed, at each experimental session, gave the measure of improvement.
quotes.author: Mary C. Jones

quotes.text: I don't really know the story of the Pied Piper. I don't read stories, first of all. I just remember either a rabbit or a rat leading people out of the village with a flute. That's all I can tell you.
quotes.author: R. Kelly

quotes.text: I'm not going to comment about potential jobs in the future because that's a rabbit hole to go down and get caught up in, but all I'll say is I'll go where the good scripts are.
quotes.author: Natalie Dormer

quotes.text: The movie truism is that stars play themselves, while actors play other people - troubled or toxic, and memorably strange. By that definition, Philip Seymour Hoffman, who disappeared into the rabbit hole of his characters' souls, was our generation's anti-star and the chameleonic film actor of his age.
quotes.author: Richard Corliss

quotes.text: After I left the R.S.C., I did a musical, 'Masquerade,' where I played a rabbit. I was the lead.
quotes.author: Roger Rees

quotes.text: Our main deal is pastured livestock. So we have beef cattle, pigs, turkeys, laying chickens, meat chickens, rabbit, lamb and ducks - egg-layer ducks.
quotes.author: Joel Salatin

quotes.text: Peter Rabbit's not a rabbit. Peter Rabbit is a proxy for the child who reads the book, and they imagine themselves in the rabbit's position.
quotes.author: Chris Van Allsburg

quotes.text: If people want to watch a movie about a fox and rabbit becoming friends and turn that into an evil, agenda-pushing practice, then what can you say?
quotes.author: Rich Moore

quotes.text: I don't follow anybody. I just flip through whatever Instagram sends me. I like to keep my algorithm pure, so I only ever like pictures of art. It's a rabbit hole for me because I'm a total voyeur.
quotes.author: Marilyn Minter

quotes.text: I did my acting performance in 'Roger Rabbit.' I think I did a voice-over also in 'Osmosis Jones' and I directed an episode of my show years ago, 'Tales from the Crypt' and that's my endeavors in the non-producer oriented ranks.
quotes.author: Joel Silver

quotes.text: I give and give, and sometimes I can't find me. I'm sure many moms and wives go down that same rabbit hole.
quotes.author: Kim Fields

quotes.text: You can't start a product simply by building it. You have to know why you're building it, and you might go down the wrong rabbit hole, waste time, and confuse things. Spending long afternoons with a sketchbook or talking through your ideas with other people can save a year in software development later on.
quotes.author: Mike Krieger

quotes.text: The excitement of being a Task Rabbit is that you can create your own businesses and become an entrepreneur. We're creating jobs for people in this economy. Some of the Task Rabbits are cashing out at $5,000 per month.
quotes.author: Leah Busque

quotes.text: I think fondly of the rabbit holes I disappeared down when I researched papers for history and English because I couldn't find quite what I was looking for, or because I had to go through so much material to find examples for my thesis.
quotes.author: Christina Baker Kline

quotes.text: I think, when I was little, I was a little obsessed with anything that provided luck: Buddhas, 4-leaf clovers, heads-up pennies, even - gasp - a rabbit foot - which actually kind of disgusts me now.
quotes.author: Alysia Reiner

quotes.text: As a child, I copied Tenniel's illustrations from 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland' obsessively, particularly his drawing of the white rabbit in waistcoat and frockcoat, umbrella tucked under one arm and a fob watch in paw, a look of suppressed panic in his eye.
quotes.author: Chris Riddell

quotes.text: When I was nine, I was taught to ride a surfboard in Waikiki by the beach boy Rabbit Kekai.
quotes.author: Susanna Moore

quotes.text: The rabbit is significant in that the handle on the original South Pointing Chariot was carved in the form of a rabbit. Because the handle extended out front it meant that wherever the rabbit went the chariot had to follow.
quotes.author: Kit Williams

quotes.text: Absolutely, 'Rabbit Hole' gave me a nice first introduction into film acting.
quotes.author: Miles Teller

quotes.text: As a very small boy, my passion was nature, and I had pets - cats, a dog and a bunny rabbit - and I wrote a very small book called 'My Pets,' filled with their photographs and a discussion about my pets and how much I loved them... That was my first book.
quotes.author: Tony Buzan

quotes.text: I've always liked Bernie Sanders. I've always wanted to do a Bernie Sanders impression, but I didn't believe people were familiar enough with him to pull it off. And I've gone down the rabbit hole of doing impressions that not everybody gets. It's not fun.
quotes.author: James Adomian

quotes.text: 'The Moon Rabbit' is laying against the bunker, dreaming and thinking about life and dreaming the impossible possible and creating its own true stories.
quotes.author: Florentijn Hofman

quotes.text: When I'm writing the text for a book like 'Little White Rabbit,' I read it aloud, alone, in my studio, again and again and again - because the rhythm has to be exactly right. After I get my manuscript to the point where I think it is perfect, I begin to think about what I want the art to look like.
quotes.author: Kevin Henkes

quotes.text: I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone's face? Did I say words of healing? Did I let go of my anger and resentment? Did I forgive? Did I love? These are the real questions. I must trust that the little bit of love that I sow now will bear many fruits, here in this world and the life to come.
quotes.author: Henri Nouwen

quotes.text: Let every nation know, whether it wishes us well or ill, that we shall pay any price, bear any burden, meet any hardship, support any friend, oppose any foe to assure the survival and the success of liberty.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.text: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
quotes.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.text: All, too, will bear in mind this sacred principle, that though the will of the majority is in all cases to prevail, that will to be rightful must be reasonable; that the minority possess their equal rights, which equal law must protect, and to violate would be oppression.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: But people who really know me, know that I am not a bad boy at heart... I am a big teddy bear.
quotes.author: A. J. McLean

quotes.text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Endurance is not just the ability to bear a hard thing, but to turn it into glory.
quotes.author: William Barclay

quotes.text: Forgive, forget. Bear with the faults of others as you would have them bear with yours.
quotes.author: Phillips Brooks

quotes.text: It was the labor movement that helped secure so much of what we take for granted today. The 40-hour work week, the minimum wage, family leave, health insurance, Social Security, Medicare, retirement plans. The cornerstones of the middle-class security all bear the union label.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: The cell phone has become the adult's transitional object, replacing the toddler's teddy bear for comfort and a sense of belonging.
quotes.author: Margaret Heffernan

quotes.text: You, too, women, cast away all the cowards from your embraces; they will give you only cowards for children, and you who are the daughters of the land of beauty must bear children who are noble and brave.
quotes.author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

quotes.text: The whole point of the kingdom of God is Jesus has come to bear witness to the true truth, which is nonviolent. When God wants to take charge of the world, he doesn't send in the tanks. He sends in the poor and the meek.
quotes.author: N. T. Wright

quotes.text: If you are going to wrestle a bear, try to stay away from all fish oil products, you know. I mean it's tough for me, because I love to rub myself with salmon oil every day - it's a great conditioner for the hair, skin.
quotes.author: Will Ferrell

quotes.text: Nobody's life is a bed of roses. We all have crosses to bear, and we all just do our best. I would never claim to have the worst situation. There are many widows, and many people dying of AIDS, many people killed in Lebanon, people starving all over the planet. So we have to count our lucky stars.
quotes.author: Yoko Ono

quotes.text: For who can bear to feel himself forgotten?
quotes.author: W. H. Auden

quotes.text: With big folks, either people think you look mean or it's more of a jolly Santa Claus, 'Oh, he's just a pudgy little teddy bear pillow.'
quotes.author: The Notorious B.I.G.

quotes.text: A high heart ought to bear calamities and not flee them, since in bearing them appears the grandeur of the mind and in fleeing them the cowardice of the heart.
quotes.author: Pietro Aretino

quotes.text: I shall cheerfully bear the reproach of having descended below the dignity of history if I can succeed in placing before the English of the nineteenth century a true picture of the life of their ancestors.
quotes.author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quotes.text: The success of the suffrage movement would injure women spiritually and intellectually, for they would be assuming a burden though they knew themselves unable to bear it. It is the sediment, not the wave, of a sex. It is the antithesis of that highest and sweetest mystery - conviction by submission, and conquest by sacrifice.
quotes.author: John Boyle O'Reilly

quotes.text: People go to the zoo and they like the lion because it's scary. And the bear because it's intense, but the monkey makes people laugh.
quotes.author: Lorne Michaels

quotes.text: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble, and then not worth much after you get it.
quotes.author: Zora Neale Hurston

quotes.text: Whatever seeds each man cultivates will grow to maturity and bear in him their own fruit. If they be vegetative, he will be like a plant.
quotes.author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quotes.text: You shouldn't feel guilty about taking time for yourself. Every so often, everyone needs to give themselves a big ol' bear hug and treat themselves to some TLC.
quotes.author: Sean Covey

quotes.text: In every advanced mammalian species that survives and thrives, a common anthropological characteristic is the fierce behavior of the adult female of the species when she senses a threat to her cubs. The lioness, the tigress and the mama bear are all examples.
quotes.author: Marianne Williamson

quotes.text: Within the walls of our own homes, we can and should bear pure testimony of the divinity and reality of the Father and the Son, of the great plan of happiness, and of the Restoration.
quotes.author: David A. Bednar

quotes.text: The fundamental idea which defines a human being as a Muslim is the declaration of faith: that there is a creator, whom we call God - or Allah, in Arabic - and that the creator is one and single. And we declare this faith by the declaration of faith, where we... bear witness that there is no God but God.
quotes.author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

quotes.text: I know how easy it is for some minds to glide along with the current of popular opinion, where influence, respectability, and all those motives which tend to seduce the human heart are brought to bear.
quotes.author: Benjamin F. Wade

quotes.text: Well, my son really loves wildlife. And everytime he draws a polar bear I want to tell him there probably won't any by the time... he's my age. That's kinda hard to deal with.
quotes.author: Thom Yorke

quotes.text: Perhaps our only sickness is to desire a truth which we cannot bear rather than to rest content with the fictions we manufacture out of each other.
quotes.author: Lawrence Durrell

quotes.text: Good thoughts bear good fruit, bad thoughts bear bad fruit.
quotes.author: James Lane Allen

quotes.text: Judaism and Christianity in themselves are distinctly separate entities, to be sure; but when considering their influence on Western thought, we must bear in mind that Christianity alone, or almost alone, transmitted the Jewish share, simply by what it contained of it in its own, original constitution.
quotes.author: Hans Jonas

quotes.text: In falling over in heels while trying to look attractive, you don't just hurt your body, you bear the humiliation of injuring your very soul. Physical pain? Whatever, bring it on. But the humiliation? Oh, you have seen to the very weakest part of me.
quotes.author: Kate Reardon

quotes.text: Whether a woman's running for office or she's supporting her husband who's running for office and she gets criticised for wearing open-toed shoes or for the colour of her coat, there's just a lot of history that you bear if you are a woman who puts herself out in the political arena.
quotes.author: Hillary Clinton

quotes.text: The actual tragedies of life bear no relation to one's preconceived ideas. In the event, one is always bewildered by their simplicity, their grandeur of design, and by that element of the bizarre which seems inherent in them.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: Your patience would fail you if I should continue to relate all the disrespectful speeches and treatment which your servants have been obliged to listen to and patiently to bear.
quotes.author: Peter Stuyvesant

quotes.text: When Prime Minister Neville Chamberlain's government fell in May 1940, the nation turned to Churchill. At last, his unique qualities were brought to bear on a supreme challenge, and with his unshakable optimism, his heroic vision, and above all, his splendid speeches, Churchill roused the spirit of the British people.
quotes.author: Gretchen Rubin

quotes.text: Death and love are the two wings that bear the good man to heaven.
quotes.author: Michelangelo

quotes.text: To be a king and wear a crown is a thing more glorious to them that see it than it is pleasant to them that bear it.
quotes.author: Elizabeth I

quotes.text: I wanted to write a very simple story about a boy, a wolf, a girl, a bear and a forest, so I thought I might set it in the past. I didn't realise that it went back to when I was 10: I used to love the Stone Age when I was a kid and wanted to live in it, and I got rid of my bed and slept on the floor, but I didn't remember it.
quotes.author: Michelle Paver

quotes.text: A lot of us grow up and we grow out of the literal interpretation that we get when we're children, but we bear the scars all our life. Whether they're scars of beauty or scars of ugliness, it's pretty much in the eye of the beholder.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: For all your days be prepared, and meet them ever alike. When you are the anvil, bear - when you are the hammer, strike.
quotes.author: Edwin Markham

quotes.text: I bear no grudges. I have a mind that retains nothing.
quotes.author: Bette Midler

quotes.text: Men will bear many things from a kept mistress, which they would not bear from a wife.
quotes.author: Samuel Richardson

quotes.text: One of my favorite snacks is Chobani yogurt with Bear Naked granola, because it has all the nutrients I need; it's all-natural, and it has a lot of protein.
quotes.author: Hannah Kearney

quotes.text: As for ourselves, yes, we must be meek, bear injustice, malice, rash judgment. We must turn the other cheek, give up our cloak, go a second mile.
quotes.author: Dorothy Day

quotes.text: I bear solemn witness to the fact that NATO heads of state and of government meet only to go through the tedious motions of reading speeches, drafted by others, with the principal objective of not rocking the boat.
quotes.author: Pierre Trudeau

quotes.text: Bear and endure: This sorrow will one day prove to be for your good.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.text: For a lot of people, Superman is and has always been America's hero. He stands for what we believe is the best within us: limitless strength tempered by compassion, that can bear adversity and emerge stronger on the other side. He stands for what we all feel we would like to be able to stand for, when standing is hardest.
quotes.author: J. Michael Straczynski

quotes.text: I have a massive phobia for schedules and calendars. I need people to tell me where I need to be. I can't bear to see it in black and white. I think it's a fear of being pinned down.
quotes.author: Sam Taylor-Wood

quotes.text: Good thoughts bear good fruit, bad thoughts bear bad fruit.
quotes.author: James Allen

quotes.text: Hate is too great a burden to bear. It injures the hater more than it injures the hated.
quotes.author: Coretta Scott King

quotes.text: I'm noticing a new approach to art making in recent museum and gallery shows. It flickered into focus at the New Museum's 'Younger Than Jesus' last year and ran through the Whitney Biennial, and I'm seeing it blossom and bear fruit at 'Greater New York,' MoMA P.S. 1's twice-a-decade extravaganza of emerging local talent.
quotes.author: Jerry Saltz

quotes.text: Whatever we believe about how we got to be the extraordinary creatures we are today is far less important than bringing our intellect to bear on how do we get together now around the world and get out of the mess that we've made. That's the key thing now. Never mind how we got to be who we are.
quotes.author: Jane Goodall

quotes.text: Glory is a heavy burden, a murdering poison, and to bear it is an art. And to have that art is rare.
quotes.author: Oriana Fallaci

quotes.text: Paddington Bear was a refugee with a label - 'Please look after this bear. Thank you', and he had a little suitcase.
quotes.author: Michael Bond

quotes.text: Three hundred years ago a prisoner condemned to the Tower of London carved on the wall of his cell this sentiment to keep up his spirits during his long imprisonment: 'It is not adversity that kills, but the impatience with which we bear adversity.
quotes.author: James Keller

quotes.text: You gotta bear in mind, the youth - and this is just in Britain alone - have nowhere to go in the evenings. They've closed all the social centers. There's not even a patch of grass to kick a ball on.
quotes.author: John Lydon

quotes.text: Bear up, my child, bear up; Zeus who oversees and directs all things is still mighty in heaven.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: To bear with patience wrongs done to oneself is a mark of perfection, but to bear with patience wrongs done to someone else is a mark of imperfection and even of actual sin.
quotes.author: Thomas Aquinas

quotes.text: The devil put before me that I could not endure the trials of the religious life, because of my delicate nurture. I defended myself against him by alleging the trials which Christ endured, and that it was not much for me to suffer something for His sake; besides, He would help me to bear it.
quotes.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: I'm always annoyed about why black people have to bear the brunt of everybody else's contempt. If we are not totally understanding and smiling, suddenly we're demons.
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.text: There is no harm in patience, and no profit in lamentation. Death is easier to bear (than) that which precedes it, and more severe than that which comes after it. Remember the death of the Apostle of God, and your sorrow will be lessened.
quotes.author: Abu Bakr

quotes.text: We are celebrating the feast of the Eternal Birth which God the Father has borne and never ceases to bear in all eternity... But if it takes not place in me, what avails it? Everything lies in this, that it should take place in me.
quotes.author: Meister Eckhart

quotes.text: If it is right for men to fight for their freedom, and God knows what the human race would be like today if men had not, since time began, fought for their freedom, then it is right for women to fight for their freedom and the freedom of the children they bear.
quotes.author: Emmeline Pankhurst

quotes.text: The proper means of increasing the love we bear our native country is to reside some time in a foreign one.
quotes.author: William Shenstone

quotes.text: Let us be of cheer, remembering that the misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never come.
quotes.author: Amy Lowell

quotes.text: Do not make best friends with a melancholy sad soul. They always are heavily loaded, and you must bear half.
quotes.author: Francois Fenelon

quotes.text: To bear is to conquer our fate.
quotes.author: Thomas Campbell

quotes.text: The smoothest curled courtier in the boudoirs of a palace has an animal nature, rude and aboriginal as a white bear.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: No other country in the world does what we do. On every issue, the world turns to us, not simply because of the size of our economy or our military might - but because of the ideals we stand for, and the burdens we bear to advance them.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: We never need feel we are alone or unloved in the Lord's service because we never are. The Savior has promised angels on our left and on our right to bear us up, and he always keeps his word.
quotes.author: Henry B. Eyring

quotes.text: I would miss months of school and then return with bright blond hair. Needless to say, there was bullying. I wasn't beaten up daily, but there was name-calling and jealousy. You have to bear in mind that 'Harry Potter' wasn't cool. I wasn't part of the 'Terminator' franchise.
quotes.author: Tom Felton

quotes.text: A hurtful act is the transference to others of the degradation which we bear in ourselves.
quotes.author: Simone Weil

quotes.text: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.
quotes.author: Moliere

quotes.text: Let my name stand among those who are willing to bear ridicule and reproach for the truth's sake, and so earn some right to rejoice when the victory is won.
quotes.author: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.text: Once the bear's hug has got you, it is apt to be for keeps.
quotes.author: Harold MacMillan

quotes.text: It is true that the Puritans banned all recreation on Sundays and all games of chance, gambling, bear baiting, horse racing, and bowling in or around taverns at all times. They did so, not because they were opposed to fun, but because they judged these activities to be inherently harmful or immoral.
quotes.author: Leland Ryken

quotes.text: The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it.
quotes.author: Arnold H. Glasow

quotes.text: Ever consider what pets must think of us? I mean, here we come back from a grocery store with the most amazing haul - chicken, pork, half a cow. They must think we're the greatest hunters on earth!
quotes.author: Anne Tyler

quotes.text: I was eating in a Chinese restaurant downtown. There was a dish called Mother and Child Reunion. It's chicken and eggs. And I said, I gotta use that one.
quotes.author: Paul Simon

quotes.text: A Jewish woman had two chickens. One got sick, so the woman made chicken soup out of the other one to help the sick one get well.
quotes.author: Henny Youngman

quotes.text: Regard it as just as desirable to build a chicken house as to build a cathedral.
quotes.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.text: I love chicken. I would eat chicken fingers on Thanksgiving if it were socially acceptable.
quotes.author: Todd Barry

quotes.text: One day Mum saved up for this exciting new thing - a frozen chicken. She cooked it on the Sunday and we all sat around waiting for it, but there was a terrible smell from the kitchen. She didn't realise that the giblets were in a plastic bag inside it. We just ate vegetables and she cried and cried.
quotes.author: Carol Vorderman

quotes.text: I always get so excited cooking chicken wings.
quotes.author: Jourdan Dunn

quotes.text: I like to cook simple things, like vegetable egg-white omelets; roast chicken; sauteed chicken breast with curry powder; and Greek salad. Just things that are fresh and healthy and fast and easy, because I have such a crazy schedule.
quotes.author: Sasha Cohen

quotes.text: In L.A., I get a meal delivery service called Diet Designs. I like a nice butter lettuce salad with some avocado, fresh grapefruit, shredded chicken breast and raw almond slices with a sesame vinaigrette dressing. I also love juicing and am kind of obsessed with it.
quotes.author: Fergie

quotes.text: What is sauce for the goose may be sauce for the gander but is not necessarily sauce for the chicken, the duck, the turkey or the guinea hen.
quotes.author: Alice B. Toklas

quotes.text: I like chicken a lot because chicken is generous - that is to say, it's obedient. It will do whatever you tell it to do.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: I love chicken. I love chicken products: fried chicken, roasted chicken, chicken nuggets - whatever. And going to Japan, I would see that these chicken were smoked and then grilled and then have this amazing crispy skin.
quotes.author: David Chang

quotes.text: For meals, I'm big into quinoa or rocket salad with a protein like shrimp of chicken added to it.
quotes.author: Jessica Stroup

quotes.text: My God, he looks like he's beating a chicken.
quotes.author: Byron Nelson

quotes.text: This is how sad my life is: I got a scar from scratching my chicken pox too much. That's my big scar story. I really have no major scars.
quotes.author: Lewis Black

quotes.text: Yes and, you know, I can't use the nice words anymore because I used to chicken out by using them. I used to call myself plus size, used to call myself chubby. I used to call myself overweight.
quotes.author: Star Jones

quotes.text: In the Bible it says God has made everything good for man to eat and to wear their skins. Whenever we eat beef, we eat chicken, we have to kill to eat. But at the same time, hunting is a sport. I think it is a great sport... I would say most hunters are Christian men.
quotes.author: Luke Scott

quotes.text: The difference between involvement and commitment is like ham and eggs. The chicken is involved; the pig is committed.
quotes.author: Martina Navratilova

quotes.text: In order to have good fried chicken, you should wash and season the bird the morning you're preparing it for dinner. Don't wait and do it right before you start cooking. Throw it in the refrigerator, seasoned, that morning, and give it a chance to soak up all the salt and pepper and goodness.
quotes.author: Paula Deen

quotes.text: If you like good ol' fashion Southern soul food then, yes, I am a good cook! My specialty is chicken dumplings and poke salad.
quotes.author: Dolly Parton

quotes.text: Today, most women are surrounded by ingenious gadgets. They don't grow the peas or raise the chicken that they serve for dinner; instead they hunt and gather in the grocery store. They go through catalogs or department stores to buy clothes instead of shearing sheep, carding wool, and weaving cloth for skirts and coats and blankets.
quotes.author: Helen Fisher

quotes.text: Love, like a chicken salad or restaurant hash, must be taken with blind faith or it loses its flavor.
quotes.author: Helen Rowland

quotes.text: Is this chicken, what I have, or is this fish? I know it's tuna, but it says 'Chicken of the Sea.'
quotes.author: Jessica Simpson

quotes.text: I love chicken fingers, I love French fries. I love desserts. I'm not just into dessert or just into savoury food. I love it all. I'm a pig. I love food. So it takes a lot of discipline to eat healthy.
quotes.author: Holly Madison

quotes.text: I like animals, all animals. I wouldn't hurt a cat or a dog - or a chicken or a cow. And I wouldn't ask someone else to hurt them for me. That's why I'm a vegetarian.
quotes.author: Peter Dinklage

quotes.text: When I arrived at Campbell on January 8, 2001, the company had lost half its market value in the prior year. They had to cut costs to the point where they were literally taking the chicken out of chicken noodle soup and the product was no longer competitive.
quotes.author: Douglas Conant

quotes.text: Food feeds both the body and soul - there are clear reasons to eat a balanced diet, but there are also reasons you cling to your mom's secret chicken noodle soup recipe when you're sick.
quotes.author: Michael Mina

quotes.text: I wasn't eating the right kinds of calories. I didn't know about healthy carbs such as brown rice and lentils. Now I eat small meals throughout the day: oatmeal with cinnamon to start, fruit and yogurt as a snack, and vegetables or with chicken or tuna, and a healthy carb, like a yam, for lunch.
quotes.author: Alison Sweeney

quotes.text: I have time only for cricket, and when I am not playing, I love to be at home, chat with my family, do puja with them, call for some yummy paani puri, etc. Also I love to cook. I can make dal, sabji and chicken! But, at home everybody's a vegetarian, so I can't cook non-veg at home!
quotes.author: Suresh Raina

quotes.text: I love cooking. I like to make lasagna - it's authentic Italian-style. I also do a great chicken recipe for a barbecue.
quotes.author: Sullivan Stapleton

quotes.text: What's the two things they tell you are healthiest to eat? Chicken and fish. You know what you should do? Combine them, eat a penguin.
quotes.author: Dave Attell

quotes.text: The best comfort food will always be greens, cornbread, and fried chicken.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: I try to teach my son about sanitation, especially when handling foods like chicken that could be dangerous. I remind him to wash his hands all the time. When my son cooks with me, he stands on a step stool so he can reach the stove. I teach him about safety and fire.
quotes.author: Emeril Lagasse

quotes.text: I always think if you have to cook once, it should feed you twice. If you're going to make a big chicken and vegetable soup for lunch on Monday, you stick it in the refrigerator and it's also for Wednesday's dinner.
quotes.author: Curtis Stone

quotes.text: My best nutrition tip is to eat things you like that are low in calories and fat. Some of my favorites are chicken, rice, assorted veggies, egg white omelets, turkey sandwiches and protein shakes.
quotes.author: Nate Holland

quotes.text: I've eaten lion, leopard, crocodile, python. I don't recommend lion. It tastes exactly like when a tomcat comes into your house and sprays. Snake and crocodile are great - a cross between lobster and chicken.
quotes.author: Wilbur Smith

quotes.text: There are a lot of 'chicken Christians.' Chickens are generally afraid of life, and they seldom fly or reach their potential in life. And when a storm comes, all they seem to do is flap around the chicken yard, stirring up dirt and running to the chicken house.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.text: Repetition creates pattern. If I have a hundred of these, a hundred of those, it doesn't make any difference what these and those are. If I can repeat anything, I have the possibility of a pattern from hickory nuts and chicken eggs, shards of glass, branches. It doesn't make any difference.
quotes.author: Dan Phillips

quotes.text: The greatest story of all is Colonel Sanders. He didn't start until he was sixty-six on a freeway bypass for his chicken shop. Anything is possible!
quotes.author: Robert Kiyosaki

quotes.text: I have a great time cooking and eating Thai green chicken curry.
quotes.author: Akshay Kumar

quotes.text: I cook chicken for a living.
quotes.author: S. Truett Cathy

quotes.text: I definitely try to eat a healthy diet, but I am the first person to say I love unhealthy food. I would never tell you I don't. I love fried chicken or mac and cheese. Do I order them all the time when I'm out at restaurants? No, though I do have one splurge meal a week.
quotes.author: Rachel Nichols

quotes.text: When I'm doing a movie, I eat the same thing every day. For lunch, it's tuna salad or chicken salad and cole slaw. That's it. For dinner it's either veal and rice, fish and rice or steak and rice. It gets boring; boy, does it get boring.
quotes.author: Sylvester Stallone

quotes.text: A woman who demands further gun control legislation is like a chicken who roots for Colonel Sanders.
quotes.author: Larry Elder

quotes.text: In the voyeurism of Reality TV, the viewer's passivity is kept intact, pampered and massaged and force-fed Chicken McNuggets of carefully edited snippets that permit him or her to sit in easy judgment and feel superior at watching familiar strangers make fools of themselves. Reality TV looks in only one direction: down.
quotes.author: James Wolcott

quotes.text: When you turn from one room to the next, when your animal senses no longer perceive the sounds of the dishwasher, the ticking clock, the smell of a chicken roasting - the kitchen and all its seemingly discrete bits dissolve into nothingness - or into waves of probability.
quotes.author: Robert Lanza

quotes.text: I try to work out my mind more these days. I try to eat right. I don't drink, I don't smoke, and I take the skin off chicken. But I'm not on no special diet. I like my steak and potatoes, ice cream, doughnuts.
quotes.author: Mr. T

quotes.text: Sticking feathers up your butt does not make you a chicken.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: When you are at home, even if the chicken is a little burnt, what's the big deal? Relax.
quotes.author: Jacques Pepin

quotes.text: The Bluebird of Happiness long absent from his life, Ned is visited by the Chicken of Depression.
quotes.author: Gary Larson

quotes.text: We were never the family that ordered pizza, and my mom never came home with a bucket of fried chicken. My mom always made home-cooked meals. We always sat down at the dinner table as a family.
quotes.author: Haylie Duff

quotes.text: Thanks to farm subsidies, the fine collaboration between agribusiness and Congress, soy, corn and cattle became king. And chicken soon joined them on the throne. It was during this period that the cycle of dietary and planetary destruction began, the thing we're only realizing just now.
quotes.author: Mark Bittman

quotes.text: I don't think people should be fed mesclun salad and chicken breast. My grandmother would serve grits and oxtail stew at a formal dinner, and if you didn't like it, well then you ate more beans or you went home and ate a peanut butter and jelly sandwich.
quotes.author: Marjorie Gubelmann

quotes.text: The great thing about being a print journalist is that you are permitted to duck. Cameramen get killed while the writers are flat on the floor. A war correspondent for the BBC dedicated his memoir to 50 fallen colleagues, and I guarantee you they were all taking pictures. I am only alive because I am such a chicken.
quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.text: Business is never so healthy as when, like a chicken, it must do a certain amount of scratching around for what it gets.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: I do all of the grocery shopping in my little family. I buy cheese, of many different kinds, sliced packaged meats and poultry, bagels, immense quantities of eggs, pre-made fried chicken. Milk. Bacon. It is insane how much dairy, deli and bakery stuff I buy.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.text: With 'Dope Walk,' I wanted to bring back kids dancing and having fun again. That's how it used to be in Harlem. I remember everybody Harlem-shaking and 'Chicken Noodle Soup'-ing. Those were some of the most fun and memorable times in my life.
quotes.author: ASAP Ferg

quotes.text: I'm the fussiest eater on earth; my husband despairs. I like chicken and pasta, and can't resist milk chocolate. I figure if you're going to do something naughty, make it really enjoyable.
quotes.author: Bonnie Langford

quotes.text: My favorite meal has always been fried chicken.
quotes.author: Tom Watson

quotes.text: You can't set a hen in one morning and have chicken salad for lunch.
quotes.author: George M. Humphrey

quotes.text: I'm going to scream this from the mountain top, there's no such thing as 'a curry.' There's six kazillion different kinds of curry. When someone asks how to make chicken curry, I have to ask 'Which one?'
quotes.author: Aarti Sequeira

quotes.text: I'm particularly fond of boned chicken breasts with a little garlic under the flesh and cooked in a casserole for 40 minutes with a jar of olives, some cherry tomatoes and a spoonful of olive oil.
quotes.author: Maeve Binchy

quotes.text: Chicken, brown rice, and veggies is a great healthy dinner option. It's full of whole grains and protein, and will keep you full for a long time.
quotes.author: Mia Hamm

quotes.text: I have my meals delivered... you know what I like? Chicken and rice... But the problem with being a defensive lineman is, if we get out of hand with our eating, we balloon up to, like, 300-some pounds. So I really got to watch what I eat.
quotes.author: Hugh Douglas

quotes.text: I love the smell of fried chicken.
quotes.author: Giancarlo Esposito

quotes.text: I love eating it - grilled chicken, pasta, rice, and other foods that give me long term energy. Every once in a while, my sweet tooth gets the best of me and I have to snack on some candy. Beverage wise, I stick to sports drinks, water, milk, and juice.
quotes.author: Derrick Rose

quotes.text: Religion is no more the parent of morality than an incubator is the mother of a chicken.
quotes.author: Lemuel K. Washburn

quotes.text: For resourceful tech founders, finding capital is rarely a problem; making the best use of it is another story. A few years slinging pepperoni pies and chicken wings - on tiny margins and with minimal investment - might not be the worst fiscal training.
quotes.author: Ryan Holmes

quotes.text: If you are killing a chicken and cooking a chicken, it has to taste like chicken. Veal has to taste like veal. You have to be able to identify what you're eating. One of my worst experiences is when I can't tell what I'm eating. It is a waste.
quotes.author: Joel Robuchon

quotes.text: Radio was my life growing up. Then, I started in our family band with my uncle, my father, my aunt and my little brother. We would go to The Chicken Box and all the bars and play.
quotes.author: Meghan Trainor

quotes.text: My dad's a doctor, and when I was 8, I went to one of his medical conferences where they were demonstrating laser surgery on a chicken. I was so mad that a chicken had to die, I never ate meat again.
quotes.author: Natalie Portman

quotes.text: I eat the same foods almost every day. I have my favorites like Filipino beef broth, chicken soup with lots and lots of rice.
quotes.author: Manny Pacquiao

quotes.text: The first time I met Beyonce she was about 18 years old, sitting in a makeup chair eating fried chicken, and I knew it was only a matter of time before everyone would know her name.
quotes.author: Gayle King

quotes.text: Being on the road is no excuse for having a poor diet. I don't like fast food, but if I have to, I'll order three plain grilled chicken sandwiches and throw out the buns.
quotes.author: Triple H

quotes.text: My friend told me later he got the chicken pox. I told him I caught politics and never got over it.
quotes.author: Jack Johnson

quotes.text: 'The Chicken Soup for the Soul' books are the result of over 20 years of teaching seminars and giving speeches. The first book contains all of the stories that I used in my seminars to illustrate the points that I wanted to make.
quotes.author: Jack Canfield

quotes.text: I love chicken. But, like a lot of chefs and cooks, I get tired of preparing it the same way.
quotes.author: Marcus Samuelsson

quotes.text: I always have really fresh, hormone-free, additive-free chicken, healthy veggies, and brown rice in the fridge to grab because I'm always on the go.
quotes.author: Laura Prepon

quotes.text: Fifty thousand dollars' worth of cabinets isn't going to make you a better cook; cooking is going to make you a better cook. At the end of the day, you can slice a mushroom in about three inches of space, and you can carve a chicken in a foot and a half. So it doesn't matter how big the kitchen is.
quotes.author: Tyler Florence

quotes.text: Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.text: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: Intelligence without ambition is a bird without wings.
quotes.author: Salvador Dali

quotes.text: My heart is like a singing bird.
quotes.author: Christina Rossetti

quotes.text: Delicious autumn! My very soul is wedded to it, and if I were a bird I would fly about the earth seeking the successive autumns.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.text: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
quotes.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.text: Time sometimes flies like a bird, sometimes crawls like a snail; but a man is happiest when he does not even notice whether it passes swiftly or slowly.
quotes.author: Ivan Turgenev

quotes.text: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
quotes.author: Langston Hughes

quotes.text: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being with an independent will.
quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.text: What is a fish without a river? What is a bird without a tree to nest in? What is an Endangered Species Act without any enforcement mechanism to ensure their habitat is protected? It is nothing.
quotes.author: Jay Inslee

quotes.text: Just as the bird sings or the butterfly soars, because it is his natural characteristic, so the artist works.
quotes.author: Alma Gluck

quotes.text: I found myself in the doldrums in the early Nineties. I was too old to play the dolly bird any longer and I looked too young to play a woman of my real age. No one ever saw me as the aunt, mother or grandmother.
quotes.author: Barbara Windsor

quotes.text: I was a smoker for years. Occasionally I slip and have a cigarette. Remarkably, my voice has held up. I'm grateful, obviously. But I don't gargle with honey and ground-up bird eggs. I have no secrets.
quotes.author: Loudon Wainwright III

quotes.text: When I see a bird that walks like a duck and swims like a duck and quacks like a duck, I call that bird a duck.
quotes.author: James Whitcomb Riley

quotes.text: Success is full of promise till one gets it, and then it seems like a nest from which the bird has flown.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: I have snakes, three sharks, moray eels, piranhas, five scorpions and a bird spider. All of them are predators. They are dangerous but it's cool to have strong and powerful pets.
quotes.author: Tracy Morgan

quotes.text: After months of playing air guitar to 'Free Bird', what really got me into guitar was watching a documentary about Jimi Hendrix and picking up the Woodstock soundtrack. Listening to his version of 'Star Spangled Banner' and 'Purple Haze.' My brother played acoustic guitar and, idolising him, I thought, 'I'm going to get a guitar.'
quotes.author: Kirk Hammett

quotes.text: Since 2001, people have been scared. There's been some really scary stuff that's been happening - 9/11, Iraq, Afghanistan, Katrina, anthrax letters, D.C. sniper, global warming, global financial meltdown, bird flu, swine flu, SARS. I think people really feel like the system's breaking down.
quotes.author: Max Brooks

quotes.text: My father always said, 'Malala will be free as a bird.'
quotes.author: Malala Yousafzai

quotes.text: I can't understand why the front pages of newspapers can cover bird flu and swine flu and everybody is up in arms about that and we still haven't really woken up to the fact that so many women in sub-Saharan Africa - 60 percent of people in - infected with HIV are women.
quotes.author: Annie Lennox

quotes.text: Seasonally ploughing and harvesting crops will mash up a few moles, slice through a burrow of field mice and crush any ground-nesting bird chicks. Far more significant, however, is the creation of the field in the first place: an act that replaces entire ecosystems, along with all their animal inhabitants.
quotes.author: Tristram Stuart

quotes.text: Stuffing is evil. Stuffing adds mass, so it slows the cooking. That's evil because the longer the bird cooks, the drier it will be.
quotes.author: Alton Brown

quotes.text: Praises for our past triumphs are as feathers to a dead bird.
quotes.author: Paul Eldridge

quotes.text: If you had asked me when I was 28 and in my wedding dress if I ever thought I would end up in my forties flipping my husband the bird over potato chips, I'd say you were crazy.
quotes.author: Jenna McCarthy

quotes.text: Some newspapers are fit only to line the bottom of bird cages.
quotes.author: Spiro T. Agnew

quotes.text: For my own part, I wish the bald eagle had not been chosen the representative of our country. He is a bird of bad moral character. He does not get his living honestly.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I don't mind being 65, but nobody is gonna tell me to come in at 5:30 to have the early bird special.
quotes.author: Alan King

quotes.text: People are in such a hurry to launch their product or business that they seldom look at marketing from a bird's eye view and they don't create a systematic plan.
quotes.author: Dave Ramsey

quotes.text: God gives every bird its food, but He does not throw it into its nest.
quotes.author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

quotes.text: Put a bird cage near the window so that the bird can see the sky? It's much better to look than not to, even if it hurts.
quotes.author: Klaus Kinski

quotes.text: It may be hard for an egg to turn into a bird: it would be a jolly sight harder for it to learn to fly while remaining an egg. We are like eggs at present. And you cannot go on indefinitely being just an ordinary, decent egg. We must be hatched or go bad.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.text: I think that Vegas is one of the wildest places I've ever been to. You can look to your left and there's a drag queen getting married by Elvis, to the right there is some old bird sticking quarters into a slot machine for hours.
quotes.author: Marsha Thomason

quotes.text: I was raised on a farm in Kansas where we lived next door to my Grandma Dew, and I was her shadow. We went everywhere together - to the bank, the doctor, the Early Bird Garden Club, and to an endless procession of Church meetings.
quotes.author: Sheri L. Dew

quotes.text: If it looks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, we have at least to consider the possibility that we have a small aquatic bird of the family anatidae on our hands.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.text: In order to have good fried chicken, you should wash and season the bird the morning you're preparing it for dinner. Don't wait and do it right before you start cooking. Throw it in the refrigerator, seasoned, that morning, and give it a chance to soak up all the salt and pepper and goodness.
quotes.author: Paula Deen

quotes.text: I'm not an early bird at all. Ideally, on Saturday morning I'd allow myself a lovely lie-in. 10:45 would be just right.
quotes.author: Shilpa Shetty

quotes.text: I'd like to think that the nature of the two teams - Boston being a championship team over the years and the Lakers, same thing - was a lot bigger than Larry Bird or Magic Johnson.
quotes.author: Oscar Robertson

quotes.text: We must force the government to stop the bird migration. We must shoot all birds, field all our men and troops... and force migratory birds to stay where they are.
quotes.author: Vladimir Zhirinovsky

quotes.text: The Golden Eagle, which has universally been considered as a bird of most extraordinary powers of flight, is in my estimation little more than a sluggard, though its wings are long and ample.
quotes.author: John James Audubon

quotes.text: I wanted to know the name of every stone and flower and insect and bird and beast. I wanted to know where it got its color, where it got its life - but there was no one to tell me.
quotes.author: George Washington Carver

quotes.text: I think I was first awakened to musical exploration by Dizzy Gillespie and Bird. It was through their work that I began to learn about musical structures and the more theoretical aspects of music.
quotes.author: John Coltrane

quotes.text: My room is like an antique shop, full of junk, and weird stuff. There's a big sword in there. And a taxidermy bird, and a couple of birdcages. And a lot of newspaper cuttings. I used to have a weird thing about cutting out morbid headlines from newspapers, and collecting them. I was fascinated with drowning, which is kind of strange.
quotes.author: Florence Welch

quotes.text: History repeats itself, but the special call of an art which has passed away is never reproduced. It is as utterly gone out of the world as the song of a destroyed wild bird.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.text: The early bird gets the worm. The early worm... gets eaten.
quotes.author: Norman Ralph Augustine

quotes.text: The soul has illusions as the bird has wings: it is supported by them.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: I think we consider too much the good luck of the early bird and not enough the bad luck of the early worm.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: I'm youth, I'm joy, I'm a little bird that has broken out of the egg.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.text: When I wrote the eight fairy tales that appear in 'Horse, Flower, Bird' I was working toward a completely new form of artistic expression, trying to create a new kind of tale that also felt vintage: innocent and childlike, but haunted. I tried to write a picture-less picture book.
quotes.author: Kate Bernheimer

quotes.text: The early bird may get the worm, but its the second mouse that gets the cheese.
quotes.author: Jeremy Paxman

quotes.text: I like the idea of taking off like a bird.
quotes.author: Florence Welch

quotes.text: Romance is a bird that will not sing in every bush, and love-affairs, however devoted the sentiments that inspire them, are often so business-like in the prudence with which they are conducted, that romance is reduced to a mere croaking or a disgusted silence.
quotes.author: E. F. Benson

quotes.text: It's impossible to explain creativity. It's like asking a bird, 'How do you fly?' You just do.
quotes.author: Eric Jerome Dickey

quotes.text: No better way is there to learn to love Nature than to understand Art. It dignifies every flower of the field. And, the boy who sees the thing of beauty which a bird on the wing becomes when transferred to wood or canvas will probably not throw the customary stone.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: London is a roost for every bird.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.text: The human bird shall take his first flight, filling the world with amazement, all writings with his fame, and bringing eternal glory to the nest whence he sprang.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: I never saw a wild thing sorry for itself. A small bird will drop frozen dead from a bough without ever having felt sorry for itself.
quotes.author: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.text: When you have seen one ant, one bird, one tree, you have not seen them all.
quotes.author: E. O. Wilson

quotes.text: The compelled mother loves her child as the caged bird sings. The song does not justify the cage nor the love the enforcement.
quotes.author: Germaine Greer

quotes.text: God gives every bird his worm, but He does not throw it into the nest.
quotes.author: P. D. James

quotes.text: Man can now fly in the air like a bird, swim under the ocean like a fish, he can burrow into the ground like a mole. Now if only he could walk the earth like a man, this would be paradise.
quotes.author: Tommy Douglas

quotes.text: When you have shot one bird flying you have shot all birds flying. They are all different and they fly in different ways but the sensation is the same and the last one is as good as the first.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: The greatest achievement was at first and for a time a dream. The oak sleeps in the acorn, the bird waits in the egg, and in the highest vision of the soul a waking angel stirs. Dreams are the seedlings of realities.
quotes.author: James Allen

quotes.text: A forest bird never wants a cage.
quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

quotes.text: Be like the bird who, pausing in her flight awhile on boughs too slight, feels them give way beneath her, and yet sings, knowing she hath wings.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: Oh, bird of my soul, fly away now, For I possess a hundred fortified towers.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: I never wanted to weigh more heavily on a man than a bird.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: Look at guys like Larry Bird and George Brett and John McEnroe; that's what they did in their careers. They all wanted to be the guy under the microscope late in the game or late in the match. So you just take on that know-how that that's part of your responsibility, and you learn that's what makes it exciting. That's what makes it fun!
quotes.author: Wayne Gretzky

quotes.text: It's best to have failure happen early in life. It wakes up the Phoenix bird in you so you rise from the ashes.
quotes.author: Anne Baxter

quotes.text: A heart without dreams is like a bird without feathers.
quotes.author: Suzy Kassem

quotes.text: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: Everyone likes birds. What wild creature is more accessible to our eyes and ears, as close to us and everyone in the world, as universal as a bird?
quotes.author: David Attenborough

quotes.text: Be as a bird perched on a frail branch that she feels bending beneath her, still she sings away all the same, knowing she has wings.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.text: Even the dullest bird or face becomes interesting when you give it a good look in the wild/flesh. The way the shadow drops across the cheek, the light hits an eyebrow, etc... there are many more angles, positions etc. than you can ever imagine. My heart always makes a little jump when I see things in birds or faces that surprise me.
quotes.author: Siegfried Woldhek

quotes.text: Gliders, sail planes, they're wonderful flying machines. It's the closest you can come to being a bird.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: The early bird catches the worm.
quotes.author: William Camden

quotes.text: Girdles and wire stays should have never been invented. No man wants to hug a padded bird cage.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: In all religions, the quickening spirit has been symbolically represented as a bird. At the baptism, when Jesus' body was in the water, the Spirit of Christ descended into it as a dove.
quotes.author: Max Heindel

quotes.text: I consider myself to have been the bridge between the shotgun and the binoculars in bird watching. Before I came along, the primary way to observe birds was to shoot them and stuff them.
quotes.author: Roger Tory Peterson

quotes.text: If I'm going to be a caged bird, I'll sing the best song I can.
quotes.author: Wes Craven

quotes.text: If you direct your attention to the position of a bird with regard to the wave surface, it will speedily be noticed to be nearly always on the rising side or face of the wave and moving apparently at right angles to the wave's course, but really diagonal to it.
quotes.author: Lawrence Hargrave

quotes.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: We can never obtain peace in the outer world until we make peace with ourselves.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: I refuse to accept the view that mankind is so tragically bound to the starless midnight of racism and war that the bright daybreak of peace and brotherhood can never become a reality... I believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: Peace begins with a smile.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.text: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Imagine all the people living life in peace. You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us, and the world will be as one.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: I believe in the religion of Islam. I believe in Allah and peace.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.text: Peace is a journey of a thousand miles and it must be taken one step at a time.
quotes.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.text: Peace and justice are two sides of the same coin.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.text: Never be in a hurry; do everything quietly and in a calm spirit. Do not lose your inner peace for anything whatsoever, even if your whole world seems upset.
quotes.author: Saint Francis de Sales

quotes.text: Happiness, true happiness, is an inner quality. It is a state of mind. If your mind is at peace, you are happy. If your mind is at peace, but you have nothing else, you can be happy. If you have everything the world can give - pleasure, possessions, power - but lack peace of mind, you can never be happy.
quotes.author: Dada Vaswani

quotes.text: When the power of love overcomes the love of power the world will know peace.
quotes.author: Jimi Hendrix

quotes.text: I'm concentrating on staying healthy, having peace, being happy, remembering what is important, taking in nature and animals, spending time reading, trying to understand the universe, where science and the spiritual meet.
quotes.author: Joan Jett

quotes.text: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: Those who make peaceful revolution impossible will make violent revolution inevitable.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: While you are proclaiming peace with your lips, be careful to have it even more fully in your heart.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: I took a deep breath and listened to the old bray of my heart. I am. I am. I am.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.text: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Harmony makes small things grow, lack of it makes great things decay.
quotes.author: Sallust

quotes.text: If they want peace, nations should avoid the pin-pricks that precede cannon shots.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.text: First keep peace with yourself, then you can also bring peace to others.
quotes.author: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.text: Peace is a day-to-day problem, the product of a multitude of events and judgments. Peace is not an 'is,' it is a 'becoming.'
quotes.author: Haile Selassie

quotes.text: Let us have peace.
quotes.author: Ulysses S. Grant

quotes.text: Each one has to find his peace from within. And peace to be real must be unaffected by outside circumstances.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Nobody can bring you peace but yourself.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The most valuable possession you can own is an open heart. The most powerful weapon you can be is an instrument of peace.
quotes.author: Carlos Santana

quotes.text: It is madness for sheep to talk peace with a wolf.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.text: Let us more and more insist on raising funds of love, of kindness, of understanding, of peace. Money will come if we seek first the Kingdom of God - the rest will be given.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: It isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: The true and solid peace of nations consists not in equality of arms, but in mutual trust alone.
quotes.author: Pope John XXIII

quotes.text: All we are saying is give peace a chance.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: Mankind must remember that peace is not God's gift to his creatures; peace is our gift to each other.
quotes.author: Elie Wiesel

quotes.text: If there must be trouble, let it be in my day, that my child may have peace.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.text: Those who are at war with others are not at peace with themselves.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.text: Even peace may be purchased at too high a price.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: The Dove, on silver pinions, winged her peaceful way.
quotes.author: James Montgomery

quotes.text: The pursuit, even of the best things, ought to be calm and tranquil.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.text: You cannot shake hands with a clenched fist.
quotes.author: Indira Gandhi

quotes.text: He that would live in peace and at ease must not speak all he knows or all he sees.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: I happen to dig being able to use whatever mystique I have to further the idea of peace.
quotes.author: Garrett Morris

quotes.text: Peace is rarely denied to the peaceful.
quotes.author: Friedrich Schiller

quotes.text: For behind all imperialism is ultimately the imperialistic individual, just as behind all peace is ultimately the peaceful individual.
quotes.author: Irving Babbitt

quotes.text: Peace is liberty in tranquillity.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.text: An army of principles can penetrate where an army of soldiers cannot.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.text: It has become impossible to give up the enterprise of disarmament without abandoning the whole great adventure of building up a collective peace system.
quotes.author: Arthur Henderson

quotes.text: Peace is a daily, a weekly, a monthly process, gradually changing opinions, slowly eroding old barriers, quietly building new structures.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: If you want to make peace with your enemy, you have to work with your enemy. Then he becomes your partner.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: If you want peace, you don't talk to your friends. You talk to your enemies.
quotes.author: Desmond Tutu

quotes.text: Peace is not an absence of war, it is a virtue, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.text: Peace of mind for five minutes, that's what I crave.
quotes.author: Alanis Morissette

quotes.text: One does not need buildings, money, power, or status to practice the Art of Peace. Heaven is right where you are standing, and that is the place to train.
quotes.author: Morihei Ueshiba

quotes.text: The purpose of all wars, is peace.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.text: It is easier to lead men to combat, stirring up their passion, than to restrain them and direct them toward the patient labors of peace.
quotes.author: Andre Gide

quotes.text: A bad peace is even worse than war.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.text: I am not only a pacifist but a militant pacifist. I am willing to fight for peace. Nothing will end war unless the people themselves refuse to go to war.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: The real and lasting victories are those of peace, and not of war.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Where ignorance is our master, there is no possibility of real peace.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: A people free to choose will always choose peace.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.text: I think that people want peace so much that one of these days government had better get out of their way and let them have it.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.text: The pursuit of peace and progress cannot end in a few years in either victory or defeat. The pursuit of peace and progress, with its trials and its errors, its successes and its setbacks, can never be relaxed and never abandoned.
quotes.author: Dag Hammarskjold

quotes.text: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: Let there be work, bread, water and salt for all.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.text: I prefer peace. But if trouble must come, let it come in my time, so that my children can live in peace.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.text: There was a time in my life when I thought I had everything - millions of dollars, mansions, cars, nice clothes, beautiful women, and every other materialistic thing you can imagine. Now I struggle for peace.
quotes.author: Richard Pryor

quotes.text: You will find peace not by trying to escape your problems, but by confronting them courageously. You will find peace not in denial, but in victory.
quotes.author: J. Donald Walters

quotes.text: You can find peace amidst the storms that threaten you.
quotes.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

quotes.text: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
quotes.author: Virginia Woolf

quotes.text: If there is to be any peace it will come through being, not having.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.text: The simplification of life is one of the steps to inner peace. A persistent simplification will create an inner and outer well-being that places harmony in one's life.
quotes.author: Peace Pilgrim

quotes.text: Peace is its own reward.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: If it's your job to eat a frog, it's best to do it first thing in the morning. And If it's your job to eat two frogs, it's best to eat the biggest one first.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: We think too small, like the frog at the bottom of the well. He thinks the sky is only as big as the top of the well. If he surfaced, he would have an entirely different view.
quotes.author: Mao Zedong

quotes.text: One of the big questions in the climate change debate: Are humans any smarter than frogs in a pot? If you put a frog in a pot and slowly turn up the heat, it won't jump out. Instead, it will enjoy the nice warm bath until it is cooked to death. We humans seem to be doing pretty much the same thing.
quotes.author: Jeff Goodell

quotes.text: There is no place in a city that can't be better. There is no toad that can't be a princess, no frog that can't become a prince.
quotes.author: Jaime Lerner

quotes.text: Don't be a fish; be a frog. Swim in the water and jump when you hit ground.
quotes.author: Kim Young-ha

quotes.text: I'd kiss a frog even if there was no promise of a Prince Charming popping out of it. I love frogs.
quotes.author: Cameron Diaz

quotes.text: I'm not a diva. I'm a tadpole trying to be a frog.
quotes.author: Toni Braxton

quotes.text: They may have turned this up, whether you had the Paula Jones case or not. But again maybe not, but again that's like if a frog had side pockets he'd probably wear a handgun.
quotes.author: Dan Rather

quotes.text: I went into a French restaraunt and asked the waiter, 'Have you got frog's legs?' He said, 'Yes,' so I said, 'Well hop into the kitchen and get me a cheese sandwich.'
quotes.author: Tommy Cooper

quotes.text: Theories pass. The frog remains.
quotes.author: Jean Rostand

quotes.text: If you put a frog in boiling water, it'll jump straight out. If you put it in cold water and gradually bring it to the boil, it'll sit right there until it dies. Scotland has been sitting in England's gradually boiling water for so long that many people are used to it.
quotes.author: John Niven

quotes.text: Every time I hear a politician mention the word 'stimulus,' my mind flashes back to high school biology class, when I touched battery wires to a dead frog to make it twitch.
quotes.author: Robert Kiyosaki

quotes.text: At college I'd seen my dead frog's limbs twitch under some applied stimulus or other - seen, but hadn't believed. Didn't dream of thinking beyond or around what I saw.
quotes.author: James Merrill

quotes.text: I loved Ray from 'The Princess and the Frog.' He was my guy. There was no Ray before me, so there's a level of satisfaction there.
quotes.author: Jim Cummings

quotes.text: Who doesn't love 'Frogger?' It draws its power from our shared memories of powerlessness. Wherever we are now, at one time or another we have all felt the poor frog's anxiety in the face of the world's intransigence, its blind and callous disregard for our happiness or well-being.
quotes.author: D. B. Weiss

quotes.text: If you're going to have to swallow a frog, you don't want to have to look at that sucker too long!
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.text: My parents called me the WB frog. Because when I was onstage, I would do this whole song and dance, but if my parents had a family friend over, I would just go hide in the bedroom.
quotes.author: Brie Larson

quotes.text: As a brand new graduate student starting in October 1956, my supervisor Michail Fischberg, a lecturer in the Department of Zoology at Oxford, suggested that I should try to make somatic cell nuclear transplantation work in the South African frog Xenopus laevis.
quotes.author: John Gurdon

quotes.text: I think the fact that I'm so well known to be gay makes it very difficult to have a convincing relationship with a woman on screen. It wouldn't be at all difficult for me to kiss a woman - I'll kiss a frog if you like.
quotes.author: Stephen Fry

quotes.text: Analyzing humor is like dissecting a frog. Few people are interested and the frog dies of it.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.text: In France, if you have any sort of talent, you'd better keep it here. And if you're going to go abroad, it had better not be America. The old battle - American versus Frog cinema. It's ridiculous.
quotes.author: Jean Reno

quotes.text: Nobody would have me in their laboratory for five minutes. I couldn't cut up a frog, and I certainly couldn't perform surgery. I'm better at making it possible for other people.
quotes.author: Mary Lasker

quotes.text: I have a pet lizard named Puff, five goldfish - named Pinky, Brain, Jowels, Pearl and Sandy, an oscar fish named Chef, two pacus, an albino African frog named Whitey, a bonsai tree, four Venus flytraps, a fruit fly farm and sea monkeys.
quotes.author: Chris Pratt

quotes.text: I liked the name Frog Brigade because it lent itself to a lot of cool imagery with the whole frog thing.
quotes.author: Les Claypool

quotes.text: I performed in public for the first time at three years old. I remember it like it was yesterday. It was on a big stage. There were probably three or four hundred people in the audience. We were doing this dance, this Kermit the Frog routine, all of us in our little green leotards.
quotes.author: Jaime Pressly

quotes.text: When I play with my band around the U.S.A., the most requested song is 'Peace Frog.'
quotes.author: Robby Krieger

quotes.text: It is odd that we have so little relationship with nature, with the insects and the leaping frog and the owl that hoots among the hills calling for its mate. We never seem to have a feeling for all living things on the earth.
quotes.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quotes.text: I'm known up there as the guy from Frog Jump. And it's a good thing.
quotes.author: Stephen Fincher

quotes.text: There's Frog Jump on my GPS, so it's there. It's a real place.
quotes.author: Stephen Fincher

quotes.text: I found it possible to observe at least the superficial capillaries of muscles both in the frog and in mammals through a binocular microscope, using strong reflected light as a source of illumination. Resting muscles observed in this way are usually quite pale, and the microscope reveals only a few capillaries at fairly regular intervals.
quotes.author: August Krogh
