quotes.text: If you think squash is a competitive activity, try flower arranging.
quotes.author: Alan Bennett

quotes.text: I am the flower child who will not wilt. You couldn't have asked for anything more.
quotes.author: Annie Golden

quotes.text: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: A woman should be like a single flower, not a whole bouquet.
quotes.author: Anna Held

quotes.text: A flower doesn't love you or hate you, it just exists.
quotes.author: Mike White

quotes.text: I still have a Gypsy sense of adventure. I don't think I have slept in the same bed for more than three or four months my whole life. I am always planting vegetables that I never get to eat and flowers that I never see flower. I have always moved around the world.
quotes.author: Helen Mirren

quotes.text: I want it said of me by those who knew me best, that I always plucked a thistle and planted a flower where I thought a flower would grow.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: A weed is but an unloved flower.
quotes.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quotes.text: I wanted to know the name of every stone and flower and insect and bird and beast. I wanted to know where it got its color, where it got its life - but there was no one to tell me.
quotes.author: George Washington Carver

quotes.text: Us sing and dance, make faces and give flower bouquets, trying to be loved. You ever notice that trees do everything to git attention we do, except walk?
quotes.author: Alice Walker

quotes.text: Patience doesn't mean making a pact with the devil of denial, ignoring our emotions and aspirations. It means being wholeheartedly engaged in the process that's unfolding, rather than ripping open a budding flower or demanding a caterpillar hurry up and get that chrysalis stage over with.
quotes.author: Sharon Salzberg

quotes.text: The artist is the confidant of nature, flowers carry on dialogues with him through the graceful bending of their stems and the harmoniously tinted nuances of their blossoms. Every flower has a cordial word which nature directs towards him.
quotes.author: Auguste Rodin

quotes.text: All things by immortal power. Near of far, to each other linked are, that thou canst not stir a flower without troubling of a star.
quotes.author: Francis Thompson

quotes.text: Love is the flower of life, and blossoms unexpectedly and without law, and must be plucked where it is found, and enjoyed for the brief hour of its duration.
quotes.author: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.text: A weed is no more than a flower in disguise, Which is seen through at once, if love give a man eyes.
quotes.author: James Russell Lowell

quotes.text: When I wrote the eight fairy tales that appear in 'Horse, Flower, Bird' I was working toward a completely new form of artistic expression, trying to create a new kind of tale that also felt vintage: innocent and childlike, but haunted. I tried to write a picture-less picture book.
quotes.author: Kate Bernheimer

quotes.text: A flower falls, even though we love it; and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.
quotes.author: Dogen

quotes.text: I think people need to be educated to the fact that marijuana is not a drug. Marijuana is an herb and a flower. God put it here. If He put it here and He wants it to grow, what gives the government the right to say that God is wrong?
quotes.author: Willie Nelson

quotes.text: Politeness is the flower of humanity.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.text: All the lessons of history in four sentences: Whom the gods would destroy, they first make mad with power. The mills of God grind slowly, but they grind exceedingly small. The bee fertilizes the flower it robs. When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
quotes.author: Charles A. Beard

quotes.text: Sometimes, as is the case of peach and plum trees, which are often dwarfed, the plants are thrown into a flowering states, and then, as they flower freely year after year, they have little inclination to make vigorous growth.
quotes.author: Robert Fortune

quotes.text: Perhaps the old monks were right when they tried to root love out; perhaps the poets are right when they try to water it. It is a blood-red flower, with the color of sin; but there is always the scent of a god about it.
quotes.author: Olive Schreiner

quotes.text: For me, style is essentially doing things well. If you want to be outrageous, be outrageous with style. If you want to be restrained, be restrained with style. One can't specifically define style. It's like the perfume to a flower. It's a quality you can't analyze.
quotes.author: Francoise Gilot

quotes.text: No better way is there to learn to love Nature than to understand Art. It dignifies every flower of the field. And, the boy who sees the thing of beauty which a bird on the wing becomes when transferred to wood or canvas will probably not throw the customary stone.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Remember that children, marriages, and flower gardens reflect the kind of care they get.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

quotes.text: I don't believe in an outside agent that creates the world, then walks away. But I feel very strongly there is an intelligence at work in every flower, in every blade of grass, in every cell of my body. And it is that intelligence that, I wouldn't say created the universe. It is creating the universe. It's an ongoing process.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.text: The Amen of nature is always a flower.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.text: Love is flower like; Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.text: I decided that if I could paint that flower in a huge scale, you could not ignore its beauty.
quotes.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quotes.text: Nobody sees a flower really; it is so small. We haven't time, and to see takes time - like to have a friend takes time.
quotes.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quotes.text: If instead of a gem, or even a flower, we should cast the gift of a loving thought into the heart of a friend, that would be giving as the angels give.
quotes.author: George MacDonald

quotes.text: I brought the film like a flower to the world.
quotes.author: Claude Chabrol

quotes.text: Some people worry that artificial intelligence will make us feel inferior, but then, anybody in his right mind should have an inferiority complex every time he looks at a flower.
quotes.author: Alan Kay

quotes.text: We were born to die and we die to live. As seedlings of God, we barely blossom on earth; we fully flower in heaven.
quotes.author: Russell M. Nelson

quotes.text: The Japanese say, If the flower is to be beautiful, it must be cultivated.
quotes.author: Lester Cole

quotes.text: Taste and love are not the servants of the will. Love is and must be free. It rises from the heart like perfume from a flower.
quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.text: The flower which is single need not envy the thorns that are numerous.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.text: The rose is the flower and handmaiden of love - the lily, her fair associate, is the emblem of beauty and purity.
quotes.author: Dorothea Dix

quotes.text: Earth is a flower and it's pollinating.
quotes.author: Neil Young

quotes.text: She had already allowed her delectable lover to pluck that flower which, so different from the rose to which it is nevertheless sometimes compared, has not the same faculty of being reborn each spring.
quotes.author: Marquis de Sade

quotes.text: I did not want to be a tree, a flower or a wave. In a dancer's body, we as audience must see ourselves, not the imitated behavior of everyday actions, not the phenomenon of nature, not exotic creatures from another planet, but something of the miracle that is a human being.
quotes.author: Martha Graham

quotes.text: When I walk with you I feel as if I had a flower in my buttonhole.
quotes.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quotes.text: The flower in the vase smiles, but no longer laughs.
quotes.author: Malcolm de Chazal

quotes.text: The vegetable life does not content itself with casting from the flower or the tree a single seed, but it fills the air and earth with a prodigality of seeds, that, if thousands perish, thousands may plant themselves, that hundreds may come up, that tens may live to maturity; that, at least one may replace the parent.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: There is that in the glance of a flower which may at times control the greatest of creation's braggart lords.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.text: The fact that I can plant a seed and it becomes a flower, share a bit of knowledge and it becomes another's, smile at someone and receive a smile in return, are to me continual spiritual exercises.
quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.text: I put hibiscus flower in every cup of tea I have. It's sweet, sexy, and cleansing.
quotes.author: Mario Batali

quotes.text: When the flower blooms, the bees come uninvited.
quotes.author: Ramakrishna

quotes.text: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is an example of the eternal seductiveness of life.
quotes.author: Jean Giraudoux

quotes.text: Give fools their gold, and knaves their power; let fortune's bubbles rise and fall; who sows a field, or trains a flower, or plants a tree, is more than all.
quotes.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quotes.text: When I am finishing a picture, I hold some God-made object up to it - a rock, a flower, the branch of a tree or my hand - as a final test. If the painting stands up beside a thing man cannot make, the painting is authentic. If there's a clash between the two, it's bad art.
quotes.author: Marc Chagall

quotes.text: London, thou art the flower of cities all!
quotes.author: William Dunbar

quotes.text: The career of a sage is of two kinds: He is either honored by all in the world, Like a flower waving its head, Or else he disappears into the silent forest.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.text: Never cut a tree down in the wintertime. Never make a negative decision in the low time. Never make your most important decisions when you are in your worst moods. Wait. Be patient. The storm will pass. The spring will come.
quotes.author: Robert H. Schuller

quotes.text: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.
quotes.author: Marcus Garvey

quotes.text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.text: Consider a tree for a moment. As beautiful as trees are to look at, we don't see what goes on underground - as they grow roots. Trees must develop deep roots in order to grow strong and produce their beauty. But we don't see the roots. We just see and enjoy the beauty. In much the same way, what goes on inside of us is like the roots of a tree.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: He who has not Christmas in his heart will never find it under a tree.
quotes.author: Roy L. Smith

quotes.text: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.text: My sorrow, when she's here with me, thinks these dark days of autumn rain are beautiful as days can be; she loves the bare, the withered tree; she walks the sodden pasture lane.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
quotes.author: Saint Basil

quotes.text: I looked up my family tree and found out I was the sap.
quotes.author: Rodney Dangerfield

quotes.text: There is a part of me that will forever want to be walking under autumn leaves, carrying a briefcase containing the works of Shakespeare and Yeats and a portable chess set. I will pass an old tree under which once on a summer night I lay on the grass with a fragrant young woman and we quoted e.e. cummings back and forth.
quotes.author: Roger Ebert

quotes.text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: The tree of liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: What is a fish without a river? What is a bird without a tree to nest in? What is an Endangered Species Act without any enforcement mechanism to ensure their habitat is protected? It is nothing.
quotes.author: Jay Inslee

quotes.text: The Left despises Texas, with its stellar record of job growth; Texas, with its strong support for traditional marriage and the sanctity of life; Texas, the root of the conservative tree. Should the Left succeed in its attempt to turn Texas purple, America could turn permanently blue.
quotes.author: Ben Shapiro

quotes.text: A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree.
quotes.author: Spike Milligan

quotes.text: The patriot's blood is the seed of Freedom's tree.
quotes.author: Thomas Campbell

quotes.text: For in the true nature of things, if we rightly consider, every green tree is far more glorious than if it were made of gold and silver.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.text: Notice that the stiffest tree is most easily cracked, while the bamboo or willow survives by bending with the wind.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.text: The apple cannot be stuck back on the Tree of Knowledge; once we begin to see, we are doomed and challenged to seek the strength to see more, not less.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.text: Seasonal changes, as it were, take place in history, when there is practically an almost universal death, a falling of the foliage of the tree of life. Such were the intervals between the ancient and mediaeval time, the mediaeval and the modern.
quotes.author: George Edward Woodberry

quotes.text: 'Boy,' 'October,' 'War,' 'The Unforgettable Fire' and 'The Joshua Tree,' those records, they're part of my musical DNA and structure.
quotes.author: Taylor Hawkins

quotes.text: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.text: And I say the sacred hoop of my people was one of the many hoops that made one circle, wide as daylight and as starlight, and in the center grew one mighty flowering tree to shelter all the children of one mother and one father.
quotes.author: Black Elk

quotes.text: Surely man was not created to be an idle fellow; he was not set in this universal orchard to stand still as a tree.
quotes.author: Thomas Dekker

quotes.text: Night, the beloved. Night, when words fade and things come alive. When the destructive analysis of day is done, and all that is truly important becomes whole and sound again. When man reassembles his fragmentary self and grows with the calm of a tree.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.text: A woodland in full color is awesome as a forest fire, in magnitude at least, but a single tree is like a dancing tongue of flame to warm the heart.
quotes.author: Hal Borland

quotes.text: Yet, so far from laboring to know the forbidden tree of worldly pleasures and its various fruits, man gives himself up to a careless and thoughtless state of life, and yields to the lust of the flesh, not considering that this lust is really the forbidden tree.
quotes.author: Johann Arndt

quotes.text: When was the last time you spent a quiet moment just doing nothing - just sitting and looking at the sea, or watching the wind blowing the tree limbs, or waves rippling on a pond, a flickering candle or children playing in the park?
quotes.author: Ralph Marston

quotes.text: Moving between the legs of tables and of chairs, rising or falling, grasping at kisses and toys, advancing boldly, sudden to take alarm, retreating to the corner of arm and knee, eager to be reassured, taking pleasure in the fragrant brilliance of the Christmas tree.
quotes.author: T. S. Eliot

quotes.text: To read a paper book is another experience: you can do it on a ship, on the branch of a tree, on your bed, even if there is a blackout.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: We are sinful not only because we have eaten of the Tree of Knowledge, but also because we have not yet eaten of the Tree of Life. The state in which we are is sinful, irrespective of guilt.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: The only time I can really relax is up a tree or somewhere outside. I love being outside.
quotes.author: Tom Felton

quotes.text: My first real kiss came when I was 10, and it was in an acting class. I had to do a scene from a movie where someone gets kissed under a tree, and I did not want to do it! But my acting partner wanted me to feel comfortable, so he bought a picnic basket with all these snacks. He made such an effort - and it was cute.
quotes.author: Vanessa Hudgens

quotes.text: My feet are like gnarled old tree branches.
quotes.author: Dennis Rodman

quotes.text: I like to think of thoughts as living blossoms borne by the human tree.
quotes.author: James Douglas

quotes.text: When the Jewish people, after nearly 2,000 years of exile, under relentless persecution, became a nation again on 14 May 1948 the 'fig tree' put forth its first leaves. Jesus said that this would indicate that He was 'at the door,' ready to return.
quotes.author: Hal Lindsey

quotes.text: For some days, people thought that India was shaking. But there are always tremors when a great tree falls.
quotes.author: Rajiv Gandhi

quotes.text: Until you learn to play what you want to hear, you're barking up the wrong tree.
quotes.author: Billy Gibbons

quotes.text: If bad decorating was a hanging offense, there'd be bodies hanging from every tree!
quotes.author: Sylvester Stallone

quotes.text: A woman is a branchy tree and man a singing wind; and from her branches carelessly he takes what he can find.
quotes.author: James Stephens

quotes.text: I can see myself as a very old man in a terrific wheelchair. Only, I won't be photographing the tree outside my window, the way Steichen did. I'll be photographing other old people.
quotes.author: Richard Avedon

quotes.text: My Barbies were usually naked. Once, I took their heads off, cut their hair, drew on their short, spiky hair with some markers, then stuck the heads on Christmas lights. Every year, we'd string our tree with those Barbie heads. It looked demonic. My parents were so cool - they saw it as a form of self-expression.
quotes.author: Jessica Biel

quotes.text: The tree that is beside the running water is fresher and gives more fruit.
quotes.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quotes.text: Music was your real passion, this thing you held dear even above family. It was this relationship that never betrayed you. Once it became your job - this thing that was highly visible, this thing that became about commerce - that's when you were holding onto music like it was a palm tree in a hurricane.
quotes.author: Eddie Vedder

quotes.text: We are born believing. A man bears beliefs as a tree bears apples.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: If you look closely at a tree you'll notice it's knots and dead branches, just like our bodies. What we learn is that beauty and imperfection go together wonderfully.
quotes.author: Matthew Fox

quotes.text: A few minutes ago every tree was excited, bowing to the roaring storm, waving, swirling, tossing their branches in glorious enthusiasm like worship. But though to the outer ear these trees are now silent, their songs never cease.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.text: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.
quotes.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quotes.text: I never saw a discontented tree. They grip the ground as though they liked it, and though fast rooted they travel about as far as we do.
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.text: The tree which moves some to tears of joy is in the eyes of others only a green thing that stands in the way. Some see nature all ridicule and deformity... and some scarce see nature at all. But to the eyes of the man of imagination, nature is imagination itself.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: I was interested in variations in temperatures of the oceans over the past millennium. But there are no records of these changes so I had to find proxy measures: coral growth, ice cores and tree rings.
quotes.author: Michael E. Mann

quotes.text: There does not exist a category of science to which one can give the name applied science. There are science and the applications of science, bound together as the fruit of the tree which bears it.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.text: Now I'm an old Christmas tree, the roots of which have died. They just come along and while the little needles fall off me replace them with medallions.
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.text: Humanity is the rich effluvium, it is the waste and the manure and the soil, and from it grows the tree of the arts.
quotes.author: Ezra Pound

quotes.text: Know your priorities and identify the five powerful action steps that you intend to take to move your initiatives forward each day. If you go to a tree with an ax and take five whacks at the tree every day, it doesn't matter if it's an oak or a redwood; eventually, the tree has to fall down.
quotes.author: Jack Canfield

quotes.text: There's something about the Pacific Northwest, the scale of it, and the fact that not so long ago people came here and died getting here, and then died the first winter they were here. There's this breathtaking beauty, just a little bit of moss on the tree, just this little thread of danger, and the sinister. And I really like that.
quotes.author: Chelsea Cain

quotes.text: You can't sow an apple seed and expect to get an avocado tree. The consequences of your life are sown in what you do and how you behave.
quotes.author: Tom Shadyac

quotes.text: When you live in the shadow of a big tree, you have to run twice as fast to get into the sunlight.
quotes.author: Leonard Lauder

quotes.text: Art is the tree of life. Science is the tree of death.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: My brothers and sisters, may the spirit of love which comes at Christmastime fill our homes and our lives and linger there long after the tree is down and the lights are put away for another year.
quotes.author: Thomas S. Monson

quotes.text: Once something has outlived its usefulness in one area of life, its purpose for being in existence is no longer the same. The leaf that captures a stream of sunlight, and then transfers its energy to the tree, serves one purpose in the spring and summer, and another completely different one through the fall and winter.
quotes.author: Guy Finley

quotes.text: To campaign against colonialism is like barking up a tree that has already been cut down.
quotes.author: Andrew Cohen

quotes.text: The only thing that ultimately matters is to eat an ice-cream cone, play a slide trombone, plant a small tree, good God, now you're free.
quotes.author: Ray Manzarek

quotes.text: The ripest peach is highest on the tree.
quotes.author: James Whitcomb Riley

quotes.text: I think that intelligence is such a narrow branch of the tree of life - this branch of primates we call humans. No other animal, by our definition, can be considered intelligent. So intelligence can't be all that important for survival, because there are so many animals that don't have what we call intelligence, and they're surviving just fine.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: One that would have the fruit must climb the tree.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.text: As the twig is bent the tree inclines.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.text: A hypocrite is the kind of politician who would cut down a redwood tree, then mount the stump and make a speech for conservation.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quotes.text: Faith is salted and peppered through everything at Christmas. And I love at least one night by the Christmas tree to sing and feel the quiet holiness of that time that's set apart to celebrate love, friendship, and God's gift of the Christ child.
quotes.author: Amy Grant

quotes.text: You must grow like a tree, not like a mushroom.
quotes.author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quotes.text: Every crag and gnarled tree and lonely valley has its own strange and graceful legend attached to it.
quotes.author: Douglas Hyde

quotes.text: All religions, arts and sciences are branches of the same tree.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: It is remarkable how closely the history of the apple tree is connected with that of man.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: One of my earliest memories is walking up a muddy road into the mountains. It was raining. Behind me, my village was burning. When there was school, it was under a tree. Then the United Nations came. They fed me, my family, my community.
quotes.author: Ban Ki-moon

quotes.text: A fool sees not the same tree that a wise man sees.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: Rice is great if you're really hungry and want to eat two thousand of something.
quotes.author: Mitch Hedberg

quotes.text: When I was 5 years old, we had nothing in the village. One day, in front of my house, some soldiers in a big Cadillac started to do a picnic. I looked at them like they were coming from the moon. I remember they gave me a box of rice pudding - that, for me, was the American Dream.
quotes.author: Renzo Rosso

quotes.text: Real nutrition comes from soybeans, almonds, rice, and other healthy vegetable sources, not from a cow's udder.
quotes.author: Ingrid Newkirk

quotes.text: All the food we eat - every grain of rice and kernel of corn - has been genetically modified. None of it was here before mankind learned to cultivate crops. The question isn't whether our food has been modified, but how.
quotes.author: Michael Specter

quotes.text: Rice cakes and peanut butter is my favorite snack in the whole wide world.
quotes.author: Maggie Lawson

quotes.text: I saw Damien Rice in Dublin when I was 13, and that inspired me to want to pursue being a songwriter... I practised relentlessly and started recording my own EPs. At 16, I moved to London and played any gigs I could, selling CDs from my rucksack to fund recording the next, and it snowballed from there.
quotes.author: Ed Sheeran

quotes.text: I like to make Arroz con Gandules, rice with pigeon peas. My husband loves it. It's a Puerto Rican dish my mother taught me.
quotes.author: Essence Atkins

quotes.text: I knew more about produce from the sea than any of my schoolmates, and my reports in school, from kindergarten on, amused and shocked my classmates and teachers. I told them how we ate with chopsticks, had rice and seaweed for breakfast, raw fish, octopus, and sea urchin eggs for supper, and cakes made from sharks.
quotes.author: Eugenie Clark

quotes.text: Whether we like it or not, we are high-profile athletes. We're role models. Kids come up to me all the time to talk and it makes me remember when I was a kid and I got to meet Jerry Rice and how much that meant to me. And how we've got to set a good example.
quotes.author: Jonathan Vilma

quotes.text: The American dream is a crock. Stop wanting everything. Everyone should wear jeans and have three T-shirts, eat rice and beans.
quotes.author: Bill Hicks

quotes.text: I wasn't eating the right kinds of calories. I didn't know about healthy carbs such as brown rice and lentils. Now I eat small meals throughout the day: oatmeal with cinnamon to start, fruit and yogurt as a snack, and vegetables or with chicken or tuna, and a healthy carb, like a yam, for lunch.
quotes.author: Alison Sweeney

quotes.text: As young West Point cadets, our motto was 'duty, honor, country.' But it was in the field, from the rice paddies of Southeast Asia to the sands of the Middle East, that I learned that motto's fullest meaning. There I saw gallant young Americans of every race, creed and background fight, and sometimes die, for 'duty, honor, and their country.'
quotes.author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quotes.text: My most memorable meal is every Thanksgiving. I love the food: the turkey and stuffing; the sweet potatoes and rice, which come from my mother's Southern heritage; the mashed potatoes, which come from my wife's Midwestern roots; the Campbell's green-bean casserole; and of course, pumpkin pie.
quotes.author: Douglas Conant

quotes.text: I always felt like an outsider growing up. In school, I felt like I never fit in. But it didn't help when my mother, instead of buying me glue for school projects, would tell me to just use rice.
quotes.author: Margaret Cho

quotes.text: My best nutrition tip is to eat things you like that are low in calories and fat. Some of my favorites are chicken, rice, assorted veggies, egg white omelets, turkey sandwiches and protein shakes.
quotes.author: Nate Holland

quotes.text: It's quite amazing to me, as I walk around a supermarket or a health food shop, to observe the number of Fairtrade choices: not just staples such as coffee, tea, fresh fruits and rice, but cocoa and chocolate, herbs and spices, honey, ice cream, and jams.
quotes.author: Sheherazade Goldsmith

quotes.text: I like both potatoes and rice. You can do a lot with both of them. But if I could eat only one carbohydrate for the rest of my life, I wouldn't choose bread, potatoes or even noodles. I'd go for rice instead; I eat more of that than anything else.
quotes.author: Nobu Matsuhisa

quotes.text: I am a believer in nutrient timing and supplementation, through 8Zone. I love eggs, apples, wild fish, leafy greens, brown rice, pasta, oatmeal, home grown Washington Potatoes, and cooking with coconut and olive oils.
quotes.author: Apolo Ohno

quotes.text: Eroticism bubbles beneath the surface of every vampire story, but Anne Rice is a writer to make the pot boil.
quotes.author: Janet Maslin

quotes.text: My dad for a long time was an accounting professor at Rice University. And then he went out on his own, and he got hired by a client. He ended up being CEO of a hospital management company before he retired, called Lifemark.
quotes.author: John Mackey

quotes.text: This sounds like a brag, but I know how to make good fried rice. I learned in college. There are two secrets - take the rice after you cook it and let it get cold in the fridge. Then cook the egg like you're making a fried egg and just before it's done, dump the rice and veg on it and swirl it around.
quotes.author: Patton Oswalt

quotes.text: When I'm doing a movie, I eat the same thing every day. For lunch, it's tuna salad or chicken salad and cole slaw. That's it. For dinner it's either veal and rice, fish and rice or steak and rice. It gets boring; boy, does it get boring.
quotes.author: Sylvester Stallone

quotes.text: November is auspicious in so many parts of the country: the rice harvest is already in, the weather starts to cool, and the festive glow which precedes Christmas has began to brighten the landscape.
quotes.author: F. Sionil Jose

quotes.text: Thanh Hoa itself is a rich agricultural province. Rice fields, a pattern of many shades of green, stretch far into the distance along the road, which also winds through foothills and the fringes of heavy jungle where tigers are said to roam. The vegetation, wild or cultivated, is lush.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.text: When I cook for my family on Christmas, I make feijoada, a South American dish of roasted and smoked meats like ham, pork, beef, lamb, and bacon - all served with black beans and rice. It's festive but different.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: I'm a professional non-fiction reader, that's what I do. But in my 20s we had our own vampire and witch moment, courtesy of Anne Rice, whose books I read and loved.
quotes.author: Deborah Harkness

quotes.text: Don't dunk your nigiri in the soy sauce. Don't mix your wasabi in the soy sauce. If the rice is good, complement your sushi chef on the rice.
quotes.author: Anthony Bourdain

quotes.text: I eat nothing that's processed or refined - no high-fructose corn syrup, no sugar, no trans-fats. I eat a lot of fish and monounsaturated fats from olives, olive oil and nuts. A lot of organic, fresh fruits and vegetables. No bread. No gluten. No wheat. No rice.
quotes.author: Dean Karnazes

quotes.text: She's been married so many times she has rice marks on her face.
quotes.author: Henny Youngman

quotes.text: I eat everything, that's a problem. I don't have discipline. My favorite dish is the Caribbean. Meat, rice, lots of grains. But I do like to do exercises. Lately, I've been having capoeira classes and lots of cardiovascular exercises, such as jogging and cycling.
quotes.author: Ricky Martin

quotes.text: I found that when I went from Albany to Savannah, that I needed to put that white rice away, and I needed to turn that into Savannah red rice because they were big into that sausage, tomato-y, bell pepper-y rice mixture.
quotes.author: Paula Deen

quotes.text: Chicken, brown rice, and veggies is a great healthy dinner option. It's full of whole grains and protein, and will keep you full for a long time.
quotes.author: Mia Hamm

quotes.text: I have my meals delivered... you know what I like? Chicken and rice... But the problem with being a defensive lineman is, if we get out of hand with our eating, we balloon up to, like, 300-some pounds. So I really got to watch what I eat.
quotes.author: Hugh Douglas

quotes.text: I love eating it - grilled chicken, pasta, rice, and other foods that give me long term energy. Every once in a while, my sweet tooth gets the best of me and I have to snack on some candy. Beverage wise, I stick to sports drinks, water, milk, and juice.
quotes.author: Derrick Rose

quotes.text: A small pepperoni pizza on a tortilla is healthier than salmon teriyaki with rice and carrots.
quotes.author: Jorge Cruise

quotes.text: I remember once I had lunch with George W Bush, his father, and Condoleezza Rice. Then I went home to find my dog and my neighbour's dog fighting over a dead rabbit, and I had to separate them. I like that my home life keeps things real.
quotes.author: Jeff Kinney

quotes.text: The cheapest gadget - and you don't even have to spend a dime - is chopsticks from a Chinese restaurant. I use them for everything: to toss salads, to turn a piece of meat in the pan, to flip croquettes in the Fryolator, to whisk eggs for omelets, to stir eggs into fried rice when I make that for my daughters.
quotes.author: Jose Andres

quotes.text: American society to me and my brother was thrilling because, first of all, the food made noise. We were so excited about Rice Krispies and Coca-Cola. We had only silent food in our country, and we loved listening to our lunch and breakfast.
quotes.author: Mike Nichols

quotes.text: I eat the same foods almost every day. I have my favorites like Filipino beef broth, chicken soup with lots and lots of rice.
quotes.author: Manny Pacquiao

quotes.text: The combination of lentils with rice or bulgur is the absolute height of Levantine comfort food. I could eat it every day.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: I think the Canadian Football League is a great league, but it's not the NFL, and I'm not Jerry Rice.
quotes.author: Darren Flutie

quotes.text: It was my love for the guitar that first got me into music and singing. Growing up, I was inspired by The Beatles and Bob Dylan. Damian Rice was a huge influence for me musically.
quotes.author: Ed Sheeran

quotes.text: I always have really fresh, hormone-free, additive-free chicken, healthy veggies, and brown rice in the fridge to grab because I'm always on the go.
quotes.author: Laura Prepon

quotes.text: My husband is such a healthy eater. Except when it comes to sweets. He never consumes anything except fruit until noon. And then from noon on he might have some brown rice and some tofu, and then, come eight or nine at night, he orders three mud-pie double-chocolate pieces of cake and eats all three of them.
quotes.author: Sara Blakely

quotes.text: Dr. Rice went well beyond offering a helping hand - she went so far as to shed tears and share hugs with those who, in a matter of just a few hours, had lost everything to the rising floodwaters.
quotes.author: Jo Bonner

quotes.text: When I went to visit this rice cake plant, I hadn't realized how the rice cakes were made. As soon as I saw the molds of rice and how the heat pops it like popcorn, the light bulb went off. This is popped. This isn't baked or fried.
quotes.author: Keith Belling

quotes.text: In 1991, only two years into the Bush administration, Condoleezza Rice suddenly left her powerful job as the top Russia expert on the National Security Council and went back to California - to get a life.
quotes.author: Elaine Sciolino

quotes.text: I can't eat beans - all beans. I think because I'm half Cuban. So growing up, we were always eating black beans and rice, and I think I just said, 'Enough with it,' and I can't even stand to taste it anymore.
quotes.author: Ryan Lochte

quotes.text: Eating rice cakes is like chewing on a foam coffee cup, only less filling.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.text: Polenta is to northern Italy what bread is to Tuscany, what pasta is to Emilia-Romagna and what rice is to the Veneto: easy to make, hungry to absorb other flavours, and hugely versatile.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: Herein lies our problem. If we level that much land to grow rice and whatever, then no other animal could live there except for some insect pest species. Which is very unfortunate.
quotes.author: Steve Irwin

quotes.text: Me, sexy? I'm just plain ol' beans and rice.
quotes.author: Pam Grier

quotes.text: The true reason of Ms. Rice's attack against Russia is very simple. Condoleezza Rice is a very cruel, offended woman who lacks men's attention.
quotes.author: Vladimir Zhirinovsky

quotes.text: Potatoes are popped, with no oil, using the same technology used in the rice cake manufacturing business. It took a lot of trial and error and lots of practice, though, to get the right flavor.
quotes.author: Keith Belling

quotes.text: The first thing I do whenever I go to Thailand is seek out the closest restaurant or stall selling mango-and-sticky rice: it's a little hillock of glutinous rice drenched in lashings of coconut milk and served with fresh mango.
quotes.author: Hanya Yanagihara

quotes.text: Dinner is often a stew of beans or legumes, which are awesome for dieting; they give you that meaty satisfaction and both are excellent with whole grain rice or bread.
quotes.author: Nadia Giosia

quotes.text: I think with 'Chunky Rice,' it felt novel to me to give this emo twist on these funny animals.
quotes.author: Craig Thompson

quotes.text: During the past three years spectacular progress has been made in increasing wheat, rice, and maize production in several of the most populous developing countries of southern Asia, where widespread famine appeared inevitable only five years ago.
quotes.author: Norman Borlaug

quotes.text: I like beans. Lentils are beans, right? I love beans and rice.
quotes.author: Prince Fielder

quotes.text: With sushi, it is all about balance. Sometimes they cut the fish too thick, sometimes too thin. Often the rice is overcooked or undercooked. Not enough rice vinegar or too much.
quotes.author: Nobu Matsuhisa

quotes.text: Haitian rice farmers are quite efficient, but they can't compete with U.S. agribusiness that relies on a huge government subsidy, thanks to Ronald Reagan's free market enthusiasms.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.text: Black glutinous rice works in both savoury and sweet dishes. It's a popular pudding rice in south-east Asia, where you'll often come across it cooked with water, coconut milk and a pandan leaf.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: Chinese sausage, which is widely available from Asian grocers and online, is sweet, rich, and enticingly smoky. I add it to steamed rice with strips of omelette and a few baby veg stir-fried with soy.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: I get great pleasure from stuffed foods, from an apple strudel to a vegetable samosa, from a whole roasted bird with a sweet and savoury stuffing to a vine leaf filled with rice and spices.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: Rice and vermicelli is a common combination in Arab and Turkish cooking - it has a lighter texture than rice on its own.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: I love using rice as a flour; I'll grind roasted rice and dip fish in that. It gives a beautiful, crunchy texture.
quotes.author: Marcus Samuelsson

quotes.text: I've been a longtime admirer of Condoleezza Rice, because I like her articulateness and style - her toughness and rigor.
quotes.author: Camille Paglia

quotes.text: Go where your customers take you! For example, did you know that Sony's first product was a rice cooker? Since abandoning the rice cooker, it has merely managed to become the world's biggest consumer electronics company.
quotes.author: Naveen Jain

quotes.text: Growing up, I was inspired by The Beatles and Bob Dylan. Damian Rice was a huge influence for me musically.
quotes.author: Ed Sheeran

quotes.text: I love to cook comfort food. I'll make fish and vegetables or meat and vegetables and potatoes or rice. The ritual of it is fun for me, and the creativity of it.
quotes.author: Reese Witherspoon

quotes.text: Instead of trying crazy diets now, I just live by a few easy rules: I try to stay away from white flour as much as I can - I go for grains and brown rice instead, and I pick lean meats, like chicken or turkey, over red meat most of the time.
quotes.author: Jenna Ushkowitz

quotes.text: The dirty little secret is that I grew up in a household where there were no carbohydrates allowed, ever. No cookies, no bread, no potatoes, no rice. My mother was very extreme in terms of what she served. Since I left home more than 40 years ago, I've been making it right for myself.
quotes.author: Ina Garten

quotes.text: Carbohydrates, and especially refined ones like sugar, make you produce lots of extra insulin. I've been keeping my intake really low ever since I discovered this. I've cut out all starch such as potatoes, noodles, rice, bread and pasta.
quotes.author: Cynthia Kenyon

quotes.text: My mother likes what I cook, but doesn't think it's French. My wife is Puerto Rican and Cuban, so I eat rice and beans. We have a place in Mexico, but people think I'm the quintessential French chef.
quotes.author: Jacques Pepin

quotes.text: Note the three most important Cabinet positions. Rice said that it was better to find the weapons of mass destruction than to see a mushroom cloud.
quotes.author: Andrew Greeley

quotes.text: I'm vegetarian and stick to a strict health regime of brown rice, tofu, salads and soya milk. When I'm at home in Somerset, I buy almost everything in the local farmshops including Barleymow's in Chard. I always get organic - I like happy hens.
quotes.author: Kate O'Mara

quotes.text: You'll remember Dr. Rice said that several times: It was not a warning about the place and the method and the time - it was a general warning. And that points out the imperfection, if you would, of our intelligence.
quotes.author: Lee H. Hamilton

quotes.text: For a quick, healthy meal that's also fun for kids, I serve fish tacos: soft tortillas, lettuce, tomatoes, black beans and brown rice.
quotes.author: Kim Raver

quotes.text: By the second tour I had rice cakes and hummus with me, and I was jumping rope in my room.
quotes.author: Taylor Dayne

quotes.text: You should hear what my parents wanted to call me. It was between Brown Rice, Neon Hitch and Z. Ziggurat Zanzibar Zandorf. I'm not joking. Imagine fitting that on my passport!
quotes.author: Neon Hitch

quotes.text: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.text: Our Lord has written the promise of resurrection, not in books alone, but in every leaf in springtime.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.text: October is the fallen leaf, but it is also a wider horizon more clearly seen. It is the distant hills once more in sight, and the enduring constellations above them once again.
quotes.author: Hal Borland

quotes.text: Every time you tear a leaf off a calendar, you present a new place for new ideas and progress.
quotes.author: Charles Kettering

quotes.text: Matisse draws what I call the essence of the plants. He leaves a shape open. He'll do a leaf and not close it. Everybody used to say, oh, I got it all from Matisse, and I said, 'Not really.'
quotes.author: Ellsworth Kelly

quotes.text: Never say there is nothing beautiful in the world anymore. There is always something to make you wonder in the shape of a tree, the trembling of a leaf.
quotes.author: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.text: I turn over a new leaf every day. But the blots show through.
quotes.author: Keith Waterhouse

quotes.text: I think there is a certain charm to the hand drawn image that I like. My problem with CGI is that it's so rich in texture that my eyes actually get tired. Everything is in focus down to the littlest leaf.
quotes.author: Matt Groening

quotes.text: Tiles, the best furniture, fabrics, bath fixtures, bronze - just leaf through any design magazine and you immediately understand they're all 'Made in Italy.' We have the premier opera house in the world, La Scala, and behind the Nobel given to CERN is the research of many Italians.
quotes.author: Lapo Elkann

quotes.text: When the wind blows through a wood, its mass is cut and closed by every leaf, forming a train of jittery vortices in the air.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: As with all my work, whether it's a leaf on a rock or ice on a rock, I'm trying to get beneath the surface appearance of things. Working the surface of a stone is an attempt to understand the internal energy of the stone.
quotes.author: Andy Goldsworthy

quotes.text: Animals come from nature. They were not designed. All my inspiration comes from nature, whether it's an animal or the layout of bark or of a leaf. Sometimes my patterns are very bold, and you can barely see where they come from, but all the textures and all the prints come out of nature.
quotes.author: Diane von Furstenberg

quotes.text: Once something has outlived its usefulness in one area of life, its purpose for being in existence is no longer the same. The leaf that captures a stream of sunlight, and then transfers its energy to the tree, serves one purpose in the spring and summer, and another completely different one through the fall and winter.
quotes.author: Guy Finley

quotes.text: There's design, and there's art. Good design is total harmony. There's no better designer than nature - if you look at a branch or a leaf, it's perfect. It's all function. Art is different. It's about emotion. It's about suffering and beauty - but mostly suffering!
quotes.author: Diane von Furstenberg

quotes.text: Every particular in nature, a leaf, a drop, a crystal, a moment of time is related to the whole, and partakes of the perfection of the whole.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: I just loved going fast. So I started out with Alka-Seltzer and soda water in a bottle and attached it to the skateboard. That didn't do much. I would try a leaf blower. I was searching for anything that would go fast. Then, the lawnmower engine.
quotes.author: Kellan Lutz

quotes.text: First I shake the whole Apple tree, that the ripest might fall. Then I climb the tree and shake each limb, and then each branch and then each twig, and then I look under each leaf.
quotes.author: Martin Luther

quotes.text: Instead of drifting along like a leaf in a river, understand who you are and how you come across to people and what kind of an impact you have on the people around you and the community around you and the world, so that when you go out, you can feel you have made a positive difference.
quotes.author: Jane Fonda

quotes.text: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
quotes.author: Vusi Mahlasela

quotes.text: My coming to faith did not start with a leap but rather a series of staggers from what seemed like one safe place to another. Like lily pads, round and green, these places summoned and then held me up while I grew. Each prepared me for the next leaf on which I would land, and in this way I moved across the swamp of doubt and fear.
quotes.author: Anne Lamott

quotes.text: One of the great lessons the fall of the leaf teaches, is this: do your work well and then be ready to depart when God shall call.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.text: There are three types of biomimicry - one is copying form and shape, another is copying a process, like photosynthesis in a leaf, and the third is mimicking at an ecosystem's level, like building a nature-inspired city.
quotes.author: Janine Benyus

quotes.text: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: If you bend a branch until it's horizontal, the sap will slow to a stopping point: a comma or colon, made of leaves grown into one another and over one another and hardened. Out of this pause comes a flower, which unfolds itself in spirals, as if the leaf form, unable to keep to its line, had begun to pivot.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: If a leaf fell from a tree, I'd stop juggling and play with the leaf. I went to my prop bag and got a little bandage and stuck the leaf back on the tree. People loved it.
quotes.author: Philippe Petit

quotes.text: From the moment I wrote 'Leaf Storm' I realized I wanted to be a writer and that nobody could stop me and that the only thing left for me to do was to try to be the best writer in the world.
quotes.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quotes.text: I never leaf through a copy of National Geographic without realizing how lucky we are to live in a society where it is traditional to wear clothes.
quotes.author: Erma Bombeck

quotes.text: Under the big political umbrella, a man is just like a leaf in the ocean, with no control of his destiny and does not have any choice.
quotes.author: Zhang Yimou

quotes.text: We need to take a leaf out of nature's book. Any species that clones itself will eventually be attacked by a parasite, leading to an inevitable population crash.
quotes.author: Daniel Suarez

quotes.text: When I'm writing, I am concentrating almost wholly on concrete detail: the color a room is painted, the way a drop of water rolls off a wet leaf after a rain.
quotes.author: Donna Tartt

quotes.text: A leaf fluttered in through the window this morning, as if supported by the rays of the sun, a bird settled on the fire escape, joy in the task of coffee, joy accompanied me as I walked.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.text: If you look at any leaf on any tree branch, it's similar to but not exactly a repetition of the previous branch. So the new science of complexity or showing how an architecture can be produced just as quickly, cheaply and efficiently by using computer production methods to get the slight variation, the self-similarity.
quotes.author: Charles Jencks

quotes.text: The harsh truth is, most red-haired men look like blondes who've spoiled from lack of refrigeration. They look like brown-haired men who've been composted out behind the barn. Yet that same pigmentation that on a man can resemble leaf mold or junkyard rust, a woman wears like a tiara of rubies.
quotes.author: Tom Robbins

quotes.text: Leaf fans loyalty is unshakeable. The fans keep coming back and it hurts, I have been there. I have lost in game six to go to the finals with the Maple Leafs, against Carolina and what a great final that would have been.
quotes.author: Curtis Joseph

quotes.text: We will all, someday, experience death, and become obsolete as a dead leaf falling from a tree, crushed by passersby to ashes underlying the earth.
quotes.author: Kim Elizabeth

quotes.text: I and others like me believe Timerman was chosen by President Kirshner, first as Argentina's U.N. ambassador and then as foreign minister, among other reasons because he does not hide his Jewishness and his relations with the Jewish community and, therefore, can be a 'fig leaf' for her policy.
quotes.author: Pepe Eliaschev

quotes.text: I like Toronto a lot, it's a good city. The only thing that really annoys me about Toronto is that you're turning Maple Leaf Gardens into a grocery store, which is absolutely nothing short of disgusting.
quotes.author: Rick Wakeman

quotes.text: Let the winds of evidence blow you about as though you are a leaf, with no direction of your own. Beware lest you fight a rearguard retreat against the evidence, grudgingly conceding each foot of ground only when forced, feeling cheated. Surrender to the truth as quickly as you can.
quotes.author: Eliezer Yudkowsky

quotes.text: I'm the kind of person who would have liked to have lived at the Plaza. I love crystal chandeliers and gold leaf, velvets and mirrors, Oriental rugs and marble.
quotes.author: Candace Bushnell

quotes.text: I started experimenting with jewelry in my 20s - I was playing around with gemstones and painting things in gold leaf, and it turned into this huge obsession for me, so I launched my first jewelry line, Jade Inc.
quotes.author: Jade Jagger

quotes.text: Faith makes all evil good to us, and all good better; unbelief makes all good evil, and all evil worse. Faith laughs at the shaking of the spear; unbelief trembles at the shaking of a leaf.
quotes.author: Robert Cecil

quotes.text: I suppose no person ever enjoyed with more relish the infusion of this fragrant leaf than did Johnson.
quotes.author: James Boswell

quotes.text: Once you change the technology - from a film camera to a video camera, or from an 8-mm camera to 16 mm - you change completely the content. With 8 mm, a leaf on a tree will be made up of maybe four grains. So it's very impressionistic, almost like Seurat. If you switch to 16 mm, the technology gives you hundreds of grains on that leaf.
quotes.author: Jonas Mekas

quotes.text: The type of fig leaf which each culture employs to cover its social taboos offers a twofold description of its morality. It reveals that certain unacknowledged behavior exists and it suggests the form that such behavior takes.
quotes.author: Freda Adler

quotes.text: This is a coca leaf. This is not cocaine. This represents the culture of indigenous people of the Andean region.
quotes.author: Evo Morales

quotes.text: If you put a real leaf and a silk leaf side by side, you'll see something of the difference between Homer's poetry and anyone else's. There seem to be real leaves still alive in the 'Iliad,' real animals, real people, real light attending everything.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: Gary Cooper was a good friend. He was a great nature lover. He was like an American Indian, he knew every leaf that was turned over. It was an education to go for a walk with him.
quotes.author: Richard Widmark

quotes.text: Black glutinous rice works in both savoury and sweet dishes. It's a popular pudding rice in south-east Asia, where you'll often come across it cooked with water, coconut milk and a pandan leaf.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: I get great pleasure from stuffed foods, from an apple strudel to a vegetable samosa, from a whole roasted bird with a sweet and savoury stuffing to a vine leaf filled with rice and spices.
quotes.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.text: A big tree seemed even more beautiful to me when I imagined thousands of tiny photosynthesis machines inside every leaf. So I went to MIT and worked on bacteria because that's where people knew the most about these switches, how to control the genetics.
quotes.author: Cynthia Kenyon

quotes.text: I've never turned over a fig leaf yet that didn't have a price tag on the other side.
quotes.author: Saul Bellow

quotes.text: As the country now turns a new leaf, our ambition is to give hope to each and every Afghan.
quotes.author: Hamid Karzai

quotes.text: Home ownership was the fig leaf for the rise in subprime lending. But that was really about cash-out refinancings, not buying homes.
quotes.author: Bethany McLean

quotes.text: I have a maple leaf tattoo over my heart, quite literally, and my two favorite things on Earth are being in Canada and making movies.
quotes.author: Jay Baruchel

quotes.text: My end goal in the piano is to play Scott Joplin's 'Maple Leaf Rag.'
quotes.author: Miranda Leek

quotes.text: I used to not be really honest with girls and then I dropped a song called 'Starry Room' and then I started turning over a new leaf.
quotes.author: Jaden Smith

quotes.text: Ryan Leaf is doing great now. If he progresses the way he is now, we're going to have a quarterback that's going to be reckoned with in the near future. And that's not political.
quotes.author: Junior Seau

quotes.text: I type most of my books for the first chapter or two - I use a manual typewriter for the first 50 pages or so - and then I move to the computer. It helps me keep the work lean so I don't end up spending 10 pages describing a leaf.
quotes.author: James McBride

quotes.text: I especially remember that on All Souls Day, when so many people wanted new monuments for the graves, our whole family pitched in. I did the lettering on the stones, my brother did the carving, and my sisters put the finishing touches on them, the gold leaf and all that.
quotes.author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quotes.text: I think that the leaf of a tree, the meanest insect on which we trample, are in themselves arguments more conclusive than any which can be adduced that some vast intellect animates Infinity.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: Sometimes the buzz of reading about others eating comes from the voyeuristic thrill of seeing how the other half lives: the gold leaf and truffles or - in the case of Trimalchio's feast in Petronius' 'Satyricon' - the dormice and honey.
quotes.author: Bee Wilson

quotes.text: You can assume that the leaf you see let go of a branch and fall towards the ground has never been considered by any being but yourself. Catch it in your hand - or, even better, keep walking until one falls into your reach naturally - and it will have spent its whole time on the planet without ever touching the ground, only because of you.
quotes.author: Eliot Schrefer

quotes.text: The United States can't keep a completely open system if the rest of the world is less open. The United States may have to take a leaf out of the book of Japan, China, and Germany, and have protectionism inside the system.
quotes.author: Robert Mundell

quotes.text: Someone made me a Leaf Coneybear finger puppet. Someone made me a portrait of me on some chocolate. I'm keeping it. I daren't eat such a work of art. It's so unique and so fun that fans do that. It's incredibly flattering. I like it when people spend time on me. People don't spend the same amount of time on my brother who's an insurance broker.
quotes.author: Barrett Foa

quotes.text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
quotes.author: Jimmy Dean

quotes.text: Life is full of beauty. Notice it. Notice the bumble bee, the small child, and the smiling faces. Smell the rain, and feel the wind. Live your life to the fullest potential, and fight for your dreams.
quotes.author: Ashley Smith

quotes.text: You must take personal responsibility. You cannot change the circumstances, the seasons, or the wind, but you can change yourself. That is something you have charge of.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: The three great elemental sounds in nature are the sound of rain, the sound of wind in a primeval wood, and the sound of outer ocean on a beach.
quotes.author: Henry Beston

quotes.text: I love the feeling of the fresh air on my face and the wind blowing through my hair.
quotes.author: Evel Knievel

quotes.text: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

quotes.text: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: Just imagine becoming the way you used to be as a very young child, before you understood the meaning of any word, before opinions took over your mind. The real you is loving, joyful, and free. The real you is just like a flower, just like the wind, just like the ocean, just like the sun.
quotes.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quotes.text: The fragrance of flowers spreads only in the direction of the wind. But the goodness of a person spreads in all directions.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.text: Words empty as the wind are best left unsaid.
quotes.author: Homer

quotes.text: There is an urgent need to stop subsidizing the fossil fuel industry, dramatically reduce wasted energy, and significantly shift our power supplies from oil, coal, and natural gas to wind, solar, geothermal, and other renewable energy sources.
quotes.author: Bill McKibben

quotes.text: A wind has blown the rain away and blown the sky away and all the leaves away, and the trees stand. I think, I too, have known autumn too long.
quotes.author: e. e. cummings

quotes.text: Political language... is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.text: Sunshine is delicious, rain is refreshing, wind braces us up, snow is exhilarating; there is really no such thing as bad weather, only different kinds of good weather.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.text: The older you get the stronger the wind gets - and it's always in your face.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: With all the knowledge and skill acquired in thousands of flights in the last ten years, I would hardly think today of making my first flight on a strange machine in a twenty-seven mile wind, even if I knew that the machine had already been flown and was safe.
quotes.author: Orville Wright

quotes.text: The elements and majestic forces in nature, Lightning, Wind, Water, Fire, and Frost, were regarded with awe as spiritual powers, but always secondary and intermediate in character.
quotes.author: Charles Eastman

quotes.text: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
quotes.author: Augustus Hare

quotes.text: Yes, you can lose somebody overnight, yes, your whole life can be turned upside down. Life is short. It can come and go like a feather in the wind.
quotes.author: Shania Twain

quotes.text: If you don't know where you are going, you might wind up someplace else.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.text: Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind extinguishes candles and fans fires.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.text: Notice that the stiffest tree is most easily cracked, while the bamboo or willow survives by bending with the wind.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.text: Israel welcomes the wind of change, and sees a window of opportunity. Democratic and science-based economies by nature desire peace. Israel does not want to be an island of affluence in an ocean of poverty. Improvements in our neighbours' lives mean improvements to the neighbourhood in which we live.
quotes.author: Shimon Peres

quotes.text: Though the sex to which I belong is considered weak you will nevertheless find me a rock that bends to no wind.
quotes.author: Elizabeth I

quotes.text: The autumn wind is a pirate. Blustering in from sea with a rollicking song he sweeps along swaggering boisterously. His face is weather beaten, he wears a hooded sash with a silver hat about his head... The autumn wind is a Raider, pillaging just for fun.
quotes.author: Steve Sabol

quotes.text: What, nephew, said the king, is the wind in that door?
quotes.author: Thomas Malory

quotes.text: I don't trust Santa Barbara as far as I can spit. I am afraid that if I went back there, it's possible that I could be run through their system, their judicial system, and wind up in some county jail where I could be killed and I'm not gonna take that chance.
quotes.author: Randy Quaid

quotes.text: A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man. Kites rise against, not with, the wind.
quotes.author: Lewis Mumford

quotes.text: A light wind swept over the corn, and all nature laughed in the sunshine.
quotes.author: Anne Bronte

quotes.text: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
quotes.author: Johannes Brahms

quotes.text: You can drive an SUV, but there's a balance. If you do that, maybe use energy-efficient light bulbs at home or just be conscious of switching off lights. If you can afford to drive an SUV, maybe you can afford to make a donation to a wind farm or plant some trees. It's all about balance.
quotes.author: Orlando Bloom

quotes.text: I was on vacation with my family when I got the scripts for 'Wanderlust' and I was trying to work on the audition while I was on vacation. I remember a big gust of wind blew the entire script into the pool, so I had to dry it with a hairdryer.
quotes.author: Kathryn Hahn

quotes.text: Thought is the wind and knowledge the sail.
quotes.author: David Hare

quotes.text: Wind to a sailor is what money is to life on shore.
quotes.author: Sterling Hayden

quotes.text: What we need to do is always lean into the future; when the world changes around you and when it changes against you - what used to be a tail wind is now a head wind - you have to lean into that and figure out what to do because complaining isn't a strategy.
quotes.author: Jeff Bezos

quotes.text: The first rule of hurricane coverage is that every broadcast must begin with palm trees bending in the wind.
quotes.author: Carl Hiaasen

quotes.text: A clear cold morning with high wind: we caught in a trap a large gray wolf, and last night obtained in the same way a fox who had for some time infested the neighbourhood of the fort.
quotes.author: Meriwether Lewis

quotes.text: I still get wildly enthusiastic about little things... I play with leaves. I skip down the street and run against the wind.
quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.text: When was the last time you spent a quiet moment just doing nothing - just sitting and looking at the sea, or watching the wind blowing the tree limbs, or waves rippling on a pond, a flickering candle or children playing in the park?
quotes.author: Ralph Marston

quotes.text: I find the great thing in this world is not so much where we stand, as in what direction we are moving: To reach the port of heaven, we must sail sometimes with the wind and sometimes against it, but we must sail, and not drift, nor lie at anchor.
quotes.author: Marjorie Holmes

quotes.text: If there's a pregnancy rumor, people will find out it's not true when you wind up not being pregnant, like nine months from now, and if there's a house rumor, they'll find out it's not true when you are actively not ever spotted at that house.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: Put two ships in the open sea, without wind or tide, and, at last, they will come together. Throw two planets into space, and they will fall one on the other. Place two enemies in the midst of a crowd, and they will inevitably meet; it is a fatality, a question of time; that is all.
quotes.author: Jules Verne

quotes.text: In my life outdoors, I've observed that animals of almost any variety will stand in a windy place rather than in a protected, windless area infested with biting insects. They would rather be annoyed by the wind than bitten.
quotes.author: Tim Cahill

quotes.text: He ploughs the waves, sows the sand, and hopes to gather the wind in a net, who places his hopes in the heart of a woman.
quotes.author: Jacopo Sannazaro

quotes.text: Wind is God's way of balancing heat. Wind is the way you shift heat from areas where it's hotter to areas where it's cooler. That's what wind is.
quotes.author: Joe Barton

quotes.text: I love to clean my ears. I've heard that you're not supposed to do it every day, but I throw caution to the wind for some quality time with a strong Q-Tip.
quotes.author: Rachel Nichols

quotes.text: We are launching a campaign called Wind, Not War, which is about the alternatives to a fossil-fuels-based economy and looking at wind, an alternative energy, as key to that in terms of issues of global climate change as well as issues of democracy.
quotes.author: Winona LaDuke

quotes.text: I think there's a time to work, and everyone has to kind of adjust. And then there's a time to relax, and be the mom or take the kids on vacation when you need to wind down. So it's a matter of planning, and being able to map out your year or your week or let's start with the day. It is just being multi-tasking and being available.
quotes.author: Vanessa Williams

quotes.text: Thus I was able to make pioneering measurements of the height and physical scale of plasma clouds in the ionosphere and also to estimate wind speeds in this region.
quotes.author: Antony Hewish

quotes.text: If a man knows not what harbor he seeks, any wind is the right wind.
quotes.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.text: Our lives feel like these epochs, but really, we are dust in the wind.
quotes.author: Justin Vernon

quotes.text: When the wind blows through a wood, its mass is cut and closed by every leaf, forming a train of jittery vortices in the air.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: A woman is a branchy tree and man a singing wind; and from her branches carelessly he takes what he can find.
quotes.author: James Stephens

quotes.text: I have a lot of nervous energy. Work is my best way of channelling that into something productive unless I want to wind up assaulting the postman or gardener.
quotes.author: Ben Stiller

quotes.text: Sometimes, when the wind hits hard and icicles form on the sea cliffs, we can all come together - and at those times, we are at our best.
quotes.author: John Burnside

quotes.text: Kites rise highest against the wind - not with it.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Come Fairies, take me out of this dull world, for I would ride with you upon the wind and dance upon the mountains like a flame!
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.text: To reach a port we must sail, sometimes with the wind, and sometimes against it. But we must not drift or lie at anchor.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.text: We wind a simple ring of iron with coils; we establish the connections to the generator, and with wonder and delight we note the effects of strange forces which we bring into play, which allow us to transform, to transmit and direct energy at will.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla

quotes.text: I have spent a great deal of my life being part of minorities. Some of the people I admire the most in the world have had the courage to defend, against wind and tide, minority viewpoints in those frightening times when any disagreement with universal conformity is identified as treason.
quotes.author: Antonio Munoz Molina

quotes.text: Sleep is when all the unsorted stuff comes flying out as from a dustbin upset in a high wind.
quotes.author: William Golding

quotes.text: People don't understand the devastation the murder of a child does to someone. Eighty percent of parents of murdered children wind up in divorce. The only thing you have in common is that horrible sadness. You can't see the joy of your previous life.
quotes.author: John Walsh

quotes.text: I want to go and go, and then drop dead in the middle of something I'm loving to do. And if that doesn't happen, if I wind up sitting in a wheelchair, at least I'll have my high heels on.
quotes.author: Dolly Parton

quotes.text: A great wind swept over the ghetto, carrying away shame, invisibility and four centuries of humiliation. But when the wind dropped people saw it had been only a little breeze, friendly, almost gentle.
quotes.author: Jean Genet

quotes.text: To attempt to advise conceited people is like whistling against the wind.
quotes.author: Thomas Hood

quotes.text: When men sow the wind it is rational to expect that they will reap the whirlwind.
quotes.author: Frederick Douglass

quotes.text: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
quotes.author: Laurence Sterne

quotes.text: My wife Juliana and I first saw Eurovision while on our honeymoon in Greece in 2006, and we were amazed by it. They basically recreate a music video onstage, and pyro cannons, LED video screens, background dancers, fireworks, costume changes, and wind machines are their tools.
quotes.author: Seamus Dever

quotes.text: Being married means I can break wind and eat ice cream in bed.
quotes.author: Brad Pitt

quotes.text: O, wind, if winter comes, can spring be far behind?
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: So many gods, so many creeds, so many paths that wind and wind while just the art of being kind is all the sad world needs.
quotes.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quotes.text: You cannot have one bathroom. And it don't matter how much you love your wife and everything, 'cause you wind up with no room at all. You just get a little corner, and you've got a toothbrush and your paste and a shaving brush and a razor.
quotes.author: Michael Caine

quotes.text: The hardest thing about skateboarding is consistency: The slightest flick of your foot or gust of wind can send your board flying, so it's really anybody's game out there.
quotes.author: Shaun White

quotes.text: To me, Ann Romney sounds like a better candidate than her husband. She put her MS into remission through horseback riding, alternative therapies, and a healthy diet. She knows how to pace herself. She has a sense of humor and an innate honesty, and her hair moves in the wind. Maybe she should run.
quotes.author: Patti Davis

quotes.text: Who am I to blow against the wind?
quotes.author: Paul Simon

quotes.text: At the Summer Solstice, all is green and growing, potential coming into being, the miracle of manifestation painted large on the canvas of awareness. At the Winter Solstice, the wind is cold, trees are bare and all lies in stillness beneath blankets of snow.
quotes.author: Gary Zukav

quotes.text: A kestrel can and does hover in the dead calm of summer days, when there is not the faintest breath of wind. He will, and does, hover in the still, soft atmosphere of early autumn, when the gossamer falls in showers, coming straight down as if it were raining silk.
quotes.author: Richard Jefferies

quotes.text: If I had been on 'Bowling for Dollars', I'd wind up owing them money.
quotes.author: Ricki Lake

quotes.text: When I woke up Sunday morning at the Open and stepped outside and felt the wind and rain in my face, I knew I had an excellent chance to win if I just took my time and trusted myself.
quotes.author: Tom Kite

quotes.text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
quotes.author: Saint Basil

quotes.text: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.text: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
quotes.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

quotes.text: Balance, peace, and joy are the fruit of a successful life. It starts with recognizing your talents and finding ways to serve others by using them.
quotes.author: Thomas Kinkade

quotes.text: While traveling, I love granola bars, trail mix nuts, dry cereal and fruit for on-the-go snacks. I also try and start the day with a high fiber and protein meal, such as whole-grain toast with peanut butter.
quotes.author: Christie Rampone

quotes.text: Pleasure only starts once the worm has got into the fruit, to become delightful happiness must be tainted with poison.
quotes.author: Georges Bataille

quotes.text: I eat a lot of salad, a little meat, and some fruit. That's all. But I like sweets.
quotes.author: Sophia Loren

quotes.text: For me, healthy eating and exercising is something I work on constantly. I'm not the most disciplined dieter. I try to eat a lot of fruit and vegetables but sometimes late at night I tend to have fast-food meals - and that's where I get myself into trouble! So I'm not in the best shape I could be, but I'm still healthy and comfy.
quotes.author: Fergie

quotes.text: Loyal and efficient work in a great cause, even though it may not be immediately recognized, ultimately bears fruit.
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.text: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
quotes.author: Brian O'Driscoll

quotes.text: Whatever seeds each man cultivates will grow to maturity and bear in him their own fruit. If they be vegetative, he will be like a plant.
quotes.author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quotes.text: Time flies like an arrow - but fruit flies like a banana.
quotes.author: Terry Wogan

quotes.text: We incorporated new tastes and flavors into our kids' diets from a very early age, which helped to develop their palates and prevented them from becoming picky eaters. We don't buy junk food and give them options of fresh fruit, yogurt, raw almonds, or dried whole grain cereals for snack time.
quotes.author: Cat Cora

quotes.text: Good thoughts bear good fruit, bad thoughts bear bad fruit.
quotes.author: James Lane Allen

quotes.text: It's kind of interesting, because hacking is a skill that could be used for criminal purposes or legitimate purposes, and so even though in the past I was hacking for the curiosity, and the thrill, to get a bite of the forbidden fruit of knowledge, I'm now working in the security field as a public speaker.
quotes.author: Kevin Mitnick
