quotes.text: On Sunday morning, I'm not nervous... I can't wait to tell what God wants me to say.
quotes.author: Charles Stanley

quotes.text: About four days a week, I do pretty good at having a morning prayer time. But even at that, it's a rambling sort of thing. What I have learned to do better is to try to keep my mind turned toward God and ear inclined toward God throughout the day, and I think I'm doing better at that, but I've got a long way to go.
quotes.author: Max Lucado

quotes.text: I'm always thinking about creating. My future starts when I wake up every morning... Every day I find something creative to do with my life.
quotes.author: Miles Davis

quotes.text: Some mornings you wake up and think, gee I look handsome today. Other days I think, what am I doing in the movies? I wanna go back to Ireland and drive a forklift.
quotes.author: Liam Neeson

quotes.text: It ain't as bad as you think. It will look better in the morning.
quotes.author: Colin Powell

quotes.text: Do not say, 'It is morning,' and dismiss it with a name of yesterday. See it for the first time as a newborn child that has no name.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.text: When I wake up in the morning, I feel like a billionaire without paying taxes.
quotes.author: Ernie Banks

quotes.text: I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning, that's as good as they're going to feel all day.
quotes.author: Dean Martin

quotes.text: I love the smell of juice boxes in the morning.
quotes.author: Robert Duvall

quotes.text: Arranging a bowl of flowers in the morning can give a sense of quiet in a crowded day - like writing a poem or saying a prayer.
quotes.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.text: You feel a little older in the morning. By noon I feel about 55.
quotes.author: Bob Dole

quotes.text: Let me tell you, it is still morning in America. It just happens to be kind of a head pounding, hung over for four hours in America - and it's shaping up to be a nasty day, but its still morning in America.
quotes.author: Glenn Beck

quotes.text: Do I get up every morning and ask: am I doing the things that I believe in and am I doing them for the best possible motives? Yes. Unambiguously yes.
quotes.author: Nick Clegg

quotes.text: I get up in the morning looking for an adventure.
quotes.author: George Foreman

quotes.text: The most efficient way to live reasonably is every morning to make a plan of one's day and every night to examine the results obtained.
quotes.author: Alexis Carrel

quotes.text: It is a matter of shame that in the morning the birds should be awake earlier than you.
quotes.author: Abu Bakr

quotes.text: Every morning I jump out of bed and step on a landmine. The landmine is me. After the explosion, I spent the rest of the day putting the pieces together.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: I wake up laughing. Yes, I wake up in the morning and there I am just laughing my head off.
quotes.author: Bruce Willis

quotes.text: In a real dark night of the soul, it is always three o'clock in the morning, day after day.
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.text: No man knows till he has suffered from the night how sweet and dear to his heart and eye the morning can be.
quotes.author: Bram Stoker

quotes.text: I wake up every morning at nine and grab for the morning paper. Then I look at the obituary page. If my name is not on it, I get up.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Burning desire to be or do something gives us staying power - a reason to get up every morning or to pick ourselves up and start in again after a disappointment.
quotes.author: Marsha Sinetar

quotes.text: Think in the morning. Act in the noon. Eat in the evening. Sleep in the night.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: Be thou the rainbow in the storms of life. The evening beam that smiles the clouds away, and tints tomorrow with prophetic ray.
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.text: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
quotes.author: Jean de La Fontaine

quotes.text: I've had a perfectly wonderful evening. But this wasn't it.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: I need your help. I am injured, near death, and too weak to hike out of here. I am all alone. This is no joke. In the name of God, please remain to save me. I am out collecting berries close by and shall return this evening. Thank you, Chris McCandless.
quotes.author: Christopher McCandless

quotes.text: By the time this concert ends this evening, 30,000 Africans will have died because of extreme poverty. By this time tomorrow evening, another 30,000. This does not make sense.
quotes.author: Brad Pitt

quotes.text: I'd love to knock an audience cold with one note, but what do you do for the rest of the evening?
quotes.author: Eric Clapton

quotes.text: Most of the top actors and actresses may be working in ten or twelve films at the same time, so they will give one director two hours and maybe shoot in Bombay in the morning and Madras in the evening. It happens.
quotes.author: Satyajit Ray

quotes.text: Sometimes I've been to a party where no one spoke to me for a whole evening. The men, frightened by their wives or sweeties, would give me a wide berth. And the ladies would gang up in a corner to discuss my dangerous character.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: The man who says his evening prayer is a captain posting his sentinels. He can sleep.
quotes.author: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.text: In the evening every man looks the same. Like penguins. Women have a special dress for that event; men, the same tuxedo.
quotes.author: Roberto Cavalli

quotes.text: I'm very sensitive. Because my mum was my primary emotional caregiver growing up, I found myself being pinned into dresses, darting her dresses, choosing her high heels for the evening or what to wear. I'm very much a mommy's boy.
quotes.author: Tom Hardy

quotes.text: In Israel, waves of anger and fear circulate all the time, but so do jokes and gossip and silky evening breezes. So, too, in America.
quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.text: It was a wonderful experience to live the life for a year; to spend all day doing Shakespeare and then do a play in the evening.
quotes.author: Phil Daniels

quotes.text: During the day I force myself to at least eat some salads rather than rubbish, and a steak in the evening. In fact, I eat to basically satisfy my hunger. I hardly have the time to appreciate a meal, and I'm everything, but a gourmet.
quotes.author: Milla Jovovich

quotes.text: Collectively, we must do more than simply watch, with resignation and a feeling of powerlessness, reports on the evening news about the latest terrorist atrocity.
quotes.author: Michael Jeffery

quotes.text: Perfect happiness would be knowing that all my family and friends were happy and safe. Then I'd go to a tropical island with my husband where it was gorgeous and fun all day long and interesting and fun all evening. Good food and dancing would be nice, too, and weekly visits from those safe and happy family and friends. Plus world peace.
quotes.author: Suzanne Weyn

quotes.text: For age is opportunity no less Than youth itself, though in another dress, And as the evening twilight fades away The sky is filled with stars, invisible by day.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.text: Colorful garments - ball gowns, kimonos, evening pajamas - made from yards upon yards of iridescent silk or velvet. I own an unjustifiable number of such outfits and jump at the chance to wear them. Against the etiquette about which I am otherwise all too conscious, I frequently, and unrepentantly, overdress for the occasion.
quotes.author: Julia Glass

quotes.text: I write in the morning, I walk in the afternoon and I read in the evening. It's a very easy, lovely life.
quotes.author: Margaret Forster

quotes.text: Joy descends gently upon us like the evening dew, and does not patter down like a hailstorm.
quotes.author: Jean Paul

quotes.text: The day of the sun is like the day of a king. It is a promenade in the morning, a sitting on the throne at noon, a pageant in the evening.
quotes.author: Wallace Stevens

quotes.text: In the morning a man walks with his whole body; in the evening, only with his legs.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: I think I have something tonight that's not quite correct for evening wear. Blue suede shoes.
quotes.author: Elvis Presley

quotes.text: There are worse things in life than death. Have you ever spent an evening with an insurance salesman?
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.text: My ideal meal varies, depending on the time of year. Lobster on a deck overlooking a beach at sunset is one - but all my kids have to be there, because they are all lobster-lovers. Making a bolognese sauce over pappardelle for my husband on a winter evening, because he loves my bolognese sauce and it's his comfort food.
quotes.author: Amy Bloom

quotes.text: Evening is a time of real experimentation. You never want to look the same way.
quotes.author: Donna Karan

quotes.text: I love to put on diamonds and beautiful evening gowns and make my girl-friends upset.
quotes.author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quotes.text: We know that a man can read Goethe or Rilke in the evening, that he can play Bach and Schubert, and go to his day's work at Auschwitz in the morning.
quotes.author: George Steiner

quotes.text: My grandmother took me to church on Sunday all day long, every Sunday into the night. Then Monday evening was the missionary meeting. Tuesday evening was usher board meeting. Wednesday evening was prayer meeting. Thursday evening was visit the sick. Friday evening was choir practice. I mean, and at all those gatherings, we sang.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: I have had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: Good evening, ladies and gentleman. My name is Orson Welles. I am an actor. I am a writer. I am a producer. I am a director. I am a magician. I appear onstage and on the radio. Why are there so many of me and so few of you?
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.text: Truth is tough. It will not break, like a bubble, at a touch; nay, you may kick it about all day like a football, and it will be round and full at evening.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.text: What a nice night for an evening.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.text: I get up at 7:30 and work four hours a day. Nine to twelve in the morning, five to six in the evening. Businessmen would achieve better results if they studied human metabolism. No one works well eight hours a day. No one ought to work more than four hours.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.text: Each morning sees some task begun, each evening sees it close; Something attempted, something done, has earned a night's repose.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.text: My family lived off the land and summer evening meals featured baked stuffed tomatoes, potato salad, corn on the cob, fresh shelled peas and homemade ice cream with strawberries from our garden. With no air conditioning in those days, the cool porch was the center of our universe after the scorching days.
quotes.author: David Mixner

quotes.text: These flowers, which were splendid and sprightly, waking in the dawn of the morning, in the evening will be a pitiful frivolity, sleeping in the cold night's arms.
quotes.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

quotes.text: One's age should be tranquil, as childhood should be playful. Hard work at either extremity of life seems out of place. At midday the sun may burn, and men labor under it; but the morning and evening should be alike calm and cheerful.
quotes.author: Thomas Arnold

quotes.text: Hide our ignorance as we will, an evening of wine soon reveals it.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: I do accents. Sometimes when I've had a few drinks, I speak in different accents all night long, and then at the end of an evening someone will say to me, 'Seriously, where are you from?'
quotes.author: Rebecca Mader

quotes.text: The darkness of death is like the evening twilight; it makes all objects appear more lovely to the dying.
quotes.author: Jean Paul

quotes.text: I'm not one of those people who wakes up and thinks, 'Bring on the day!' I have to have about 7 pints of coffee before I'm even remotely awake. But I love the golden hour in the evening, as hokey as that sounds. Just as the sun is about to set and you get those lovely shadows and everything looks gold and yellow.
quotes.author: Stacy London

quotes.text: In the evening of life we shall be judged on love, and not one of us is going to come off very well, and were it not for my absolute faith in the loving forgiveness of my Lord I could not call on him to come.
quotes.author: Madeleine L'Engle

quotes.text: The evening sings in a voice of amber, the dawn is surely coming.
quotes.author: Al Stewart

quotes.text: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
quotes.author: Christopher Marlowe

quotes.text: What is love? It is the morning and the evening star.
quotes.author: Sinclair Lewis

quotes.text: Many nights, I would begin the evening fueled by caffeine and nicotine, which I needed to propel me out of torpor and hopelessness - only to overshoot into quaking, quivering anxiety.
quotes.author: Scott Stossel

quotes.text: My evening really begins when I take a long, hot bath. I light a candle, and I turn on the news and try to catch up. It's when I can breathe from the day to the night, and that means a lot to me.
quotes.author: Vera Wang

quotes.text: It felt good doing a physical job, and going home each evening feeling like I had really done a day's work.
quotes.author: James D'arcy

quotes.text: 'Cosmos' wouldn't deserve its place in primetime evening network television were it not a landscape on which compelling stories were told. People, when they watch TV in the evening, want to see stories, and science simply tells the best stories.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: The companion of an evening, and the companion for life, require very different qualifications.
quotes.author: Samuel Richardson

quotes.text: I like a quiet evening with family or friends over, great food and great discussion and a lot of laughter. That's really what I think fills my tank.
quotes.author: Anna Eshoo

quotes.text: I saw my parents as model grown-ups, and their manner, their silence, informed my sense of what adulthood looked and felt like. Grown-ups behaved rationally and calmly. Grown-ups worked during the day and came home at night and sat down for drinks and passed the evening quietly.
quotes.author: Caroline Knapp

quotes.text: I started to work in television for three or four years, in 1954. There was one channel of television, black and white. But it could be entertaining and educational. During the evening they showed important plays, opera or Shakespeare's tragedies.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: Close your eyes and place your finger on a map. Wherever it lands, that's the theme of the evening. So many times we settle for routine dishes. This forces you to try new cuisines.
quotes.author: Mario Batali

quotes.text: To go to the synagogue with one's father on the Passover eve - is there in the world a greater pleasure than that? What is it worth to be dressed in new clothes from head to foot, and to show off before one's friends? Then the prayers themselves - the first Festival evening prayer and blessing.
quotes.author: Sholom Aleichem

quotes.text: Not to discriminate every moment some passionate attitude in those about us, and in the very brilliancy of their gifts some tragic dividing on their ways, is, on this short day of frost and sun, to sleep before evening.
quotes.author: Walter Pater

quotes.text: I tweet in the morning and the evening. To write 12 hours a day, there is a moment when you're really tired. It's my relaxing time.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: I like the evening in India, the one magic moment when the sun balances on the rim of the world, and the hush descends, and ten thousand civil servants drift homeward on a river of bicycles, brooding on the Lord Krishna and the cost of living.
quotes.author: James Cameron

quotes.text: I look back into past history, the stored experiences or products of the imagination. I look no further forward than the evening.
quotes.author: Jerzy Kosinski

quotes.text: After my parents' divorce when I was 4, I spent weekends with my dad before we finally moved to California. By the time Sunday rolled around, I was incapable of enjoying the day's activities, of being in the moment, because I was already dreading the inevitable goodbye of Sunday evening.
quotes.author: Rob Lowe

quotes.text: I'll co-host 'TODAY' from Los Angeles Saturday morning and then make my way up to Merced for that evening's graduation ceremony. I'm still touching up my remarks, but my challenge to the Class of 2010 will be to break through the deafening and too often negative echo chamber of the digital era and become critical and independent thinkers.
quotes.author: Lester Holt

quotes.text: When I am on my deathbed, I don't think I will be thinking about a nice pair of shoes I had or my beautiful house. I am going to be thinking about an evening I spent with somebody when I was twenty where I felt that I was just absolutely connected to them.
quotes.author: Tom Ford

quotes.text: Probably the happiest period in life most frequently is in middle age, when the eager passions of youth are cooled, and the infirmities of age not yet begun; as we see that the shadows, which are at morning and evening so large, almost entirely disappear at midday.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: South Koreans who have seen and praised the mass games should remember the hardship of tearful children. Teachers drive them hard with curses and orders to repeat and repeat. When the children return home in the evening, they can hardly walk.
quotes.author: Kim Il-sung

quotes.text: To be really in shape, it's dynamic. It's got to be a lot of different everything, always switching it up. So a good day for me would be hit the gym, do some sort of cross training in the gym and then go surfing and then maybe take a jiu-jitsu class at night or go swimming at night or go stand up paddle boarding in the evening.
quotes.author: Scott Eastwood

quotes.text: After tea it's back to painting - a large poplar at dusk with a gathering storm. From time to time instead of this evening painting session I go bowling in one of the neighbouring villages, but not very often.
quotes.author: Gustav Klimt

quotes.text: I grew up in a house where there was lots of teasing and language play and laughter; it was very important. When I was a teenager, you wouldn't go to a bar and find lots of televisions everywhere. People were talking. Talk was the mental fire you would gather around in the evening. It occupied a big part of your existence.
quotes.author: Dylan Moran

quotes.text: I know folks all have a tizzy about it, but I like a little bourbon of an evening. It helps me sleep. I don't much care what they say about it.
quotes.author: Lillian Gordy Carter

quotes.text: You're not supposed to look perfect while you're making babies. Making babies is the perfection. It's about feeling good in clothes and knowing you can get dressed up in the evening, work it for a minute, and maybe get back in a certain pair of jeans. But there's just no such thing as perfection.
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.text: It was one of the most exciting, perfect evenings of my life, my solo debut at Carnegie Hall. And knowing we were all there to raise money for Gay Men's Health Crisis made the evening an extraordinary experience.
quotes.author: Bernadette Peters

quotes.text: I cannot always write at the same time, in the same place. I work, travel and have a vigorous family life. If I'm stranded in an airport lobby - I write. If I have to wait in a doctor's office - I write. If I have a morning or evening to myself - I write.
quotes.author: Carmen Agra Deedy

quotes.text: I'd rather win two or three, lose one, win two or three more. I'm a great believer in things evening out. If you win a whole bunch in a row, somewhere along the line you're going to lose some too.
quotes.author: Walt Alston

quotes.text: I never want anyone to have a bad evening because I caused it.
quotes.author: Doug Morris

quotes.text: I used to meditate all the time in bed. That was when I was raising my daughter, and I'd get her up and off to school, and then I would go back to bed and meditate. And then I would do the same in the evening, and that was very good for that period because I had so many things to juggle as a single mother.
quotes.author: Alice Walker

quotes.text: Touch was important. The evening of the Third of July we would go around the neighborhood and look at the fireworks others had bought, taking them out of the brown paper sack and handling them cautiously as if they were precious stones. There was envy when we saw sacks with more in them than we had.
quotes.author: Paul Engle

quotes.text: My favorite drink is water - the bland one: Evian. I stick with that. I celebrate in the evening sometimes with Perrier. That's why I love coming to California. They're always talking to you about bottled water.
quotes.author: George Foreman

quotes.text: Gray hairs seem to my fancy like the soft light of the moon, silvering over the evening of life.
quotes.author: Jean Paul

quotes.text: The Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind cannot stay in the cradle forever.
quotes.author: Konstantin Tsiolkovsky

quotes.text: Do you realize that if you fall into a black hole, you will see the entire future of the Universe unfold in front of you in a matter of moments and you will emerge into another space-time created by the singularity of the black hole you just fell into?
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: Modern science says: 'The sun is the past, the earth is the present, the moon is the future.' From an incandescent mass we have originated, and into a frozen mass we shall turn. Merciless is the law of nature, and rapidly and irresistibly we are drawn to our doom.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla

quotes.text: That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the drug store, but that's just peanuts to space.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.text: You cannot look up at the night sky on the Planet Earth and not wonder what it's like to be up there amongst the stars. And I always look up at the moon and see it as the single most romantic place within the cosmos.
quotes.author: Tom Hanks

quotes.text: Who are we? We find that we live on an insignificant planet of a humdrum star lost in a galaxy tucked away in some forgotten corner of a universe in which there are far more galaxies than people.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.text: The stars don't look bigger, but they do look brighter.
quotes.author: Sally Ride

quotes.text: I would like to die on Mars. Just not on impact.
quotes.author: Elon Musk

quotes.text: The world, when you look at it, it just can't be random. I mean, it's so different than the vast emptiness that is everything else, and even all the other planets we've seen, at least in our solar system, none of them even remotely resemble the precious life-giving nature of our own planet.
quotes.author: Chris Hadfield

quotes.text: What we observe as material bodies and forces are nothing but shapes and variations in the structure of space.
quotes.author: Erwin Schrodinger

quotes.text: Philosophically, the universe has really never made things in ones. The Earth is special and everything else is different? No, we've got seven other planets. The sun? No, the sun is one of those dots in the night sky. The Milky Way? No, it's one of a hundred billion galaxies. And the universe - maybe it's countless other universes.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: Empty space is a boiling, bubbling brew of virtual particles that pop in and out of existence in a time scale so short that you can't even measure them.
quotes.author: Lawrence M. Krauss

quotes.text: It bears mentioning that the Milky Way is only one of 150 billion galaxies visible to our telescopes - and each of these will have its own complement of planets.
quotes.author: Seth Shostak

quotes.text: It suddenly struck me that that tiny pea, pretty and blue, was the Earth. I put up my thumb and shut one eye, and my thumb blotted out the planet Earth. I didn't feel like a giant. I felt very, very small.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: If you're going to go to the moon, you don't shoot the rocket right at the moon. You have to go at it obliquely.
quotes.author: Drew Houston

quotes.text: I grew up watching a lot of the coverage of the early U.S. space program, all the way back starting with Mercury and then through Gemini and Apollo and of course going to the moon as the main part of the Apollo program.
quotes.author: Linda M. Godwin

quotes.text: The dinosaurs became extinct because they didn't have a space program.
quotes.author: Larry Niven

quotes.text: Whenever I gaze up at the moon, I feel like I'm on a time machine. I am back to that precious pinpoint of time, standing on the foreboding - yet beautiful - Sea of Tranquility. I could see our shining blue planet Earth poised in the darkness of space.
quotes.author: Buzz Aldrin

quotes.text: The photographs of space taken by our astronauts have been published all over the place. But the eye is a much more dynamic mechanism than any camera or pictures. It's a more exciting view in person than looking at the photographs. Of course, I personally am sick and tired of hearing people talk like that: I want to see it myself!
quotes.author: Burt Rutan

quotes.text: In essence, String Theory describes space and time, matter and energy, gravity and light, indeed all of God's creation... as music.
quotes.author: Roy H. Williams

quotes.text: The feeling is constantly growing on me that I had been the first to hear the greeting of one planet to another.
quotes.author: Nikola Tesla

quotes.text: Man is an artifact designed for space travel. He is not designed to remain in his present biologic state any more than a tadpole is designed to remain a tadpole.
quotes.author: William S. Burroughs

quotes.text: Rocket science is tough, and rockets have a way of failing.
quotes.author: Sally Ride

quotes.text: The most important thing we can do is inspire young minds and to advance the kind of science, math and technology education that will help youngsters take us to the next phase of space travel.
quotes.author: John Glenn

quotes.text: Each year, thousands of UFOs are sighted and reported, which is an impressive tally of unidentified aerial phenomena. Surveys show that roughly one-third of the populace believes that at least some of this sky show is due to extraterrestrial spacecraft, here to probe our airspace and, when that proves boring, our bodies.
quotes.author: Seth Shostak

quotes.text: I'm Chinese-American, of course, and so it's very interesting to see China actually launch their own astronauts, becoming the third nation, following the United States and Russia, to do so.
quotes.author: Leroy Chiao

quotes.text: One in 200 stars has habitable Earth-like planets surrounding it - in the galaxy, half a billion stars have Earth-like planets going around them - that's huge, half a billion. So when we look at the night sky, it makes sense that someone is looking back at us.
quotes.author: Michio Kaku

quotes.text: I think we're going to the moon because it's in the nature of the human being to face challenges. It's by the nature of his deep inner soul... we're required to do these things just as salmon swim upstream.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: It's very dangerous to put astronauts on a moon base where there's radiation, solar flares and micro meteorites. It'd be much better to put robots on the moon and have them mentally connected to astronauts on the Earth.
quotes.author: Michio Kaku

quotes.text: Everything has a natural explanation. The moon is not a god, but a great rock, and the sun a hot rock.
quotes.author: Anaxagoras

quotes.text: Houston, we've had a problem.
quotes.author: Jim Lovell

quotes.text: I am absolutely certain that life can exist in outer space, move around, find a new aqueous environment.
quotes.author: Craig Venter

quotes.text: If the Sun and Moon should ever doubt, they'd immediately go out.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: As a young boy growing up in rural India, most of what I knew of the world was what I could see around me. But each night, I would look at the Moon - it was impossibly far away, yet it held a special attraction because it allowed me to dream beyond my village and country, and think about the rest of the world and space.
quotes.author: Naveen Jain

quotes.text: Space offers extraordinary potential for commerce and adventure, for new innovations and new tests of will. As Americans, we can't help but reach for the stars. It's our nature. It's our destiny.
quotes.author: Bill Frist

quotes.text: If we ever start communicating with living creatures from other planets, the number one priority is, how are you going to communicate information? Even between different cultures here on Earth, you get into communication problems.
quotes.author: Story Musgrave

quotes.text: The lunar flights give you a correct perception of our existence. You look back at Earth from the moon, and you can put your thumb up to the window and hide the Earth behind your thumb. Everything you've ever known is behind your thumb, and that blue-and-white ball is orbiting a rather normal star, tucked away on the outer edge of a galaxy.
quotes.author: Jim Lovell

quotes.text: I think space exploration is very important. I think there is very intelligent life on Mars. I believe that Martians are spying on us from the bottom of the ocean.
quotes.author: Annabella Sciorra

quotes.text: Time travel used to be thought of as just science fiction, but Einstein's general theory of relativity allows for the possibility that we could warp space-time so much that you could go off in a rocket and return before you set out.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: By refocusing our space program on Mars for America's future, we can restore the sense of wonder and adventure in space exploration that we knew in the summer of 1969. We won the moon race; now it's time for us to live and work on Mars, first on its moons and then on its surface.
quotes.author: Buzz Aldrin

quotes.text: The stars look the same from night to night. Nebulae and galaxies are dully immutable, maintaining the same overall appearance for thousands or millions of years. Indeed, only the sun, moon and planets - together with the occasional comet, asteroid or meteor - seem dynamic.
quotes.author: Seth Shostak

quotes.text: Trees go wandering forth in all directions with every wind, going and coming like ourselves, traveling with us around the sun two million miles a day, and through space heaven knows how fast and far!
quotes.author: John Muir

quotes.text: Ye stars! which are the poetry of heaven!
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.text: In spite of the opinions of certain narrow-minded people, who would shut up the human race upon this globe, as within some magic circle it must never outstep, we shall one day travel to the moon, the planets, and the stars, with the same facility, rapidity, and certainty as we now make the voyage from Liverpool to New York!
quotes.author: Jules Verne

quotes.text: Sometimes I think we're alone in the universe, and sometimes I think we're not. In either case the idea is quite staggering.
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.text: I would rather be a superb meteor, every atom of me in magnificent glow, than a sleepy and permanent planet.
quotes.author: Jack London

quotes.text: There is a fifth dimension, beyond that which is known to man. It is a dimension as vast as space and as timeless as infinity. It is the middle ground between light and shadow, between science and superstition.
quotes.author: Rod Serling

quotes.text: Space isn't remote at all. It's only an hour's drive away if your car could go straight upwards.
quotes.author: Fred Hoyle

quotes.text: When you look at the stars and the galaxy, you feel that you are not just from any particular piece of land, but from the solar system.
quotes.author: Kalpana Chawla

quotes.text: We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: Space exploration is a force of nature unto itself that no other force in society can rival.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: Who among us has never looked up into the heavens on a starlit night, lost in wonder at the vastness of space and the beauty of the stars?
quotes.author: Jeb Bush

quotes.text: There are no passengers on spaceship earth. We are all crew.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.text: Well, I don't think we should go to the moon. I think we maybe should send some politicians up there.
quotes.author: Ron Paul

quotes.text: Houston, Tranquillity Base here. The Eagle has landed.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: The important achievement of Apollo was demonstrating that humanity is not forever chained to this planet and our visions go rather further than that and our opportunities are unlimited.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: Before we had airplanes and astronauts, we really thought that there was an actual place beyond the clouds, somewhere over the rainbow. There was an actual place, and we could go above the clouds and find it there.
quotes.author: Barbara Walters

quotes.text: It's a very sobering feeling to be up in space and realize that one's safety factor was determined by the lowest bidder on a government contract.
quotes.author: Alan Shepard

quotes.text: Hey sky, take off your hat, I'm on my way!
quotes.author: Valentina Tereshkova

quotes.text: A black hole really is an object with very rich structure, just like Earth has a rich structure of mountains, valleys, oceans, and so forth. Its warped space whirls around the central singularity like air in a tornado.
quotes.author: Kip Thorne

quotes.text: Why should man's first flight to the moon be a matter of national competition? Why should the United States and the Soviet Union, in preparing for such expeditions, become involved in immense duplications of research, construction and expenditure?
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: We've been surrounded by images of space our whole lives, from the speculative images of science fiction to the inspirational visions of artists to the increasingly beautiful pictures made possible by complex technologies. But whilst we have an overwhelmingly vivid visual understanding of space, we have no sense of what space sounds like.
quotes.author: Honor Harger

quotes.text: There is just one thing I can promise you about the outer-space program - your tax-dollar will go further.
quotes.author: Wernher von Braun

quotes.text: The moon is a friend for the lonesome to talk to.
quotes.author: Carl Sandburg

quotes.text: What can we gain by sailing to the moon if we are not able to cross the abyss that separates us from ourselves? This is the most important of all voyages of discovery, and without it, all the rest are not only useless, but disastrous.
quotes.author: Thomas Merton

quotes.text: It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist in delusion, however satisfying and reassuring.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.text: When you launch in a rocket, you're not really flying that rocket. You're just sort of hanging on.
quotes.author: Michael P. Anderson

quotes.text: We travel together, passengers on a little spaceship, dependent on its vulnerable reserves of air and soil, all committed, for our safety, to its security and peace. Preserved from annihilation only by the care, the work and the love we give our fragile craft.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

quotes.text: When many astronauts go to space, they see the insignificant size of the earth and vastness of space, and they become very religious, because they have seen the Signs of Allah.
quotes.author: Cat Stevens

quotes.text: After one look at this planet any visitor from outer space would say 'I want to see the manager.'
quotes.author: William S. Burroughs

quotes.text: People need to be made conscious of a very simple reality: we have no choice but to share this planet, this small blue sphere floating in the vast reaches of space, with all of our fellow 'passengers.'
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.text: There is good evidence that Venus once had liquid water and a much thinner atmosphere, similar to Earth billions of years ago. But today the surface of Venus is dry as a bone, hot enough to melt lead, there are clouds of sulfuric acid that reach a hundred miles high and the air is so thick it's like being 900 meters deep in the ocean.
quotes.author: Bill Nye

quotes.text: When a place gets crowded enough to require ID's, social collapse is not far away. It is time to go elsewhere. The best thing about space travel is that it made it possible to go elsewhere.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.text: Planets move in ellipses with the Sun at one focus.
quotes.author: Johannes Kepler

quotes.text: We must still think of ourselves as pioneers to understand the importance of space.
quotes.author: Buzz Aldrin

quotes.text: In so many and such important ways, then, do the planets bear witness to the earth's mobility.
quotes.author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quotes.text: There are no wishy-washy astronauts. You don't get up there by being uncaring and blase. And whatever gave you the sense of tenacity and purpose to get that far in life is absolutely reaffirmed and deepened by the experience itself.
quotes.author: Chris Hadfield

quotes.text: What is the use of a house if you haven't got a tolerable planet to put it on?
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Space enthusiasts are the most susceptible demographic to delusion that I have ever seen.
quotes.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.text: Sometimes I think God wants there to be a circus so we can show there's another way to respond.
quotes.author: Tony Dungy

quotes.text: You know the circus performer who spins the plates in the air you know, and he'll spin six or seven plates in the air? Acting sometimes is kind of that guy spinning all those plates in the air but in your head and in your body.
quotes.author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

quotes.text: My people. I have given them a sense of individuality, integrity. I have not made them slaves of any god or any religion. Nor of any holy book or any priest. I have certainly not replaced their god. They are all a part of what I call my traveling circus.
quotes.author: Rajneesh

quotes.text: You realize that for all the shenanigans that go on in the big circus of politics, everybody wakes up and goes to work.
quotes.author: Lewis Black

quotes.text: Keep the circus going inside you, keep it going, don't take anything too seriously, it'll all work out in the end.
quotes.author: David Niven

quotes.text: I would have done well as a gypsy child, I think. A circus baby. I coulda played a great street urchin or ragamuffin. Or just been one. I certainly liked entertaining people and making jokes, but I don't know necessarily if that's what your child is prone to that you should necessarily put them in a real working industry at six years old.
quotes.author: Natasha Lyonne

quotes.text: I was always a fan of the old-style comics. I loved vaudeville. I loved Milton Berle, Dick Shawn, Phyllis Diller, Don Rickles, Charlie Callas, all those guys. Hilarious. I love the Bing Crosby and Bob Hope movies, and Abbott & Costello. My television influences were 'Monty Python's Flying Circus,' 'Benny Hill,' and 'Hee Haw.'
quotes.author: Larry the Cable Guy

quotes.text: It would've been hard to do something else, to as it were, run away from the circus and become an accountant.
quotes.author: Samuel West

quotes.text: There's a hell of a lot of freedom in this rock and roll circus... it's where all the freaks go - it's the environment for me.
quotes.author: Brian Molko

quotes.text: Time is a circus, always packing up and moving away.
quotes.author: Ben Hecht

quotes.text: I look like a casual, laid-back guy, but it's like a circus in my head.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.text: People speak of the fear of the blank canvas as though it is a temporary hesitation, a trembling moment of self-doubt. For me it was more like being abducted from my bed by a clown, thrust into a circus arena with a wicker chair, and told to tame a pissed-off lion in front of an expectant crowd.
quotes.author: Hannah Kent

quotes.text: I'll continue to try and balance like a circus act. And I will just fight to always tell the truth. Even if it's difficult.
quotes.author: Katy Perry

quotes.text: A national political campaign is better than the best circus ever heard of, with a mass baptism and a couple of hangings thrown in.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.text: Just cause you got the monkey off your back doesn't mean the circus has left town.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.text: We're all going to die, all of us; what a circus! That alone should make us love each other, but it doesn't. We are terrorized and flattened by trivialities. We are eaten up by nothing.
quotes.author: Charles Bukowski

quotes.text: Clowns are the pegs on which the circus is hung.
quotes.author: P. T. Barnum

quotes.text: The attraction of the virtuoso for the public is very like that of the circus for the crowd. There is always the hope that something dangerous will happen.
quotes.author: Claude Debussy

quotes.text: Just as people can watch spellbound a circus artist tumbling through the air in a phosphorized costume, so they can listen to a preacher who uses the Word of God to draw attention to himself. But a sensational preacher stimulates the senses and leaves the spirit untouched. Instead of being the way to God, his 'being different' gets in the way.
quotes.author: Henri Nouwen

quotes.text: Animal abuse is rampant in the U.S., right under everyone's eyes, for the entertainment of the public. The brutal confinement and pain of training methods of wild animals in the circus, the aquatic and theatrical shows, leads to retaliation by the animals. Eventually they find the right time to strike out, and they will.
quotes.author: Tippi Hedren

quotes.text: The students that, like the wild animal being prepared for its tricks in the circus called 'life', expects only training as sketched above, will be severely disappointed: by his standards he will learn next to nothing.
quotes.author: Edsger Dijkstra

quotes.text: I have always been a romantic, one of those people who believes that a woman in pink circus tights contains all the secrets of the universe.
quotes.author: Tom Robbins

quotes.text: Democracy is the art and science of running the circus from the monkey cage.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.text: One can do a film and not work for six months, but on TV, you have to produce good content every week. It involves a lot of hard work, as one has to fight for ratings every week. But I have always got love from the audiences, be it during 'The Great Laughter Challenge' or 'Comedy Circus.'
quotes.author: Kapil Sharma

quotes.text: In my day, MI6 - which I called the Circus in the books - stank of wartime nostalgia. People were defined by secret cachet: one man did something absolutely extraordinary in Norway; another was the darling of the French Resistance. We didn't even show passes to go in and out of the building.
quotes.author: John le Carre

quotes.text: I remember in the circus learning that the clown was the prince, the high prince. I always thought that the high prince was the lion or the magician, but the clown is the most important.
quotes.author: Roberto Benigni

quotes.text: Cirque du Soleil means Circus of the Sun. When I need to take time to reenergize, I go somewhere by the ocean to sit back and watch the sunsets. That is where the idea of 'Soleil' came from, on a beach in Hawaii, and because the sun is the symbol of youth and energy.
quotes.author: Guy Laliberte

quotes.text: What a circus act we women perform every day of our lives. Look at us. We run a tightrope daily, balancing a pile of books on the head. Baby-carriage, parasol, kitchen chair, still under control. Steady now! This is not the life of simplicity but the life of multiplicity that the wise men warn us of.
quotes.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.text: When I was young, my family didn't go on outings to the circus or trips to Disneyland. We couldn't afford them. Instead, we stayed in our small rural West Texas town, and my parents took us to cemeteries.
quotes.author: Jenny Lawson

quotes.text: Motherhood has relaxed me in many ways. You learn to deal with crisis. I've become a juggler, I suppose. It's all a big circus, and nobody who knows me believes I can manage, but sometimes I do.
quotes.author: Jane Seymour

quotes.text: Going back to Georgiana Drew and John Drew, and my great-grandfather Maurice Barrymore, and it was such a sort of circus of odd, interesting people that loved acting.
quotes.author: Drew Barrymore

quotes.text: Living as an actor is rather like living life on the trapezes in a circus. Every time you jump on, you have to pray that, when the time comes for you to jump off, there is another trapeze swinging your way.
quotes.author: Celia Imrie

quotes.text: KISS Psycho Circus is my current favorite. I'm not ashamed to say that I prefer the mindless fun of blasting hordes of creatures to exploration or adventure games.
quotes.author: Mike Wilson

quotes.text: I've had 79 to 80 years of show business. I started when I was 5 with a man called Tom Mix. I didn't have time to go to school because I was in silent movies, I was in radio, I was in burlesque, I worked with the circus. I'm all show business!
quotes.author: George Sidney

quotes.text: I'm in the retail business, not the circus business.
quotes.author: Philip Green

quotes.text: Every country gets the circus it deserves. Spain gets bullfights. Italy the Church. America Hollywood.
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.text: When I first started dating my husband, I had this weird fascination with the circus and clowns and old carnival things and sideshow freaks and all that. About a month after we started dating, he bought me this amazing black-and-white photo book on the circus in the 1930s, and I started sobbing.
quotes.author: Christina Hendricks

quotes.text: Marriage is a good deal like a circus: there is not as much in it as is represented in the advertising.
quotes.author: E. W. Howe

quotes.text: I'm actually not a huge circus fan in the traditional sense, but I like a lot of the circus trappings of striped tents and caramel. I lean more towards Cirque du Soleil than Barnum and Bailey.
quotes.author: Erin Morgenstern

quotes.text: As a kid, the theatre always felt a bit like running away to join the circus.
quotes.author: Robert Sean Leonard

quotes.text: Many of the network television shows have done takeoffs on 'Family Circus,' including 'David Letterman,' 'Friends,' 'Roseanne,' and others, and, in my estimation the use of them is a compliment to the popularity of the feature, which just by mentioning it's name sets up the image of a warm, loving family-type feature.
quotes.author: Bil Keane

quotes.text: Liturgy and worship were never meant to be confined to the cathedrals and sanctuaries. Liturgy at its best can be performed like a circus or theater - making the Gospel visible as a witness to the world around us.
quotes.author: Shane Claiborne

quotes.text: I'm very influenced by the circus. A lot of the dreams that I have, I'm in the circus.
quotes.author: Jeff Mangum

quotes.text: I don't want to end up being a circus act, doing my most famous tricks when I'm 70.
quotes.author: Pharrell Williams

quotes.text: There is a circus around politics. But if you think it is a game, then you forget what the purpose of politics actually is.
quotes.author: Johann Lamont

quotes.text: Being an actor is well paid, but it's a bit like being a circus traveler.
quotes.author: Ben Chaplin

quotes.text: When I was a kid, I worked in the circus. It was a touring circus that was owned by a man named Terrell Jacobs. It was just one big tent, and he was a lion tamer. He didn't have any kids, but the bit was that I would dress up as his son in an identical outfit.
quotes.author: Christopher Walken

quotes.text: I don't have a place that I call home at the moment because there's no point. I mean, I'm a traveling circus for a while. It's weird. Like, if I wanted to go home, there's nowhere to go. I just go to a hotel. But I've kind of gotten used to it.
quotes.author: Idris Elba

quotes.text: In Roslyn, Pennsylvania, we started our real-life family circus. They provided the inspiration for my cartoons. I provided the perspiration.
quotes.author: Bil Keane

quotes.text: I would like to reconcile the church and the circus. I wanted to transform the theatre... to get my message across that there is only one God - the living man - the person sitting next to you. That is my religion. I believe that there is a sense to life.
quotes.author: Oleg Kulik

quotes.text: Next to a circus there ain't nothing that packs up and tears out faster than the Christmas spirit.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.text: When you're in theater or the circus or film - to me it's all one - affairs happen. People fall in love.
quotes.author: Baz Luhrmann

quotes.text: I love musicals; I love the ballet, opera, the circus. It's all performance to me.
quotes.author: Ian Mckellen

quotes.text: Damn everything but the circus.
quotes.author: Corita Kent

quotes.text: I started out doing multiple characters from day one, when I got my fist job in 'Dumbo's Circus.' I'm used to getting in an argument with myself, throwing myself off a cliff, patching myself up and brushing myself off with an arm around my shoulder.
quotes.author: Jim Cummings

quotes.text: Nobody should try to play comedy unless they have a circus going on inside.
quotes.author: Ernst Lubitsch

quotes.text: It seems so absurd to get really mad with a cartoonist over a comic strip. It's sort of like getting in a fight with a circus clown outside your house. It's not going to end well.
quotes.author: Stephan Pastis

quotes.text: When I was a child, going to a circus with wild animal acts was a rite of passage. These days, it's an act of complicit cruelty.
quotes.author: K. A. Applegate

quotes.text: I hate to witness animals in captivity - or see circus elephants paraded down the streets. When animals are caged, it's a loss of what they are.
quotes.author: K. A. Applegate

quotes.text: We didn't reinvent the circus. We repackaged it in a much more modern way.
quotes.author: Guy Laliberte

quotes.text: I love animals, and I was always attracted to the idea of being a zoo veterinarian or a veterinarian with the circus.
quotes.author: Kay Redfield Jamison

quotes.text: I'm a street photographer, but I'm interested in any ironic, whimsical images, and there's something very romantic about a circus.
quotes.author: Mary Ellen Mark

quotes.text: It's a circus life, the movies. It's a lot of travelling, a lot of antisocial hours; there's a lot of it that's about escaping from life.
quotes.author: Paul Greengrass

quotes.text: Commas in The New Yorker fall with the precision of knives in a circus act, outlining the victim.
quotes.author: E. B. White

quotes.text: Most people don't know that wrestling came out of the circus.
quotes.author: Billy Corgan

quotes.text: At any moment, one company stands in the spotlight of the middle ring in the stock market's never-ending circus. It may not be the biggest corporation in the world, or the most profitable, but somehow it both mirrors and leads the market's broader action.
quotes.author: Alex Berenson

quotes.text: How can you have a rock n' roll circus without a midget?
quotes.author: Nikki Sixx

quotes.text: Presidential primary debates are an important part of our political process. But the media has wrested complete control from the parties and candidates over everything, including the number, the format, the qualifications, and the moderators. And they've become a circus.
quotes.author: Mark McKinnon

quotes.text: The money I pay for my cultural experiences came willingly from my own pocket - they were not the result of bread being removed from the mouths of the poor so that Miss Thing here could mince off to the circus smelling of roses.
quotes.author: Julie Burchill

quotes.text: I enjoy being a hyphenate. I've always thought of my career as a plate spinner in the circus.
quotes.author: Neil Patrick Harris

quotes.text: I don't think the media circus has ever been a shock to my life seeing as I was with Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor when I was 17.
quotes.author: Francesca Annis

quotes.text: I am a Topshop homing pigeon! I can walk into the Oxford Circus branch and ferret out the best bits in minutes.
quotes.author: Ashley Madekwe

quotes.text: Well, I had an immense respect for Cirque du Soleil when I first say them in the '80s on a television show and just thought, you know, this group is really reinventing the circus, as you know. Because there wasn't three rings. There were no animals.
quotes.author: Criss Angel

quotes.text: So we see Edward as a young man on the road and he meets a giant and he brings the giant to a circus where he meets a Miss Calloway. He sees the woman of his dreams and I am the only one who knows who she is.
quotes.author: Danny DeVito

quotes.text: I will always remember this summer day in Paris, when I was to perform a great acrobatic move. I can still see myself stepping on the ring of a packed circus along real performers.
quotes.author: Tony Curtis

quotes.text: But the soul of touring and the heart of it is basically every day is like putting up a circus tent.
quotes.author: Pat Benatar

quotes.text: I did a cake for the 60th birthday of Elton John, for Britney Spears' 27th birthday and for the 'Circus' album she put out - the cake had circus themes. I prepared a cake for a surprise 82nd birthday event for the architect Frank Gehry; the cake was comprised of mini-replicas of his buildings.
quotes.author: Ron Ben-Israel

quotes.text: I never went to acting school. I started in the circus, music hall, I was in a group, did kids' bits. I've always had this kind of insecurity being uneducated.
quotes.author: Rupert Graves

quotes.text: Rock 'n' roll is like a circus today.
quotes.author: Ray Manzarek

quotes.text: Cannes is a circus, so you have to have fun with it. Everything suddenly becomes funny. And the promotion of a movie - that's where you really need to be a good actor. You need to make journalists believe that what you're saying is just for them and you've never said it before, even when you're talking about the same film over and over again.
quotes.author: Mathieu Amalric

quotes.text: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
quotes.author: Edgar Degas

quotes.text: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: Love the art in yourself and not yourself in the art.
quotes.author: Constantin Stanislavski

quotes.text: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
quotes.author: Scott Adams

quotes.text: This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.text: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: The artist who aims at perfection in everything achieves it in nothing.
quotes.author: Eugene Delacroix

quotes.text: Fine art is that in which the hand, the head, and the heart of man go together.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.text: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
quotes.author: Vincent Van Gogh

quotes.text: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: An artist cannot speak about his art any more than a plant can discuss horticulture.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
quotes.author: Edgar Degas

quotes.text: The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.
quotes.author: Twyla Tharp

quotes.text: Color is my day-long obsession, joy and torment.
quotes.author: Claude Monet

quotes.text: Photography takes an instant out of time, altering life by holding it still.
quotes.author: Dorothea Lange

quotes.text: The task of art today is to bring chaos into order.
quotes.author: Theodor Adorno

quotes.text: Art is not a thing; it is a way.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
quotes.author: Wilson Mizner

quotes.text: What makes photography a strange invention is that its primary raw materials are light and time.
quotes.author: John Berger

quotes.text: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
quotes.author: Salvador Dali

quotes.text: An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.
quotes.author: Andy Warhol

quotes.text: An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.
quotes.author: Charles Horton Cooley

quotes.text: I prefer drawing to talking. Drawing is faster, and leaves less room for lies.
quotes.author: Le Corbusier

quotes.text: An empty canvas is a living wonder... far lovelier than certain pictures.
quotes.author: Wassily Kandinsky

quotes.text: There hasn't been any art yet. Art is just beginning.
quotes.author: Constantin Brancusi

quotes.text: Painting is a nail to which I fasten my ideas.
quotes.author: Georges Braque

quotes.text: The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
quotes.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quotes.text: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: What art offers is space - a certain breathing room for the spirit.
quotes.author: John Updike

quotes.text: Through a painting we can see the whole world.
quotes.author: Hans Hofmann

quotes.text: Religion and art spring from the same root and are close kin. Economics and art are strangers.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.text: Painting is self-discovery. Every good artist paints what he is.
quotes.author: Jackson Pollock

quotes.text: I do not want art for a few any more than education for a few, or freedom for a few.
quotes.author: William Morris

quotes.text: To paint is a possessing rather than a picturing.
quotes.author: Philip Guston

quotes.text: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.text: I choose a block of marble and chop off whatever I don't need.
quotes.author: Auguste Rodin

quotes.text: A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.
quotes.author: Hedy Lamarr

quotes.text: To make pictures big is to make them more powerful.
quotes.author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quotes.text: A great artist is always before his time or behind it.
quotes.author: George Edward Moore

quotes.text: Every time a student walks past a really urgent, expressive piece of architecture that belongs to his college, it can help reassure him that he does have that mind, does have that soul.
quotes.author: Louis Kahn

quotes.text: In art, the obvious is a sin.
quotes.author: Edward Dmytryk

quotes.text: I hope to live all my life for my art, without abandoning my principles one iota.
quotes.author: Gustave Courbet

quotes.text: I don't paint things. I only paint the difference between things.
quotes.author: Henri Matisse

quotes.text: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
quotes.author: Carl Rogers

quotes.text: Not everybody trusts paintings but people believe photographs.
quotes.author: Ansel Adams

quotes.text: Impressionism; it is the birth of Light in painting.
quotes.author: Robert Delaunay

quotes.text: An original artist is unable to copy. So he has only to copy in order to be original.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: With color one obtains an energy that seems to stem from witchcraft.
quotes.author: Henri Matisse

quotes.text: An empty canvas is full.
quotes.author: Robert Rauschenberg

quotes.text: The mission of art is to represent nature not to imitate her.
quotes.author: William Morris Hunt

quotes.text: The philistine provides the best definition of art. Anything that makes him rage is first class.
quotes.author: Louis Dudek

quotes.text: My hand is the extension of the thinking process - the creative process.
quotes.author: Tadao Ando

quotes.text: The artist's job is to be a witness to his time in history.
quotes.author: Robert Rauschenberg

quotes.text: You begin with the possibilities of the material.
quotes.author: Robert Rauschenberg

quotes.text: Art is making something out of nothing and selling it.
quotes.author: Frank Zappa

quotes.text: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
quotes.author: Mary Schmich

quotes.text: I paint with shapes.
quotes.author: Alexander Calder

quotes.text: I don't want to be interesting. I want to be good.
quotes.author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quotes.text: If you do not breathe through writing, if you do not cry out in writing, or sing in writing, then don't write, because our culture has no use for it.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.text: My paintings are not about what is seen. They are about what is known forever in the mind.
quotes.author: Agnes Martin

quotes.text: A line is a dot that went for a walk.
quotes.author: Paul Klee

quotes.text: Art resides in the quality of doing, process is not magic.
quotes.author: Charles Eames

quotes.text: I don't want life to imitate art. I want life to be art.
quotes.author: Ernst Fischer

quotes.text: In a decaying society, art, if it is truthful, must also reflect decay. And unless it wants to break faith with its social function, art must show the world as changeable. And help to change it.
quotes.author: Ernst Fischer

quotes.text: Every picture shows a spot with which the artist has fallen in love.
quotes.author: Alfred Sisley

quotes.text: I don't believe in art. I believe in artists.
quotes.author: Marcel Duchamp

quotes.text: I am not strong on perfection.
quotes.author: Jasper Johns

quotes.text: If you know somethin' well, you can always paint it but people would be better off buyin' chickens.
quotes.author: Grandma Moses

quotes.text: Impressionism is the newspaper of the soul.
quotes.author: Henri Matisse

quotes.text: Layer by layer art strips life bare.
quotes.author: Robert Musil

quotes.text: An artist is forced by others to paint out of his own free will.
quotes.author: Willem de Kooning

quotes.text: Art is the child of Nature; yes, her darling child, in whom we trace the features of the mother's face, her aspect and her attitude.
quotes.author: Beck

quotes.text: That's why people listen to music or look at paintings. To get in touch with that wholeness.
quotes.author: Corita Kent

quotes.text: It is more important to click with people than to click the shutter.
quotes.author: Alfred Eisenstaedt

quotes.text: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
quotes.author: E. M. Forster

quotes.text: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
quotes.author: Sholom Aleichem

quotes.text: Life is a song - sing it. Life is a game - play it. Life is a challenge - meet it. Life is a dream - realize it. Life is a sacrifice - offer it. Life is love - enjoy it.
quotes.author: Sai Baba

quotes.text: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.text: We didn't lose the game; we just ran out of time.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.text: Every day is a new opportunity. You can build on yesterday's success or put its failures behind and start over again. That's the way life is, with a new game every day, and that's the way baseball is.
quotes.author: Bob Feller

quotes.text: The game of basketball has been everything to me. My place of refuge, place I've always gone where I needed comfort and peace. It's been the site of intense pain and the most intense feelings of joy and satisfaction. It's a relationship that has evolved over time, given me the greatest respect and love for the game.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.text: It's the game of life. Do I win or do I lose? One day they're gonna shut the game down. I gotta have as much fun and go around the board as many times as I can before it's my turn to leave.
quotes.author: Tupac Shakur

quotes.text: Just play. Have fun. Enjoy the game.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.text: Baseball was, is and always will be to me the best game in the world.
quotes.author: Babe Ruth

quotes.text: There's a difference between fair game and playing games.
quotes.author: Hillary Clinton

quotes.text: We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the game.
quotes.author: Randy Pausch

quotes.text: To me, throwback means I'm a smart player. I know how to play the game. I'm very skilled. I do a lot of things that other people don't do.
quotes.author: Kevin Love

quotes.text: Just be patient. Let the game come to you. Don't rush. Be quick, but don't hurry.
quotes.author: Earl Monroe

quotes.text: The way I figured it, I was even with baseball and baseball with me. The game had done much for me, and I had done much for it.
quotes.author: Jackie Robinson

quotes.text: Every game I've ever played, regardless if it was pre-season or Super Bowl, meant the same to me, and I laid it all on the line.
quotes.author: Brett Favre

quotes.text: I love baseball. The game allowed me the influence to impact kids in a positive way. This gives me a chance to talk to some social issues.
quotes.author: Cal Ripken, Jr.

quotes.text: Money is not a motivating factor. Money doesn't thrill me or make me play better because there are benefits to being wealthy. I'm just happy with a ball at my feet. My motivation comes from playing the game I love. If I wasn't paid to be a professional footballer I would willingly play for nothing.
quotes.author: Lionel Messi

quotes.text: Life is like a game of cards. The hand you are dealt is determinism; the way you play it is free will.
quotes.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.text: Football is a simple game. Twenty-two men chase a ball for 90 minutes and at the end, the Germans always win.
quotes.author: Gary Lineker

quotes.text: Life is a difficult game. You can win it only by retaining your birthright to be a person.
quotes.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.text: I was told in high school that the last game during your senior year stays with you forever, which is true.
quotes.author: Jim Otto

quotes.text: I'm not so mean. I wouldn't ever go out to hurt anybody deliberately - unless it was, you know, important, like a league game or something.
quotes.author: Dick Butkus

quotes.text: Leadership is not a popularity contest; it's about leaving your ego at the door. The name of the game is to lead without a title.
quotes.author: Robin S. Sharma

quotes.text: I think a gentleman is someone who holds the comfort of other people above their own. The instinct to do that is inside every good man, I believe. The rules about opening doors and buying dinner and all of that other 'gentleman' stuff is a chess game, especially these days.
quotes.author: Anna Kendrick

quotes.text: Satire is a lesson, parody is a game.
quotes.author: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.text: At a book festival in Fort Lauderdale, I met David Eisenhower, Ike's grandson, who was promoting his book 'Going Home to Glory: A Memoir of Life with Dwight D. Eisenhower,' in which he describes attending the Yankees' 154th game in 1961. The whole family had been following Mantle and Maris chase Babe Ruth's home run record across the country.
quotes.author: Jane Leavy

quotes.text: Baseball is like a poker game. Nobody wants to quit when he's losing; nobody wants you to quit when you're ahead.
quotes.author: Jackie Robinson

quotes.text: To me, cricket is a simple game. Keep it simple and just go out and play.
quotes.author: Shane Warne

quotes.text: Look at a football field. It looks like a big movie screen. This is theatre. Football combines the strategy of chess. It's part ballet. It's part battleground, part playground. We clarify, amplify and glorify the game with our footage, the narration and that music, and in the end create an inspirational piece of footage.
quotes.author: Steve Sabol

quotes.text: I played the game one way. I gave it everything I had. It doesn't take any ability to hustle.
quotes.author: Wade Boggs

quotes.text: Life is a game and true love is a trophy.
quotes.author: Rufus Wainwright

quotes.text: I'm not better when I force shots. I'm going to take them as they come. They are really sagging in there, trying to take me out of the game. It's my job to find guys. I want to be aggressive and take my shots, but I can't force them.
quotes.author: Tim Duncan

quotes.text: Take the hardcore gamers. The characters are way more real in the world of hardcore gamers who have played the game for hundreds of hours. They have the movie in their heads, they've built it on their own. These guys are always very disappointed in the movies.
quotes.author: Uwe Boll

quotes.text: Auction houses run a rigged game. They know exactly how many people will be bidding on a work and exactly who they are. In a gallery, works of art need only one person who wants to pay for them.
quotes.author: Jerry Saltz

quotes.text: This year I've just been aggressive. I still have that mindset of passing the ball, and being aggressive and attacking to the basket is going to draw more attention, and that way I can find my teammates. Being in attack mode is something I try to bring into every single game, and that's what's making me be so successful.
quotes.author: James Harden

quotes.text: My job is to protect the integrity of the NFL and to make sure the game is as safe as possible.
quotes.author: Roger Goodell

quotes.text: I've done a song with almost everybody in the game.
quotes.author: Two Chainz

quotes.text: I know I'm never as good or bad as one single performance. I've never believed in my critics or my worshippers, and I've always been able to leave the game at the arena.
quotes.author: Charles Barkley

quotes.text: After 20 years in the game, I was fortunate to get away from the game and enjoy my family, which was great for me.
quotes.author: Joe Sakic

quotes.text: I didn't have to win, and winning wasn't important to me. Being world champion wasn't important to me. What was important to me was entertaining the audience, and whether that meant winning, losing, singing, or whatever it was on the live show we were doing every week, which was awesome, I was game for it.
quotes.author: Dwayne Johnson

quotes.text: Too many people get lost in the game of having a good time and being naive about things.
quotes.author: Steve Brown

quotes.text: I like college football, but I'm a huge college basketball fan. I could sit and watch every game of March Madness and be happy. That could be a vacation.
quotes.author: Lewis Black

quotes.text: I don't want to be just known for the way I dress. I want to be known for how I play, how I treat people, and how I am as a role model. I don't just want to be, 'He dresses cool' or 'He dresses crazy.' You're going to have lovers and haters. I want my golf game to be the main thing.
quotes.author: Rickie Fowler

quotes.text: There has always been a saying in baseball that you can't make a hitter, but I think you can improve a hitter. More than you can improve a fielder. More mistakes are made hitting than in any other part of the game.
quotes.author: Ted Williams

quotes.text: My life used to be like that game of freeze tag we played as kids. Once tagged, you had to freeze in the position you were in. Whenever something happened, I'd freeze like a statue, too afraid of moving the wrong way, of making the wrong decision. The problem is, if you stand still too long, that's your decision.
quotes.author: Regina Brett

quotes.text: I have a tip that will take five strokes off anyone's golf game. It's called an eraser.
quotes.author: Arnold Palmer

quotes.text: We played well in Kenya. We didn't lose a game and we bowled Pakistan out for 100 twice. We don't need to change much from that for this tournament.
quotes.author: Shane Warne

quotes.text: We must not let ourselves get driven off course, no matter what happens we must stick to our natural game.
quotes.author: Zinedine Zidane

quotes.text: Riding my motorcycle around L.A. is like my own video game. But unlike many folks at the wheel, I am occupied with getting where I'm going and keeping myself safe. Most people are applying makeup, texting, and checking out the beauty in the next car.
quotes.author: Hugh Laurie

quotes.text: The Nationals tried hard to recover the lost ground. The final result, however, was the success of the Forest Citys by a score of 29 to 23 in a nine innings game, twice interrupted by rain.
quotes.author: Henry Chadwick

quotes.text: I play to win, whether during practice or a real game. And I will not let anything get in the way of me and my competitive enthusiasm to win.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.text: All you can do is really the prep work and make sure you're ready to hit each golf shot. Outside of that, you're not sure really what's going to happen. It's a funny game, but I think that's why I love it. You never know, one day to the next; you could go shoot 62, and the next day you're going to shoot 78, and you can't predict it.
quotes.author: Rickie Fowler

quotes.text: I know that, in hockey, the object of the game is simple in that you have to get the puck into the net. With figure skating, it's not as simple, and there is a ton of work that goes into it.
quotes.author: Patrick Chan

quotes.text: It's not so important who starts the game but who finishes it.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: The American people, Neil, are sick and tired of excuses. They are sick and tired of the blame game. And they're sick and tired of the deception coming from this president and this administration. This is why I believe that I am doing so well in the polls.
quotes.author: Herman Cain

quotes.text: There's no way the writing staff of 'Game of Thrones' haven't read 'The Art of War.' There's definitely an influence on 'Game of Thrones' from this book in both a general way and on the character of Lord Baelish and his strategies.
quotes.author: Aidan Gillen

quotes.text: I set very high standards for myself and worked every game with the same energy and enthusiasm as if it were the seventh game of a World Series.
quotes.author: Jim Evans

quotes.text: Mere longevity is a good thing for those who watch Life from the side lines. For those who play the game, an hour may be a year, a single day's work an achievement for eternity.
quotes.author: Helen Hayes

quotes.text: Baseball gives every American boy a chance to excel, not just to be as good as someone else but to be better than someone else. This is the nature of man and the name of the game.
quotes.author: Ted Williams

quotes.text: The chairmen of the largest companies in the world can cancel an appointment or move a board meeting; a manager cannot change the date of a game. In the combined 42 years that Sir Alex Ferguson and Arsene Wenger have managed in English football, I can only remember one occasion when Sir Alex did not attend a Manchester United game.
quotes.author: Howard Wilkinson

quotes.text: Football is a game of mistakes. Whoever makes the fewest mistakes wins.
quotes.author: Johan Cruyff

quotes.text: She felt like a chess player who, by the clever handling of his pieces, sees the game taking the course intended. Her eyes were bright and tender with a smile as they glanced up into his; and her lips looked hungry for the kiss which they invited.
quotes.author: Kate Chopin

quotes.text: I always wanted to be somebody. If I made it, it's half because I was game enough to take a lot of punishment along the way and half because there were a lot of people who cared enough to help me.

quotes.text: I went to a fight the other night, and a hockey game broke out.

quotes.text: I'm at like 325 pairs right now, give or take. But I've given away about 200 pairs of sneakers. I'm not as big of a collector as I used to be, because I think the game just got weird. Everybody likes to collect now, so it's kind of corny. But I got the essentials.

quotes.text: I've learned how to stay humble. I don't want to get in over my head because when you do that it takes you off your game.

quotes.text: When you play in the Premier League, say you're playing against a lower-end team, they set up to defend all the time, they set up to block you off. But when you play in the Champions League, all the other teams are used to winning every week, so it's more of an open game, it's more attacking, end-to-end.
