quotes.text: Every age has its storytelling form, and video gaming is a huge part of our culture. You can ignore or embrace video games and imbue them with the best artistic quality. People are enthralled with video games in the same way as other people love the cinema or theatre.
quotes.author: Andy Serkis

quotes.text: Cinema is a matter of what's in the frame and what's out.
quotes.author: Martin Scorsese

quotes.text: Cinema should make you forget you are sitting in a theater.
quotes.author: Roman Polanski

quotes.text: Cinema in India is like brushing your teeth in the morning. You can't escape it.
quotes.author: Shah Rukh Khan

quotes.text: Indian cinema gives you everything that western cinema doesn't. It's maseladar and spicy. If you like Indian food, I think you'll love Indian movies.
quotes.author: Shahid Kapoor

quotes.text: I really believe musical form will go on. There's got to be a way of making musical form in cinema live again.
quotes.author: Baz Luhrmann

quotes.text: The select group of people who do make realistic cinema, who do make cinema perhaps a little more acceptable to the Western audience, is a very small percentage.
quotes.author: Amitabh Bachchan

quotes.text: I believe that one of the secret engines that allows cinema to work, and have the marvelous power over us that it does, is the fact that for thousands of years we have spent eight hours every night in a 'cinematic' dream-state, and so are familiar with this version of reality.
quotes.author: Walter Murch

quotes.text: I live cinema and passionately love music, and my efforts in both these crafts are unfolding.
quotes.author: Priyanka Chopra

quotes.text: I like it when somebody tells me a story, and I actually really feel that that's becoming like a lost art in American cinema.
quotes.author: Quentin Tarantino

quotes.text: I'm getting a little bored by the juxtaposition of American and other cinema. I no longer think this division is as true as it might have been in the 1980s, or the early part of the 90s.
quotes.author: Wim Wenders

quotes.text: I tried to sing 'What's Going On' with Amy Winehouse once at an old cinema in the West End. There was a funk band that had members of both of our bands playing in it, but it was the worst kind of place to sing bad karaoke because everyone there was an amazing singer or musician.
quotes.author: Jamie Cullum

quotes.text: I am not someone who sacrifice all for the cinema, my life will be always more important.
quotes.author: Natalie Portman

quotes.text: I don't know anything about life, but everything about cinema.
quotes.author: Romy Schneider

quotes.text: I love dabbling in different genres, and I like being good at different genres of cinema.
quotes.author: Priyanka Chopra

quotes.text: The whole aspect of cinema and film festivals should be a moment to come together and celebrate art and humanity. It would be a shame if there was such a divide.
quotes.author: Keanu Reeves

quotes.text: I am young enough to try my hands at all kinds of cinema.
quotes.author: Ranbir Kapoor

quotes.text: I think cinema should provoke thoughts, sure, but using it as I soapbox I think is the wrong place. I never want to be part of something like that, where there's an agenda there that's not about telling a story, where its someone getting on a soapbox and preaching their own beliefs onto somebody.
quotes.author: Jeremy Renner

quotes.text: I see horror as part of legitimate film. I don't see it as an independent genre that has nothing to do with the rest of cinema.
quotes.author: Guillermo del Toro

quotes.text: To the Parisians, and especially to the children, all Americans are now 'heros du cinema.' This is particularly disconcerting to sensitive war correspondents, if any, aware, as they are, that these innocent thanks belong to those American combat troops who won the beachhead and then made the breakthrough. There are few such men in Paris.
quotes.author: A. J. Liebling

quotes.text: In terms of popular cinema, 'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest' is as near perfection as I can think of.
quotes.author: Peter Mullan

quotes.text: The appeal of cinema lies in the fear of death.
quotes.author: Jim Morrison

quotes.text: My style of songwriting is influenced by cinema. I'm a frustrated filmmaker. A fan once said to me, 'Girl, you make me see pictures in my head!' and I took that as a great compliment. That's exactly my intention.
quotes.author: Joni Mitchell

quotes.text: I am an animator. I feel like I'm the manager of a animation cinema factory. I am not an executive. I'm rather like a foreman, like the boss of a team of craftsmen. That is the spirit of how I work.
quotes.author: Hayao Miyazaki

quotes.text: Entertainment today constantly emphasises the message that things are wonderful the way they are. But there is another kind of cinema, which says that change is possible and necessary and it's up to you.
quotes.author: Wim Wenders

quotes.text: I prefer ordinary girls - you know, college students, waitresses, that sort of thing. Most of the girls I go out with are just good friends. Just because I go out to the cinema with a girl, it doesn't mean we are dating.
quotes.author: Leonardo DiCaprio

quotes.text: For me, the cinema is not a slice of life, but a piece of cake.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.text: Feudal societies don't create great cinema; we have great theatre. The egalitarian societies create great cinema. The Americans, the French. Because equality is sort of what the cinema deals with. It deals with stories which don't fall into 'Everybody in their place and who's who,' and all that. But the theatre's full of that.
quotes.author: Brian Cox

quotes.text: Now more than ever we need to talk to each other, to listen to each other and understand how we see the world, and cinema is the best medium for doing this.
quotes.author: Martin Scorsese

quotes.text: The essence of cinema is editing. It's the combination of what can be extraordinary images of people during emotional moments, or images in a general sense, put together in a kind of alchemy.
quotes.author: Francis Ford Coppola

quotes.text: Every viewer is going to get a different thing. That's the thing about painting, photography, cinema.
quotes.author: David Lynch

quotes.text: Even in Indian cinema, there is so much work that I have accepted because I'm comfortable and so much I have declined because I haven't been comfortable.
quotes.author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

quotes.text: Photography is truth. The cinema is truth twenty-four times per second.
quotes.author: Jean-Luc Godard

quotes.text: Art reflects society. Cinema doesn't dictate - you portray what the society demands.
quotes.author: Sonam Kapoor

quotes.text: When it's good, cinema can be one of the most important things in a person's life. A film can be a catalyst for change. You witness this and it is an incredibly spiritual experience that I'd never lived before; well, maybe only in a football match.
quotes.author: Gael Garcia Bernal

quotes.text: Harrison Ford was pretty content as a carpenter who thought it would be nice to work on TV and ended up being the biggest film star in the history of cinema.
quotes.author: Dirk Benedict

quotes.text: I am a product of Indian cinema; I've grown up watching Indian films ever since I can remember. And song and dance is part of our lives; it's part of our culture; we wake up to songs, we sleep to lullabies, you know, we celebrate every religious and traditional function with music.
quotes.author: Karan Johar

quotes.text: I love films that make me react emotionally and physically when you walk out of the cinema. Two of my favorite films however have got to be 'The Tree Of Life' and 'The Piano Teacher,' which also stars one of my favourite actresses Isabelle Huppert.
quotes.author: Alicia Vikander

quotes.text: I'm under the impression that this notion of decency is disappearing from our society where conflicts are made worse on cinema and on television, where people are nasty and cruel on the Internet and where, in general, everybody seems to be very angry.
quotes.author: Helen Mirren

quotes.text: Cinema is still a very young art form with extraordinary techniques and very impressive special effects but sometimes it seems the soul has been taken out of things.
quotes.author: Catherine Deneuve

quotes.text: I never got in this business, in cinema, to make horror movies. They arrived on my doorstep and I got typecast. Which was fine, I enjoy it, but I got into this business to make westerns. And the kind of westerns I used to see, they died. So that didn't work out.
quotes.author: John Carpenter

quotes.text: There's something rather wonderful about the fact that Oxford is a very small city that contains most of the cultural and metropolitan facilities you could want, in terms of bookshops, theatre, cinema, conversation. But it's near enough to London to get here in an hour, and it's near enough to huge open spaces without which I would go insane.
quotes.author: Mark Haddon

quotes.text: Although for some people cinema means something superficial and glamorous, it is something else. I think it is the mirror of the world.
quotes.author: Jeanne Moreau

quotes.text: It is important that alongside the blockbusters there are stories that can inspire and audiences can experience together in the cinema.
quotes.author: Justin Chadwick

quotes.text: I am not at all interested in theories about cinema. I am only interested in images and people and sound. I am really a very simple person.
quotes.author: Claire Denis

quotes.text: I like and I love everything that has to do with cinema: writing, directing, editing, creating music, and even acting.
quotes.author: Werner Herzog

quotes.text: Cinema reflects culture and there is no harm in adapting technology, but not at the cost of losing your originality.
quotes.author: Jackie Chan

quotes.text: Cinema can fill in the empty spaces of your life and your loneliness.
quotes.author: Pedro Almodovar

quotes.text: We can't keep thinking in a limited way about what cinema is. We still don't know what cinema is. Maybe cinema could only really apply to the past or the first 100 years, when people actually went to a theater to see a film, you see?
quotes.author: Martin Scorsese

quotes.text: Cinema is universal, beyond flags and borders and passports.
quotes.author: Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu

quotes.text: Cinema has opened a world of possibilities up for me.
quotes.author: Antonio Banderas

quotes.text: I'm very fond of the British cinema. I'm a big fan of Martin Campbell and Daniel Craig. I actually find Daniel very inspirational, especially on the physical side of things. He really inspired me to get back into shape when I started to add on a few pounds. I think he's a great role model.
quotes.author: Steven Bauer

quotes.text: It doesn't matter if it's black-and-white. If a movie has a story that is filled with emotion, you can have as much pleasure, and it's very good for cinema.
quotes.author: Thomas Langmann

quotes.text: Our group has been in Asia since 1981 in mining, oil and gas. Now we want to mine not silver and gold, but great stories and people, and change the world of cinema, and we want to do that by walking in the footsteps of Wu Tianming.
quotes.author: Robert Friedland

quotes.text: I've never done a film before where every single person in the audience knows the ending. I mean suspense, twists are almost impossible these days. People are blogging your endings from their cinema seats.
quotes.author: Danny Boyle

quotes.text: When I was 16, I felt very relieved to discover cinema. It was like an island where I could see life and death from another perspective. Every young person should be interested in that island. It's a beautiful place.
quotes.author: Leos Carax

quotes.text: I tend to play characters that I can infuse with certain kinds of humour. Even the baddest guy can be funny in his own particular way. I want the audience to engage with the character on some deeper level so that they leave the cinema still thinking about him.
quotes.author: Samuel L. Jackson

quotes.text: Cinema should always be in touch with the soil of the country. My films celebrate the heartland of India.
quotes.author: Salman Khan

quotes.text: Everybody has something that chews them up and, for me, that thing was always loneliness. The cinema has the power to make you not feel lonely, even when you are.
quotes.author: Tom Hanks

quotes.text: Cinema is the most beautiful fraud in the world.
quotes.author: Jean-Luc Godard

quotes.text: The notion of directing a film is the invention of critics - the whole eloquence of cinema is achieved in the editing room.
quotes.author: Orson Welles

quotes.text: I just like really simple things. If I had been on tour for a while and I got to come back and take my girlfriend Eleanor on a date, we would go to the cinema and then out for dinner.
quotes.author: Louis Tomlinson

quotes.text: A cinema villain essentially needs a moustache so he can twiddle with it gleefully as he cooks up his next nasty plan.
quotes.author: Mel Brooks

quotes.text: Cinema seats make people lazy. They expect to be given all the information. But for me, question marks are the punctuation of life.
quotes.author: Abbas Kiarostami

quotes.text: Strangers used to gather together at the cinema and sit together in the dark, like Ancient Greeks participating in the mysteries, dreaming the same dream in unison.
quotes.author: Angela Carter

quotes.text: I don't think I can speak of the achievements of Indian cinema because it's so large next to me. It's not stopping. It's ever-growing. We are going towards the right direction. We are evolving as a filmmaking industry as actors, directors, producers, singers, musicians. Everybody just pushing the boundaries.
quotes.author: Ranbir Kapoor

quotes.text: Good cinema is what we can believe, and bad cinema is what we can't believe.
quotes.author: Abbas Kiarostami

quotes.text: I saw David Lynch's 'The Elephant Man' when I was 15. I was completely bowled over. I found it so beautiful, strange and mesmerizing that I went back to the cinema every night for a week to see it.
quotes.author: Ben Daniels

quotes.text: I was born at a bad time for Spain, but a really good one for cinema.
quotes.author: Pedro Almodovar

quotes.text: A movie is a mass consumption product. I have got no delusions about being niche. I don't want to be niche. Though in the earlier part of my career I was into niche cinema, doing independent films - and I do have a revolutionary bent of mind - but you cannot make a change from outside; you have to be a part of it.
quotes.author: Randeep Hooda

quotes.text: My career in the movie business began in Hong Kong, my heart has always been tied to Asia, and it is immensely gratifying to see international recognition for Asian cinema as a whole.
quotes.author: Michelle Yeoh

quotes.text: Do we recognize the platform that Indian cinema has been given? Of course. And typically India of us, we gracefully acknowledge our host's grace and we thank you for celebrating us and our cinema.
quotes.author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

quotes.text: One of the nicest things I ever read about our show was that a critic felt 'Boardwalk Empire' could be the beginning of the blur between television and cinema, because the production values are so high and the storytelling is so compelling.
quotes.author: Terence Winter

quotes.text: Sequels are not done for the audience or cinema or the filmmakers. It's for the distributor. The film becomes a brand.
quotes.author: Francis Ford Coppola

quotes.text: I would never put on 20 kilos and mess up my system because a role demands it. Hindi cinema doesn't offer you roles that get you an Oscar, anyway. Tom Hanks can do it in Hollywood; not us.
quotes.author: Bipasha Basu

quotes.text: Elaine and I got married in summer 1979, we went on our honeymoon and came back for the premiere of 'Scum.' All of sudden my face was on billboards in Leicester Square and people were crowding outside the cinema, going mad about the film. It was a complete shock.
quotes.author: Ray Winstone

quotes.text: Indian cinema is entertaining, and what I love most about it is the songs and dances in the films.
quotes.author: Pierce Brosnan

quotes.text: My father is a silent cinema freak, so he took me to 1925 silent films that took forever, like 5-hour movies, but I've seen a lot of that stuff since I was young. And then I saw the film 'Annie,' and I just wanted to be Annie; I just wanted to be that orphan kid and wanted to sing and dance.
quotes.author: Carice van Houten

quotes.text: I have made a promise to myself that I will have no limitations as an actor. I have realised I have to pay attention to the commercials or the business aspect of cinema, but deep inside, I am purely an artiste.
quotes.author: Randeep Hooda

quotes.text: And Twin Peaks, the Film is the craziest film in the history of cinema. I have no idea what happened, I have no idea what I saw, all I know is that I left the theater floating six feet above the ground.
quotes.author: Jacques Rivette

quotes.text: There are plenty of skills I've learned from playing video games. It's more interactive than watching TV, because there are problems to solve as you're using your brain.
quotes.author: Shaun White

quotes.text: You can find heroism everyday, like guys working terrible jobs because they've got to support their families. Or as far as humor, the things I see on the job, on the street, are far funnier than anything you'll ever see on TV.
quotes.author: Harvey Pekar

quotes.text: A lot of TV is put together by teams, by writing staffs and several different directors. It's a great, very smart way to make television. It's worked for however long TV's been around.
quotes.author: Louis C. K.

quotes.text: I just go at my own pace and I like control of the TV and I like to decide when I take a shower and wash the dishes and stuff like that. So I don't know who would want to live with me to be honest!
quotes.author: Leighton Meester

quotes.text: A picador is the guy in a bullfight who helps make sure the matador doesn't get killed by distracting the bull. That's what TV writing is. You're just distracting the bull long enough to stick around for the next set of commercials.
quotes.author: Christopher Lloyd

quotes.text: There's sort of a very symbiotic thing that happens on good TV shows with great writers, which is that they start to sort of embrace who the actors are and try to make the roles more specific to what they bring and what they can do.
quotes.author: Lucas Neff

quotes.text: My mom's always been a good cook, so I took a lot of stuff from her, but most of the stuff I took from Emeril or Bobby Flay right off the TV and make it. I just loved to cook, so it just became a thing. It's a release. Even if I'm alone, I'll cook a full meal, maybe even a two-course meal, just because I love to cook. It's my secret love!
quotes.author: Christian Kane

quotes.text: At the Emmys, you've got a bunch of people who are used to being on TV on TV. You don't have that at the Oscars. At the Oscars, you have people who are used to having 40 takes.
quotes.author: Jimmy Kimmel

quotes.text: Can someone's true value really be estimated? Maybe there needs to be an Edmunds.com for people on TV. That would be funny and possibly cruel.
quotes.author: Derek Hough

quotes.text: I never thought I'd be making a living off of acting - it's still kind of a shock for my family and friends to see my face on TV every Wednesday night.
quotes.author: Matthew Gray Gubler

quotes.text: I am not interested in considering another TV series. This one was a wonderful experience which will be hard to top, and It's caused me to turn down several good film opportunities because of the schedule.
quotes.author: Dennis Franz

quotes.text: TV's like whitewater rafting: Without rocks, there wouldn't be rapids, and it wouldn't be as much fun.
quotes.author: Joss Whedon

quotes.text: I don't watch TV. In my spare time, if I have any, I want to make music.
quotes.author: Chino Moreno

quotes.text: I was completely with the reality TV boom for a while. I really liked a lot of the reality TV, and the one that lost me was the ballroom dancing one they do, 'Dancing with the Stars.' That was the one where I watched it and I was perplexed. I thought it was really boring.
quotes.author: Adam McKay

quotes.text: I watch a lot of TV. That's how I spend most of my time outside of work. If I had more time, I would fill it 100 percent with watching TV.
quotes.author: Luis von Ahn

quotes.text: Allowing your kids to watch TV doesn't have to mean they have no choice but to see commercials for junk food and alcohol.
quotes.author: Charlie Ergen

quotes.text: I am alone a lot, which is good. I need that time to just be alone after a long day, just decompress. So, I go to either my house or the hotel, or my apartment, or whatever - wherever I am, I go home and I watch TV and I sit there, with my cat, and I just watch TV or go online, check my emails.
quotes.author: Taylor Swift

quotes.text: There was definitely a lack of any sort of villain in the Clinton era, which is why, when Columbine happened, it was easy to pick on me. My face was around, and it made good TV.
quotes.author: Marilyn Manson

quotes.text: I don't doll myself up for TV because I want people to accept me for who I am.
quotes.author: John Cena

quotes.text: I was on some TV shows with Lady Gaga the other week, and you could see the difference in reaction between her fans and my fans outside. She comes out, and she looks like a star, and the reaction is just tears, crying, people going, 'Oh my God, Oh my God.' My fans are like: 'Alright, Ed.'
quotes.author: Ed Sheeran

quotes.text: Celebrity culture, it's everywhere, isn't it? It's reality TV, Big Brother. I didn't become a footballer to be famous, I became a footballer to be successful. I didn't want to be famous. Now people want to be famous. Why? Why would you want people following you about all day?
quotes.author: Ryan Giggs

quotes.text: It's not like Alaska isn't wilderness - it mostly is. But most Alaskans don't live in the wild. They live on the edge of the wild in towns with schools and cable TV and stores and dentists and roller rinks sometimes. It's just like anyplace else, only with mountains and moose.
quotes.author: Tom Bodett

quotes.text: Limit or eliminate late-night computer and television viewing. A computer or TV screen may seem much dimmer than a light bulb, but these screens often fill your field of vision, mimicking the effects of a room filled with light.
quotes.author: Andrew Weil

quotes.text: I had an early taste of fame. I was 20, going out with TV presenter Dani Behr and we'd have paparazzi chasing us. I'm not comfortable being photographed, though I accept it is part of the job. I had to ask myself, 'What comes first, being a celebrity or footballer?'
quotes.author: Ryan Giggs

quotes.text: Eat some pizza, play some Xbox, watch some TV. Gross? Maybe. Me? Yes.
quotes.author: Dustin Diamond

quotes.text: My life has always been compartmentalized into different aspects. I have my speed skating Olympic pursuits, I have my personal life and have my business life and have my entertainment - TV - Hollywood - whatever have you - always compartmentalizing every aspect of my life.
quotes.author: Apolo Ohno

quotes.text: In Russia we only had two TV channels. Channel One was propaganda. Channel Two consisted of a KGB officer telling you: Turn back at once to Channel One.
quotes.author: Yakov Smirnoff

quotes.text: I think the 24-hour news cycle has helped exaggerate the differences between the parties. You can always find someone on TV somewhere carping about something. That didn't happen 20 years ago.
quotes.author: George H. W. Bush

quotes.text: With the stand-up comic on TV, whether it's Seinfeld or Cosby or Roseanne, more important than their knowledge of how to tell a joke is their knowledge of themselves, or the persona they've created as themselves. So that when you're in a room with writers, you can say, 'Guys, that's a funny line, but I wouldn't say it.'
quotes.author: Bob Newhart

quotes.text: In TV, film, and music there's a lot of snobbery, and I don't like it. I've never been a cultural snob.
quotes.author: Simon Cowell

quotes.text: I've done my share of period stuff. I'm not sure why, but people say I have a period face. The bread and butter of British TV is Jane Austen adaptations and bridges and bonnets and boats and horses.
quotes.author: Tom Hiddleston

quotes.text: So instead of watching TV, we read every night together as a family.
quotes.author: Arne Duncan

quotes.text: If I hear an interesting turn of phrase on TV, I'll repeat it back - I just like to roll it around on my tongue. The same goes for dialog: I'll either speak it aloud or whisper it. I definitely sit in front of my computer and mutter. People have mentioned it.
quotes.author: Terence Winter

quotes.text: I have a TV Soap Boomerang award, and I always start my year with the Australian Open tennis! Tennis, soccer, you name it.
quotes.author: Doug Davidson

quotes.text: In Chinese culture, it wouldn't occur to kids to question or talk back to their parents. In American culture, kids in books, TV shows and movies constantly score points with their snappy back talk. Typically, it's the parents who need to be taught a life lesson - by their children.
quotes.author: Amy Chua

quotes.text: You don't hear TV cops griping because they have to enforce some Draconian law that shouldn't be on the books in the first place, or lamenting vindictive excesses in sentencing. Hollywood, supposedly a frothing cauldron of liberalism, has always been conservative on crime.
quotes.author: Tom Shales

quotes.text: I have an Emmy, but it's no big deal: work in TV news long enough, you eventually get one.
quotes.author: Deborah Copaken Kogan

quotes.text: If I knew how to operate a DVR, you'd find episodes of 'The Tavis Smiley Show,' 'Democracy Now!' and lots of stuff from TV Land. What you can find now on my Hulu account are Korean soap operas, 'Grey's Anatomy' and films from the Criterion collection.
quotes.author: T'Keyah Crystal Keymah

quotes.text: The TV business is like the produce section of the market. Today everything is fresh and glistening and firm. And tomorrow, when they find a bruise on you, they toss you out.
quotes.author: Bryan Cranston

quotes.text: If I have the TV on, it's either a Mets game or 'SportsCenter.'
quotes.author: Eddie Kaye Thomas

quotes.text: When your culture comes from watching TV every day, you're bombarded with images of things that seem cool, places that seem interesting, people who have jobs and careers and opportunities. None of that happened where I was. You're almost taught to realize it's not for you.
quotes.author: Trent Reznor

quotes.text: I like to talk on TV about those things that aren't worth writing about.
quotes.author: Truman Capote

quotes.text: Reality TV is to popular because it allows so many people to sit on the sidelines and just watch somebody else's life. God is saying, 'Don't sit on the sidelines of life. I have put so much in you, but you have got to be strong and very courageous. You have got to step out in faith.'
quotes.author: Victoria Osteen

quotes.text: When you see me on TV, that's about as close to my real personality as you can get.
quotes.author: John Cena

quotes.text: I stopped directing in 2001 for four or five years, until I did the TV series 'Masters Of Horror.' I had been working steadily as a director since 1970. That's a long time. I was burned out.
quotes.author: John Carpenter

quotes.text: I was so besotted with '8½' that, when it was on TV, I used to take pictures with my 35-mm. camera of the frames of the film. That was the first time I'd ever really seen Italians on screen.
quotes.author: David Chase

quotes.text: Ron Swanson is more than the MVP of the 'Parks and Recreation' squad, more than just the funniest character on TV - he's the perfect depiction of aggrieved American manhood at the twilight of the empire.
quotes.author: Rob Sheffield

quotes.text: Good music comes out of people playing together, knowing what they want to do and going for it. You have to sweat over it and bug it to death. You can't do it by pushing buttons and watching a TV screen.
quotes.author: Keith Richards

quotes.text: My choices in projects have all been character or role-based, and on a financial level, it's obvious: as an actor on a TV series, I get a wonderful paycheck, and a consistent paycheck, which doesn't always happen when you're doing theater or movies.
quotes.author: Jim Parsons

quotes.text: Our top story tonight: Famous TV dolphin flipper was arrested today on prostitution ring charges. He allegedly was seen transporting two 16 year olds across state line for immoral porpoises.
quotes.author: Colin Mochrie

quotes.text: When you're a guest star on TV shows - particularly in the 1960s - you're always the villain.
quotes.author: Robert Vaughn

quotes.text: I feed my kids organic food and milk, but I've also been known to buy the odd Lunchable. My kids are not allowed to watch TV during the week, but on weekends even the 2-year-old veges out to 'The Simpsons.'
quotes.author: Ayelet Waldman

quotes.text: I was always very curious about what a scientist's life was like when I was young. Of course, when I was young, you didn't have very many opportunities to find out with no web, TV. I was very lucky: I was born in the city of Chicago and went to the University of Chicago where I actually saw things.
quotes.author: James D. Watson

quotes.text: I liked teaching, but the bureaucracy of academia and the petty intrigue... It wasn't a good fit. Once I admitted that myself, that I didn't like academia, I was ready to try TV.
quotes.author: Nic Pizzolatto

quotes.text: I'm very hairy, and men in film and TV are no longer allowed to be hairy.
quotes.author: Nick Offerman

quotes.text: I think of myself as a Hollywood hillbilly, but I'm sick of all these questions people ask about Alabama. 'Do you have an outhouse?' 'Is there a lot of inbreeding in your family?' They think all Southerners don't have computers and TV sets and that we're all still living in 1862.
quotes.author: Sunny Mabrey

quotes.text: Stand-up can take you in so many different places, man. So many doors can be opened up from stand-up comedy, and the first one that was opened up for me was acting. But you can go from acting to being a TV personality to being a radio personality to being a writer to being a producer, to just being a visionary, to voiceover work.
quotes.author: Kevin Hart

quotes.text: Because we put ourselves in a movie or on TV, then it must mean we want to be completely open to the world. Sometimes, people will run up to you as if this is Disneyland and I'm a character. I understand their point of view, but it's difficult to explain how terrified it makes me. I'm so nervous.
quotes.author: Brie Larson

quotes.text: Women are the only 'oppressed' group that is able to buy most of the $10 billion worth of cosmetics each year; the only oppressed group that spends more on high fashion, brand-name clothing than its oppressors; the only oppressed group that watches more TV.
quotes.author: Warren Farrell

quotes.text: Because good writing in a TV cartoon is so rare, I think the animation on The Simpsons is often overlooked.
quotes.author: Matt Groening

quotes.text: People think about the world of TV and the world of online video as being different ways to distribute video. But what happens when every TV is connected to wi-fi with a browser?
quotes.author: Chad Hurley

quotes.text: Being a stand-up comic, this isn't a stepping-stone for me; it's what I do, and this is what I'm always going to do. And even if I do a TV show, the only reasons to do a TV show is to get more people to know me to come out to my stand-up shows.
quotes.author: Bill Burr

quotes.text: I've always loved watching the news on TV. As a kid, I loved watching Walter Cronkite, for some reason.
quotes.author: Will Ferrell

quotes.text: You feel a little weird, as a writer of scripted television for many years, to say you're a fan of reality TV. You feel like a traitor. But I am a total fan.
quotes.author: Mike White

quotes.text: Most of the writers in TV are from L.A. or New York, and those are places where people are cynical and snarky. And they fly from L.A. to New York in an airplane over this vast, expansive land where people aren't snarky; they're a lot more like the 'Parks and Rec' characters.
quotes.author: Chris Pratt

quotes.text: People see you on TV every day, they start knowing your name. You know, I was always just the guy from Maroon 5 until I became myself.
quotes.author: Adam Levine

quotes.text: When I'm 18, I can finally order that paid programming stuff on TV. Like it always says, 'Must be 18 or older to call,' so I'll be able to call! I can finally buy some blenders from the TV.
quotes.author: Austin Mahone

quotes.text: It used to be that you kind of got pigeonholed into one thing - you're either a stage actor or a TV actor or a movie actor. Today, there's a lot of crossover with film actors doing television, which never happened before, so those lines are a little bit more blurred than they used to be.
quotes.author: Aaron Tveit

quotes.text: There's not much TV these days where you really get that element of surprise. There are so many spoilers all the time.
quotes.author: Jenna-Louise Coleman

quotes.text: I love watching old movies, and some of the holiday-themed ones are really great. I also have a bizarre thing that I'll do: I'll turn on a foreign-language TV station, usually Spanish, and watch a whole show, riveted, even though I have no idea what anyone is saying. I don't know why I find that so addictive, but I do!
quotes.author: John Travolta

quotes.text: I've found throughout the years that I needed a place where I can go with no TV, no computer, no phone and just have no distractions and just be able to sit and think and just not be disturbed.
quotes.author: Josh Turner

quotes.text: I barely ever watch TV, but when I do, I usually only watch MTV shows, like 'The Real World Sydney.'
quotes.author: Ryan Sheckler

quotes.text: All I've ever tried to do is get the best out of people and to bring a bit of humour into it. Unlike, say, 'The X-Factor,' which may be great TV, but has no humour at all.
quotes.author: Andrew Lloyd Webber

quotes.text: I majored in criminal justice. I like 'CSI,' all that, '24.' I watch those shows on A&E, if I watch TV. I don't really watch TV shows.
quotes.author: Paul Pierce

quotes.text: I have a lot of great racing memories growing up in Europe as a young boy - playing with car parts on my dad's desk, watching the races on Sunday afternoons to try and spot him on TV, even having the chance to go to Formula 1 races where he was working.
quotes.author: Charlie Kimball

quotes.text: I love doing TV. It's such a breakneck pace, you know. It's kiss and go with your leading man. You meet them in the morning and go right into a clinch. The filming is over before you know their last names.
quotes.author: Paulette Goddard

quotes.text: I really love writing, but I am very easily distracted: my two cats fighting, a rainbow, a TV show... I have to use every trick to keep myself at the computer.
quotes.author: K. A. Applegate

quotes.text: Believe it or not, I don't own a TV. Crazy huh? I'm not a big movie-goer either. I just feel like I'm watching work. I am always outside and couldn't care less about what's on TV these days.
quotes.author: Jeffrey Donovan

quotes.text: I live in Spain. Oscars are something that are on TV Sunday night. Basically, very late at night. You don't watch, you just read the news after who won or who lost.
quotes.author: Javier Bardem

quotes.text: Then as I was wrestling as Terry Boulder. I was on a talk show with Lou Ferrigno, and I was actually bigger than he was! I went back to the dressing room that night and all of the wrestlers go 'Oh my God you're bigger than the hulk on TV' so they started calling me Terry 'The Hulk' Boulder.
quotes.author: Hulk Hogan

quotes.text: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe deserve your love and affection.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: When you go in search of honey you must expect to be stung by bees.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.text: So I say to you, Ask and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
quotes.author: Jesus Christ

quotes.text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
quotes.author: George A. Moore

quotes.text: Consciously or not, we are all on a quest for answers, trying to learn the lessons of life. We grapple with fear and guilt. We search for meaning, love, and power. We try to understand fear, loss, and time. We seek to discover who we are and how we can become truly happy.
quotes.author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quotes.text: 'In Search of Excellence' - even the title - is a reminder that business isn't dry, dreary, boring, or by the numbers. Life at work can be cool - and work that's cool isn't confined to Tiger Woods, Yo-Yo Ma, or Tom Hanks. It's available to all of us and any of us.
quotes.author: Tom Peters

quotes.text: We are a people in a quandary about the present. We are a people in search of our future. We are a people in search of a national community.
quotes.author: Barbara Jordan

quotes.text: One can state, without exaggeration, that the observation of and the search for similarities and differences are the basis of all human knowledge.
quotes.author: Alfred Nobel

quotes.text: Our own relentless search for novelty and social status locks us into an iron cage of consumerism. Affluence has itself betrayed us.
quotes.author: Tim Jackson

quotes.text: He who would search for pearls must dive below.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.text: If you do not expect the unexpected you will not find it, for it is not to be reached by search or trail.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: The word 'seek' means to go in search of, try to discover, try to acquire. It requires an active, assertive approach to life.
quotes.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

quotes.text: If I asked for a cup of coffee, someone would search for the double meaning.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: With comedy I can search for the profound.
quotes.author: Dario Fo

quotes.text: My search is always to find ways to chronicle, to share and to document stories about people, just everyday people. Stories that offer transformation, that lean into transcendence, but that are never sentimental, that never look away from the darkest things about us.
quotes.author: Chris Abani

quotes.text: Normal kids in their teens want to go and date girls and do mischievous things, your hormones are jumping around, but I stayed in my bedroom in search of something.
quotes.author: Grandmaster Flash

quotes.text: In the frantic search for an elusive 'cure,' few researchers stand back and ask a very basic question: why does cancer exist? What is its place in the grand story of life?
quotes.author: Paul Davies

quotes.text: America does not go abroad in search of monsters to destroy.
quotes.author: John Quincy Adams

quotes.text: The kind of environment that we developed Google in, the reason that we were able to develop a search engine, is the web was so open. Once you get too many rules, that will stifle innovation.
quotes.author: Sergey Brin

quotes.text: I search for the realness, the real feeling of a subject, all the texture around it... I always want to see the third dimension of something... I want to come alive with the object.
quotes.author: Andrew Wyeth

quotes.text: There are probably several hundred thousand if we narrow the definition to include only those who in their search for money and power are ruthless and deceitful.
quotes.author: Henry A. Wallace

quotes.text: The total funding of SETI (the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence) in the U.S. is 0.0003 percent of the tax monies spent on health and human services. And it's not even tax money. The SETI Institute's hunt for signals is funded by donations.
quotes.author: Seth Shostak

quotes.text: The field of ageing research is full of characters. We have hucksters claiming that cures for ageing can be bought and sold; prophetic seers, their hands extended for money, warning that immortality is nigh; and would-be Nobelists working methodically in laboratories in search of a pill to slow ageing.
quotes.author: S. Jay Olshansky

quotes.text: Information is not knowledge, and knowledge is not wisdom. Reading - even browsing - an old book can yield sustenance denied by a database search. Patience is a virtue, gluttony a sin.
quotes.author: James Gleick

quotes.text: Google did a great job hacking the Web to create search - and then monetizing search with advertising. And Apple did a great job humanizing hardware and software so that formerly daunting computers and applications could become consumer-friendly devices - even a lifestyle brand.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: I'm an ocean, because I'm really deep. If you search deep enough you can find rare exotic treasures.
quotes.author: Christina Aguilera

quotes.text: I saw no African people in the printed and illustrated Sunday school lessons. I began to suspect at this early age that someone had distorted the image of my people. My long search for the true history of African people the world over began.
quotes.author: John Henrik Clarke

quotes.text: A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth or perfection is a poverty-stricken day; and a succession of such days is fatal to human life.
quotes.author: Lewis Mumford

quotes.text: I'm a study of a man in chaos in search of frenzy.
quotes.author: Oscar Levant

quotes.text: In spite of my own reservations about Bing's ability to convert Google users, I have to admit that the search engine does offer a genuine alternative to Google-style browsing, a more coherently organized selection of links, and a more advertiser-friendly environment through which to sell space and links.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: I would always encourage people of any age not to be so quick to follow other people's truths but to search and follow your own moral code and live by your own integrity, and mostly just be brave.
quotes.author: Jewel

quotes.text: Google has placed its faith in data, while Apple worships the power of design. This dichotomy made the two companies complementary. Apple would ship the phones and computers, while Google would provide Maps, Search, YouTube, and other web tools that made the devices more useful.
quotes.author: Ben Parr

quotes.text: This search for what you want is like tracking something that doesn't want to be tracked. It takes time to get a dance right, to create something memorable.
quotes.author: Fred Astaire

quotes.text: Music is love in search of a word.
quotes.author: Sidney Lanier

quotes.text: Despite my firm convictions, I have always been a man who tries to face facts, and to accept the reality of life as new experience and new knowledge unfolds. I have always kept an open mind, a flexibility that must go hand in hand with every form of the intelligent search for truth.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.text: When you start with a portrait and search for a pure form, a clear volume, through successive eliminations, you arrive inevitably at the egg. Likewise, starting with the egg and following the same process in reverse, one finishes with the portrait.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: Is E.T. out there? Well, I work at the SETI Institute. That's almost my name. SETI: Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence. In other words, I look for aliens, and when I tell people that at a cocktail party, they usually look at me with a mildly incredulous look on their face. I try to keep my own face somewhat dispassionate.
quotes.author: Seth Shostak

quotes.text: The noblest search is the search for excellence.
quotes.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.text: The modern conservative is engaged in one of man's oldest exercises in moral philosophy; that is, the search for a superior moral justification for selfishness.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.text: A 'Magik' session is a journey through different stages of emotions and the 'Search for Sunrise' is more chilling music for when you come home after a party or when you are just about to go to one.
quotes.author: Tiesto

quotes.text: When Larry and Sergey founded Google Search, one of the things that struck me is that it was available for everyone to use. We deeply desire our services to work for everyone. And that inherently means we have to work with partners. That is the thesis underlying everything we do.
quotes.author: Sundar Pichai

quotes.text: We must trust to nothing but facts: these are presented to us by nature and cannot deceive. We ought, in every instance, to submit our reasoning to the test of experiment, and never to search for truth but by the natural road of experiment and observation.
quotes.author: Antoine Lavoisier

quotes.text: There are grounds for cautious optimism that we may now be near the end ofthe search for the ultimate laws of nature.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: Tell your heart that the fear of suffering is worse than the suffering itself. And no heart has ever suffered when it goes in search of its dream.
quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

quotes.text: For me, it's a purity thing about the joke itself. It's a test of a joke whether or not you do it completely clean and it works. If it does, then that's a legitimate item you have there. For me, it's nothing to do with finding those words offensive. It's just not what I'm in search of. Do it clean, and you are really earning that laugh.
quotes.author: Jerry Seinfeld

quotes.text: Art is the provocation for talking about enigma and the search for sense in human life. One can do that by telling a story or writing about a fresco by Giotto or studying how a snail climbs up a wall.
quotes.author: John Berger

quotes.text: The traveler was active; he went strenuously in search of people, of adventure, of experience. The tourist is passive; he expects interesting things to happen to him. He goes 'sight-seeing.'
quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quotes.text: Some say Google is God. Others say Google is Satan. But if they think Google is too powerful, remember that with search engines unlike other companies, all it takes is a single click to go to another search engine.
quotes.author: Sergey Brin

quotes.text: For me, the martial arts is a search for something inside. It's not just a physical discipline.
quotes.author: Brandon Lee

quotes.text: Governmental surveillance is not about the government collecting the information you're sharing publicly and willingly; it's about collecting the information you don't think you're sharing at all, such as the online searches you do on search engines... or private emails or text messages... or the location of your mobile phone at any time.
quotes.author: Mikko Hypponen

quotes.text: Be careful going in search of adventure - it's ridiculously easy to find.
quotes.author: William Least Heat-Moon

quotes.text: Kids can learn a lot about necessities and wants by recognizing what people live without. A common routine, but one that should not be overlooked, is having a family donation to a charity for those less fortunate. Ask your kids to search for items, toys, or clothes that they no longer use and contribute those items a collection box.
quotes.author: Alexa Von Tobel

quotes.text: A humble knowledge of thyself is a surer way to God than a deep search after learning.
quotes.author: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.text: In search of my mother's garden, I found my own.
quotes.author: Alice Walker

quotes.text: The thing that brings people to wail at a wall, or face Mecca, or to go to church, is a search for that feeling of purity.
quotes.author: Michael J. Fox

quotes.text: Whether it's by helping us search for health-related information, connecting us with doctors through online portals, or enabling us to store and retrieve our medical records online, the Internet is starting to show the promise it has to transform the way people interact with and improve their own health and wellness.
quotes.author: Dean Ornish

quotes.text: If I had the opportunity to speak to a young immigrant girl that just arrived to the U.S. the advice I would have for her would be: ask, speak, search; because there are opportunities out there. And, know that you aren't the only immigrant or the last to come to this country. Many that have come before you have succeeded. It is possible.
quotes.author: Jenni Rivera

quotes.text: Making a wrong decision is understandable. Refusing to search continually for learning is not.
quotes.author: Phil Crosby

quotes.text: There are pros and cons of experience. A con is that you can't look at the business with a fresh pair of eyes and as objectively as if you were a new CEO. Fire yourself on a Friday night and come in on Monday morning as if a search firm put you there as a turn-around leader. Can you be objective and make the bold change?
quotes.author: Andrea Jung

quotes.text: Everyone and his Big Brother wants to log your browsing habits, the better to build a profile of who you are and how you live your life - online and off. Search engine companies offer a benefit in return: more relevant search results. The more they know about you, the better they can tailor information to your needs.
quotes.author: Barton Gellman

quotes.text: Google's done a super good job on search; Apple's done a great job on the IPod.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: Scriptures reveal the divine desires of the Lord in our behalf. Each of us should have a burning desire to search the scriptures diligently and daily to seek the will of the Lord in our life. For some, it may be necessary to develop the discipline to search the scriptures daily.
quotes.author: L. Lionel Kendrick

quotes.text: I long to journey endlessly, always in search of something new. Always alert.
quotes.author: Enrique Vila-Matas

quotes.text: Vices are simply the errors which a man makes in his search after his own happiness. Unlike crimes, they imply no malice toward others, and no interference with their persons or property.
quotes.author: Lysander Spooner

quotes.text: Starting a band is the easy part. Once you've formed the band, you have to tell a story, and that story requires songs. And not just good songs, but great songs. After a while, great songs won't do - they have to be the best. Success doesn't make it any easier. Each time I start a new record, it's a brand-new search.
quotes.author: The Edge

quotes.text: I tend to do something for two years then move on to something new. Yoga, then biking, then weight lifting, then back to biking. The moment it feels like a rut, I switch and search for a new love. It's like having a midlife crisis, but without the new wife or cheesy BMW.
quotes.author: Brad Meltzer

quotes.text: A move to a different town or school gives us new places to explore, new people to meet; a lost pet means we have to organize a careful search; baby-sitting requires looking out for dangers a young child can't foresee; a car crash or fire demands that we get help immediately.
quotes.author: Jim Murphy

quotes.text: The search for the truth is the most important work in the whole world, and the most dangerous.
quotes.author: James Clavell

quotes.text: Let me alone, and go in search of someone else.
quotes.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quotes.text: If we become increasingly humble about how little we know, we may be more eager to search.
quotes.author: John Templeton

quotes.text: There is an eternal landscape, a geography of the soul; we search for its outlines all our lives.
quotes.author: Josephine Hart

quotes.text: A search is a search, even if it happens to disclose nothing but the bottom of a turntable.
quotes.author: Antonin Scalia

quotes.text: I know well what I am fleeing from but not what I am in search of.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.text: It ain't easy to break out of a mold, but if you do your work, people will ultimately see what you're capable of. Too often, people find it easier to make assumptions and stick with what they believe. They put you in a place and it makes their job easier. The good people constantly search for something different.
quotes.author: Christopher Meloni

quotes.text: Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.text: Culture is mix. Culture means a mix of things from other sources. And my town, Istanbul, was this kind of mix. Istanbul, in fact, and my work, is a testimony to the fact that East and West combine cultural gracefully, or sometimes in an anarchic way, came together, and that is what we should search for.
quotes.author: Orhan Pamuk

quotes.text: There have been women who stumbled across Feministing randomly, through a bizarre Google search or something, and had no idea what feminism was. They thought it was something older women do, or bought into the hairy bra-burning man-hating stereotype 100 percent. Anything that deviates from that is very exciting for them.
quotes.author: Jessica Valenti

quotes.text: It is not accidental that all phenomena of human life are dominated by the search for daily bread - the oldest link connecting all living things, man included, with the surrounding nature.
quotes.author: Ivan Pavlov

quotes.text: Research is what I'm doing when I don't know what I'm doing.
quotes.author: Wernher von Braun

quotes.text: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: To raise new questions, new possibilities, to regard old problems from a new angle, requires creative imagination and marks real advance in science.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Everything is theoretically impossible, until it is done.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.text: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.text: Science is a way of life. Science is a perspective. Science is the process that takes us from confusion to understanding in a manner that's precise, predictive and reliable - a transformation, for those lucky enough to experience it, that is empowering and emotional.
quotes.author: Brian Greene

quotes.text: Science is a wonderful thing if one does not have to earn one's living at it.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: The fewer the facts, the stronger the opinion.
quotes.author: Arnold H. Glasow

quotes.text: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
quotes.author: Jules Verne

quotes.text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.text: Science does not know its debt to imagination.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Most people say that it is the intellect which makes a great scientist. They are wrong: it is character.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.text: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.text: Science and technology revolutionize our lives, but memory, tradition and myth frame our response.
quotes.author: Arthur M. Schlesinger

quotes.text: The science of today is the technology of tomorrow.
quotes.author: Edward Teller

quotes.text: We live in a society exquisitely dependent on science and technology, in which hardly anyone knows anything about science and technology.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.text: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world. Science is the highest personification of the nation because that nation will remain the first which carries the furthest the works of thought and intelligence.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.text: Science is simply common sense at its best, that is, rigidly accurate in observation, and merciless to fallacy in logic.
quotes.author: Thomas Huxley

quotes.text: The cloning of humans is on most of the lists of things to worry about from Science, along with behaviour control, genetic engineering, transplanted heads, computer poetry and the unrestrained growth of plastic flowers.
quotes.author: Lewis Thomas

quotes.text: If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: There is a single light of science, and to brighten it anywhere is to brighten it everywhere.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not 'Eureka!' but 'That's funny...'
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: Science is fun. Science is curiosity. We all have natural curiosity. Science is a process of investigating. It's posing questions and coming up with a method. It's delving in.
quotes.author: Sally Ride

quotes.text: Art is I; science is we.
quotes.author: Claude Bernard

quotes.text: The next major explosion is going to be when genetics and computers come together. I'm talking about an organic computer - about biological substances that can function like a semiconductor.
quotes.author: Alvin Toffler

quotes.text: Science is not only a disciple of reason but, also, one of romance and passion.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: Science is the systematic classification of experience.
quotes.author: George Henry Lewes

quotes.text: The best scientist is open to experience and begins with romance - the idea that anything is possible.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.text: Facts are the air of scientists. Without them you can never fly.
quotes.author: Linus Pauling

quotes.text: Science, like art, religion, commerce, warfare, and even sleep, is based on presuppositions.
quotes.author: Gregory Bateson

quotes.text: By denying scientific principles, one may maintain any paradox.
quotes.author: Galileo Galilei

quotes.text: Let both sides seek to invoke the wonders of science instead of its terrors. Together let us explore the stars, conquer the deserts, eradicate disease, tap the ocean depths, and encourage the arts and commerce.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: We can lick gravity, but sometimes the paperwork is overwhelming.
quotes.author: Wernher von Braun

quotes.text: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Scientists have become the bearers of the torch of discovery in our quest for knowledge.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: Nothing in education is so astonishing as the amount of ignorance it accumulates in the form of inert facts.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.text: If a man's wit be wandering, let him study the mathematics.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Each problem that I solved became a rule, which served afterwards to solve other problems.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.text: Science is like a love affair with nature; an elusive, tantalising mistress. It has all the turbulence, twists and turns of romantic love, but that's part of the game.
quotes.author: Vilayanur S. Ramachandran

quotes.text: The scientific theory I like best is that the rings of Saturn are composed entirely of lost airline luggage.
quotes.author: Mark Russell

quotes.text: It will free man from the remaining chains, the chains of gravity which still tie him to this planet.
quotes.author: Wernher von Braun

quotes.text: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right; a single experiment can prove me wrong.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Anthropology demands the open-mindedness with which one must look and listen, record in astonishment and wonder that which one would not have been able to guess.
quotes.author: Margaret Mead

quotes.text: Geologists have a saying - rocks remember.
quotes.author: Neil Armstrong

quotes.text: Scientific research is one of the most exciting and rewarding of occupations.
quotes.author: Frederick Sanger

quotes.text: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: Reason, observation, and experience; the holy trinity of science.
quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.text: We are born at a given moment, in a given place and, like vintage years of wine, we have the qualities of the year and of the season of which we are born. Astrology does not lay claim to anything more.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: The difference between science and the fuzzy subjects is that science requires reasoning while those other subjects merely require scholarship.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.text: There are no shortcuts in evolution.
quotes.author: Louis D. Brandeis

quotes.text: The universe is made of stories, not of atoms.
quotes.author: Muriel Rukeyser

quotes.text: Scientific advancement should aim to affirm and to improve human life.
quotes.author: Nathan Deal

quotes.text: Anybody who has been seriously engaged in scientific work of any kind realizes that over the entrance to the gates of the temple of science are written the words: 'Ye must have faith.'
quotes.author: Max Planck

quotes.text: The distance between insanity and genius is measured only by success.
quotes.author: Bruce Feirstein

quotes.text: I don't want to give advice to people about their religious beliefs, but I do think that it's not smart to bet against the power of science to figure out the natural world. It used to be, a thousand years ago, that if you wanted to explain why the moon moved through the sky, you needed to invoke God.
quotes.author: Sean M. Carroll

quotes.text: Equipped with his five senses, man explores the universe around him and calls the adventure Science.
quotes.author: Edwin Powell Hubble

quotes.text: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: Science is organized knowledge.
quotes.author: Herbert Spencer

quotes.text: What is a scientist after all? It is a curious man looking through a keyhole, the keyhole of nature, trying to know what's going on.
quotes.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

quotes.text: Your theory is crazy, but it's not crazy enough to be true.
quotes.author: Niels Bohr

quotes.text: It stands to the everlasting credit of science that by acting on the human mind it has overcome man's insecurity before himself and before nature.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: The radical novelty of modern science lies precisely in the rejection of the belief... that the forces which move the stars and atoms are contingent upon the preferences of the human heart.
quotes.author: Walter Lippmann

quotes.text: We don't regard any scientific theory as the absolute truth.
quotes.author: Kenneth R. Miller

quotes.text: Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway.
quotes.author: Mary Kay Ash

quotes.text: A scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.
quotes.author: Max Planck

quotes.text: A fact is a simple statement that everyone believes. It is innocent, unless found guilty. A hypothesis is a novel suggestion that no one wants to believe. It is guilty, until found effective.
quotes.author: Edward Teller

quotes.text: Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.text: Adventure upon all the tickets in the lottery, and you lose for certain; and the greater the number of your tickets the nearer your approach to this certainty.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.text: What is required of a working hypothesis is a fine capacity for discrimination.
quotes.author: Jean-Francois Lyotard

quotes.text: The great tragedy of science - the slaying of a beautiful hypothesis by an ugly fact.
quotes.author: Thomas Huxley

quotes.text: I am not a scientist. I am, rather, an impresario of scientists.
quotes.author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

quotes.text: I believe there are no questions that science can't answer about a physical universe.
quotes.author: Stephen Hawking

quotes.text: Sadly, embryonic stem cell research is completely legal in this country and has been going on at universities and research facilities for years.
quotes.author: Mike Pence

quotes.text: We seem to have a compulsion these days to bury time capsules in order to give those people living in the next century or so some idea of what we are like.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.text: This means that to entrust to science - or to deliberate control according to scientific principles - more than scientific method can achieve may have deplorable effects.
quotes.author: Friedrich August von Hayek

quotes.text: A year spent in artificial intelligence is enough to make one believe in God.
quotes.author: Alan Perlis

quotes.text: The human brain is an incredible pattern-matching machine.
quotes.author: Jeff Bezos

quotes.text: Kids have what I call a built-in hypocrisy antenna that comes up and blocks out what you're saying when you're being a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Ben Carson

quotes.text: The explosion of companies deploying wireless networks insecurely is creating vulnerabilities, as they think it's limited to the office - then they have Johnny Hacker in the parking lot with an 802.11 antenna using the network to send threatening emails to the president!
quotes.author: Kevin Mitnick

quotes.text: I am like a TV antenna. I catch everything that is in the air, and then I do it my way.
quotes.author: Karl Lagerfeld

quotes.text: I write about personal experiences. I write about things that have happened to me and the people around me, so you just sort of keep this antenna up and on the lookout for things to say.
quotes.author: James Bay

quotes.text: The strongest signals leaking off our planet are radar transmissions, not television or radio. The most powerful radars, such as the one mounted on the Arecibo telescope (used to study the ionosphere and map asteroids) could be detected with a similarly sized antenna at a distance of nearly 1,000 light-years.
quotes.author: Seth Shostak

quotes.text: I remember attaching a wire clothing hanger to the antenna of my radio in my bedroom, so I could get the frequency and get that station and listen to the top 10 every night.
quotes.author: Nelly Furtado

quotes.text: My inspiration comes from God, so I always have to be open, kind of like being an antenna. I like to write songs people love.
quotes.author: Brenda Russell

quotes.text: Comedians are never really on vacation because you're always at attention... that antenna is always out there.
quotes.author: Bob Newhart

quotes.text: I think, because I'm an artist, part of my job is to be a barometer, an antenna. It's in the air and it resonates with a lot of people to lighten up.
quotes.author: Jane Siberry

quotes.text: But, yeah, I'm really happy when I'm writing. When I'm being creative and when I have something that I can put down. You know, if you go out and you overhear a conversation or you have a thought, you have a receptacle to go home and say, 'Oh, this would be great in this script.' Your antenna's out in a different way, and I love that time.
quotes.author: Josh Radnor

quotes.text: The people who depend on an antenna are often those who are underprivileged - the elderly and the disadvantaged who can't afford a $200-a-month cable bill.
quotes.author: Gordon Smith

quotes.text: As a film-maker and a poet, I feel it's my duty to be an eye and an antenna to what's happening around me. I always felt a solidarity with those who are desperate and confused and misused and are seeking a way out of it.
quotes.author: Jonas Mekas

quotes.text: My life's experiences, I've always had, my uncle used to call it antenna. I know what's going to happen oftentimes before it happened when it's involving me.
quotes.author: Terrence Howard

quotes.text: I've got a radio that occasionally I listen to. It's portable. It's got an antenna. I've put a piece of aluminum foil on it that gives me a little bit better reception. And a refrigerator.
quotes.author: Burt Shavitz

quotes.text: If you chase the market, it's not going to come to you. You have to have faith in yourself. I think one of the differences in what I call 'civilians' and 'authors' is that we have an antenna hat buzzing all the time.
quotes.author: David Morrell

quotes.text: The transponder requirements have three major sections, namely the chip; the antenna; and the assembly of the chip and the antenna onto the goods being labelled.
quotes.author: Mike Marsh

quotes.text: Kids have what I call a built-in hypocrisy antenna that comes up and blocks out what you're saying when you're being a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Ben Carson

quotes.author: David Morrell

quotes.text: The transponder requirements have three major sections, namely the chip; the antenna; and the assembly of the chip and the antenna onto the goods being labelled.
quotes.author: Mike Marsh

quotes.text: Now, as a nation, we don't promise equal outcomes, but we were founded on the idea everybody should have an equal opportunity to succeed. No matter who you are, what you look like, where you come from, you can make it. That's an essential promise of America. Where you start should not determine where you end up.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.text: We must reject the idea that every time a law's broken, society is guilty rather than the lawbreaker. It is time to restore the American precept that each individual is accountable for his actions.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.text: Creativity is a great motivator because it makes people interested in what they are doing. Creativity gives hope that there can be a worthwhile idea. Creativity gives the possibility of some sort of achievement to everyone. Creativity makes life more fun and more interesting.
quotes.author: Edward de Bono

quotes.text: Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.text: You may have heard of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. There's another day you might want to know about: Giving Tuesday. The idea is pretty straightforward. On the Tuesday after Thanksgiving, shoppers take a break from their gift-buying and donate what they can to charity.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: Each of us has a vision of good and of evil. We have to encourage people to move towards what they think is good... Everyone has his own idea of good and evil and must choose to follow the good and fight evil as he conceives them. That would be enough to make the world a better place.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.text: My idea of sexy is that less is more. The less you reveal the more people can wonder.
quotes.author: Emma Watson

quotes.text: A good leader can engage in a debate frankly and thoroughly, knowing that at the end he and the other side must be closer, and thus emerge stronger. You don't have that idea when you are arrogant, superficial, and uninformed.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: When an idea exclusively occupies the mind, it is transformed into an actual physical or mental state.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.text: A man may die, nations may rise and fall, but an idea lives on.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: At the time I was arrested I had no idea it would turn into this. It was just a day like any other day. The only thing that made it significant was that the masses of the people joined in.
quotes.author: Rosa Parks

quotes.text: Creativity is a spark. It can be excruciating when we're rubbing two rocks together and getting nothing. And it can be intensely satisfying when the flame catches and a new idea sweeps around the world.
quotes.author: Jonah Lehrer

quotes.text: The point of theatre is transformation: to make an extraordinary event out of ordinary material right in front of an audience's eyes. Where the germ of the idea came from is pretty much irrelevant. What matters to every theatre maker I know is speaking clearly to the audience 'right now.'
quotes.author: Lee Hall

quotes.text: I think most of us are raised with preconceived notions of the choices we're supposed to make. We waste so much time making decisions based on someone else's idea of our happiness - what will make you a good citizen or a good wife or daughter or actress. Nobody says, 'Just be happy - go be a cobbler or go live with goats.'
quotes.author: Sandra Bullock

quotes.text: My friends and family are my support system. They tell me what I need to hear, not what I want to hear and they are there for me in the good and bad times. Without them I have no idea where I would be and I know that their love for me is what's keeping my head above the water.
quotes.author: Kelly Clarkson

quotes.text: Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all peoples cry, laugh, eat, worry, and die, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: An idea isn't responsible for the people who believe in it.
quotes.author: Don Marquis

quotes.text: My objection to the death penalty is based on the idea that this is a democracy, and in a democracy the government is me, and if the government kills somebody then I'm killing somebody.
quotes.author: Steve Earle

quotes.text: Life is short, youth is finite, and opportunities endless. Have you found the intersection of your passion and the potential for world-shaping positive impact? If you don't have a great idea of your own, there are plenty of great teams that need you - unknown startups and established teams in giant companies alike.
quotes.author: Justin Rosenstein

quotes.text: It's the right idea, but not the right time.
quotes.author: John Dalton

quotes.text: Our duty is to encourage every one in his struggle to live up to his own highest idea, and strive at the same time to make the ideal as near as possible to the Truth.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.text: If it's a good movie, the sound could go off and the audience would still have a perfectly clear idea of what was going on.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.text: I love the idea of the teachings of Jesus Christ and the beautiful stories about it, which I loved in Sunday school and I collected all the little stickers and put them in my book. But the reality is that organised religion doesn't seem to work. It turns people into hateful lemmings and it's not really compassionate.
quotes.author: Elton John

quotes.text: The desire to fly is an idea handed down to us by our ancestors who... looked enviously on the birds soaring freely through space... on the infinite highway of the air.
quotes.author: Wilbur Wright

quotes.text: We need to internalize this idea of excellence. Not many folks spend a lot of time trying to be excellent.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: The idea is to die young as late as possible.
quotes.author: Ashley Montagu

quotes.text: The idea of prosthetics is a tool. Most people's cell phones are prosthetics. If you leave your cell phone at home, you feel impacted by not having it. It's an important part of your daily function and what you can do in a day.
quotes.author: Aimee Mullins

quotes.text: Parents and schools should place great emphasis on the idea that it is all right to be different. Racism and all the other 'isms' grow from primitive tribalism, the instinctive hostility against those of another tribe, race, religion, nationality, class or whatever. You are a lucky child if your parents taught you to accept diversity.
quotes.author: Roger Ebert

quotes.text: Religion has caused more harm than any other idea since the beginning of time. There's nothing good I can say about it. People use it as a crutch.
quotes.author: Larry Flynt

quotes.text: I think I meant that, given the circumstances of my childhood, I had the illusion that it's easier to be alone. To have your relationships be casual and also to pose as a solitary person, because it was more romantic. You know, I was raised on the idea of the ramblin' man and the loner.
quotes.author: Steve Martin

quotes.text: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn't go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.text: The essence of America - that which really unites us - is not ethnicity, or nationality or religion - it is an idea - and what an idea it is: That you can come from humble circumstances and do great things.
quotes.author: Condoleezza Rice

quotes.text: The whole idea of a democracy is that we ourselves, the people, are supposed to make a path of our politics, and it is we who with our feet and our vote and our labors and our vigilance are supposed to shape our country.
quotes.author: Eugene Jarecki

quotes.text: Archaeologists gave the military the idea to use aerial photographs for spying and field survey. We are fortunate that the spatial and spectral resolutions of the imagery available to us are so broadly useful for archaeology.
quotes.author: Sarah Parcak

quotes.text: It's a very smart and heartfelt movie and that's why, I think, we're all drawn to it. We really showed up for this with this collective idea that it was really ambitious, but we felt we all really had something to gain from it.
quotes.author: Robert Downey, Jr.

quotes.text: New ideas pass through three periods: 1) It can't be done. 2) It probably can be done, but it's not worth doing. 3) I knew it was a good idea all along!
quotes.author: Arthur C. Clarke
