quotes.text: My idea of good company is the company of clever, well-informed people who have a great deal of conversation; that is what I call good company.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.text: A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.text: The whole idea of love is scary - so is being with someone for the rest of your life and being happy with them for the rest of your life. There's lots of research to suggest that, actually, love's not really that simple.
quotes.author: Aziz Ansari

quotes.text: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
quotes.author: Mary Kay Ash

quotes.text: The whole idea of compassion is based on a keen awareness of the interdependence of all these living beings, which are all part of one another, and all involved in one another.
quotes.author: Thomas Merton

quotes.text: When I did 'Ferris Bueller's Day Off', I had the idea on Monday and the following Tuesday it was in budget at Paramount. I couldn't walk.
quotes.author: John Hughes

quotes.text: We need to ditch the idea that there is any value in the strong and silent man being in any way attractive. Being silent isn't being strong, it's being a victim.
quotes.author: Jane Powell

quotes.text: The idea is to try to give all the information to help others to judge the value of your contribution; not just the information that leads to judgment in one particular direction or another.
quotes.author: Richard P. Feynman

quotes.text: I like the quiet it takes to pursue an idea the way I pursued 'Hamilton,' but I couldn't write a book, because there's no applause at the end of writing a book.
quotes.author: Lin-Manuel Miranda

quotes.text: The best way to have a good idea is to have a lot of ideas.
quotes.author: Linus Pauling

quotes.text: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: You sit at the board and suddenly your heart leaps. Your hand trembles to pick up the piece and move it. But what chess teaches you is that you must sit there calmly and think about whether it's really a good idea and whether there are other, better ideas.
quotes.author: Stanley Kubrick

quotes.text: The telephone book is full of facts, but it doesn't contain a single idea.
quotes.author: Mortimer Adler

quotes.text: If you have one good idea, people will lend you twenty.
quotes.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quotes.text: Typically creative people are usually not clock-slaves or list-makers, so the idea of enforcing goals and deadlines can be somewhat daunting.
quotes.author: Kristin Armstrong

quotes.text: I like historical pieces. History was my favorite subject in school, it was the only subject I excelled in. I love the idea of history and the idea that we may have the opportunity to learn from our past mistakes.
quotes.author: Cary Elwes

quotes.text: I don't know where the idea originated that memoir writing is cathartic. For me, it's always felt like playing my own neurosurgeon, sans anesthesia. As a memoirist, you have to crack your head open and examine every uncomfortable thing in there.
quotes.author: Koren Zailckas

quotes.text: 'Disruption' is, at its core, a really powerful idea. Everyone hijacks the idea to do whatever they want now. It's the same way people hijacked the word 'paradigm' to justify lame things they're trying to sell to mankind.
quotes.author: Clayton Christensen

quotes.text: When you're working on a creative thing, everyone has an idea, and they're pushing it. The first time you work with anybody, you have to get comfortable with the way another person pushes hard for what they want.
quotes.author: Edward Norton

quotes.text: The idea that UN commitments should be followed by action is indeed a radical one, especially for the United States, where wilful neglect of its own commitments is the rule.
quotes.author: Jeffrey Sachs

quotes.text: Ideas improve. The meaning of words participates in the improvement. Plagiarism is necessary. Progress implies it. It embraces an author's phrase, makes use of his expressions, erases a false idea, and replaces it with the right idea.
quotes.author: Guy Debord

quotes.text: I've always loved the '40s romantic comedies and the idea of those mistaken identities and lovers' misunderstandings.
quotes.author: Pearl Cleage

quotes.text: You know, as you compose music, you're just off in your own world. You have no idea where reality is, so to have an idea of what people think is pretty hard.
quotes.author: Roy Lichtenstein

quotes.text: We should get used to the idea that we'll probably never be able to find - and confirm - a good explanation of the ultimate origin of the universe, though I see no reason to believe that we can't press much further on this question than we have managed to date.
quotes.author: Daniel Dennett

quotes.text: Anyone in the humor business isn't thinking clearly if he doesn't surround himself with idea people. Otherwise, you settle for mediocrity - or you burn yourself out.
quotes.author: Hank Ketcham

quotes.text: The idea of Twitter started with me working in dispatch since I was 15 years old, where taxi cabs or firetrucks would broadcast where they were and what they were doing.
quotes.author: Jack Dorsey

quotes.text: I don't like the idea of spirituality done the way it's done. The only way I could understand it was through creativity, not by going to an Ashram, or finding a guru or joining a temple. I made work out of it.
quotes.author: M.I.A.

quotes.text: Everyone has an idea that they think would be a great movie. Everyone has a cousin who they think you should work with.
quotes.author: Zach Braff

quotes.text: It's unfortunate that we live in such a panicked, dysmorphic society where women don't even give themselves a chance to see what they'll look like as older persons. I want to have some idea of what I'll look like before I start cleaning the slates.
quotes.author: Julia Roberts

quotes.text: What I find most interesting about the U.S. is this idea of equality.
quotes.author: Jorge Ramos

quotes.text: Metaphorically speaking, of course, if I put a problem behind my pillow and fall asleep, very often because my brain went to sleep with that idea or the problem alive, very often in the middle of the night I wake up, and I wake up with a solution or with a direction of solution.
quotes.author: Philippe Petit

quotes.text: I don't get it. If you're saying, Tommy Lee, you don't fit the image of the East Coast, social elitist wealthy people who comprise Harvard, the only thing I can say is you have no idea what comprises Harvard.
quotes.author: Tommy Lee Jones

quotes.text: America is a living idea. It isn't only the tenets of its founding, but also the terms of its future. Every day, we make America. Seeking to preserve and enshrine one vision of this country from one period of its past robs it of what makes it magical: its infinite possibility for adjustment.
quotes.author: Charles M. Blow

quotes.text: The gummy bears tattoo was my idea. It's my son's favorite candy. The sketch was my other son's idea. It's a self-portrait of himself. I just showed the artist his sketch and had him tattoo it on my forearm. It looks like a stick person with big hair. It's pretty funny.
quotes.author: Prince Fielder

quotes.text: I've always been interested in the idea of people who fell through the cracks.
quotes.author: Peter Capaldi

quotes.text: When I was 15, I decided I wanted to be a lawyer. No one thought this was a good idea.
quotes.author: Constance Baker Motley

quotes.text: There is in every madman a misunderstood genius whose idea, shining in his head, frightened people, and for whom delirium was the only solution to the strangulation that life had prepared for him.
quotes.author: Antonin Artaud

quotes.text: So my idea of neurotic is spending too much time trying to correct a wrong. When I feel that I'm doing that, then I snap out of it.
quotes.author: Gene Wilder

quotes.text: I had a little epiphany when I was a writer at 'Chicago' magazine. I sat down to dinner at the Ritz-Carlton. Somebody poured a white dessert wine with chocolate cake. It was a wine I would never have expected to make sense. The idea of any wine tasting fabulous with chocolate cake was fascinating to me.
quotes.author: Ted Allen

quotes.text: I read, I study, I examine, I listen, I think, and out of all that I try to form an idea into which I put as much common sense as I can.
quotes.author: Marquis de Lafayette

quotes.text: It's funny. People often compare me to other humor essayists. They're usually quite nice comparisons; I will accept those gladly. But I am always sort of appalled at the idea of being lumped with other, more chick-y female writers. And the truth is probably that neither comparison is accurate.
quotes.author: Sloane Crosley

quotes.text: Singapore has been incredibly well-managed. It was created out of the swamp, with a strong emotional idea: a safe place for mostly Chinese, but accepting other cultures and other races.
quotes.author: Nicolas Berggruen

quotes.text: I mean, the whole idea of movies was it was special to go to see - you went to a movie theater to see something that was magical and amazing, in a very special location.
quotes.author: Bob Balaban

quotes.text: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: The world is a book, and those who do not travel read only a page.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.text: Today I begin to understand what love must be, if it exists... When we are parted, we each feel the lack of the other half of ourselves. We are incomplete like a book in two volumes of which the first has been lost. That is what I imagine love to be: incompleteness in absence.
quotes.author: Edmond de Goncourt

quotes.text: There is no end to education. It is not that you read a book, pass an examination, and finish with education. The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.
quotes.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quotes.text: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
quotes.author: Malala Yousafzai

quotes.text: Any time women come together with a collective intention, it's a powerful thing. Whether it's sitting down making a quilt, in a kitchen preparing a meal, in a club reading the same book, or around the table playing cards, or planning a birthday party, when women come together with a collective intention, magic happens.
quotes.author: Phylicia Rashad

quotes.text: You cannot open a book without learning something.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: I never feel lonely if I've got a book - they're like old friends. Even if you're not reading them over and over again, you know they are there. And they're part of your history. They sort of tell a story about your journey through life.
quotes.author: Emilia Fox

quotes.text: Hold fast to the Bible. To the influence of this Book we are indebted for all the progress made in true civilization and to this we must look as our guide in the future.
quotes.author: Ulysses S. Grant

quotes.text: I like to sit down, relax, have a cup of coffee on the terrace and read a book. I like to travel the world - and I'm lucky to see so much through cycling.
quotes.author: Marianne Vos

quotes.text: You're never too old, too wacky, too wild, to pick up a book and read to a child.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.text: One always tends to overpraise a long book, because one has got through it.
quotes.author: E. M. Forster

quotes.text: If you're smart, you'll always be humble. You can learn all you want, but there'll always be somebody who's never read a book who'll know twice what you know.
quotes.author: David Duchovny

quotes.text: I've read quite a few readers' reviews of my book on Amazon, saying, 'Ah, he criticises the free market, he advocates central planning.' I don't do that for a minute! But this is our black and white, dichotomous way of thinking - which has really been harmful.
quotes.author: Ha-Joon Chang

quotes.text: If I write a book where all I've ever experienced is success, people won't take a positive lesson from it. In being candid, I have to own up to my own failures, both in my marriage and in my work environment.
quotes.author: Sonia Sotomayor

quotes.text: The new year stands before us, like a chapter in a book, waiting to be written. We can help write that story by setting goals.
quotes.author: Melody Beattie

quotes.text: The best time to plan a book is while you're doing the dishes.
quotes.author: Agatha Christie

quotes.text: I love the idea of the teachings of Jesus Christ and the beautiful stories about it, which I loved in Sunday school and I collected all the little stickers and put them in my book. But the reality is that organised religion doesn't seem to work. It turns people into hateful lemmings and it's not really compassionate.
quotes.author: Elton John

quotes.text: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: I'm writing a book. I've got the page numbers done.
quotes.author: Steven Wright

quotes.text: Literature is my Utopia. Here I am not disenfranchised. No barrier of the senses shuts me out from the sweet, gracious discourses of my book friends. They talk to me without embarrassment or awkwardness.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.text: I would never want a book's autograph. I am a proud non-reader of books.
quotes.author: Kanye West

quotes.text: I've worked with the Los Angeles Zoo for 45 years, and we have this magnificent photographer, Tad Motoyama. He takes these wonderful, wonderful animal pictures. All through the years he's given me copies of these pictures. Well, I have all these gorgeous ones, so I said, 'Tad, I want to do a book with your picture on one side.'
quotes.author: Betty White

quotes.text: You can't get a cup of tea big enough or a book long enough to suit me.
quotes.author: C. S. Lewis

quotes.text: At a book festival in Fort Lauderdale, I met David Eisenhower, Ike's grandson, who was promoting his book 'Going Home to Glory: A Memoir of Life with Dwight D. Eisenhower,' in which he describes attending the Yankees' 154th game in 1961. The whole family had been following Mantle and Maris chase Babe Ruth's home run record across the country.
quotes.author: Jane Leavy

quotes.text: What public health really is is a trust. That's why I used the term 'Betrayal of Trust' as the title of my book. It's a trust between the government and the people.
quotes.author: Laurie Garrett

quotes.text: I like the quiet it takes to pursue an idea the way I pursued 'Hamilton,' but I couldn't write a book, because there's no applause at the end of writing a book.
quotes.author: Lin-Manuel Miranda

quotes.text: Read more. Read every time you go to bed; read in the day - because at least, reading a book, you can't be distracted by anything else.
quotes.author: Theo James

quotes.text: The telephone book is full of facts, but it doesn't contain a single idea.
quotes.author: Mortimer Adler

quotes.text: The best of a book is not the thought which it contains, but the thought which it suggests; just as the charm of music dwells not in the tones but in the echoes of our hearts.
quotes.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quotes.text: The truth doesn't change. It was the same when Moses got the Ten Commandments as it is today. That's the thing about the truth. That's the thing about real. It doesn't change and it doesn't have to change. Now you can put it in a different book, but it's still real. It's still the truth.
quotes.author: DMX

quotes.text: The problem with writing a monthly book is that you're going through your work like a man running for a bus, red-faced and out of breath. There isn't time for reflection or critical self-examination.
quotes.author: J. Michael Straczynski

quotes.text: My main piece of advice would be don't worry about being published - just write a really good book, but also don't be afraid to write a bad book. Give yourself permission to fail, and don't be afraid.
quotes.author: David Levithan

quotes.text: I book myself tight. If I have any time off, I get antsy.
quotes.author: Skrillex

quotes.text: Even now I try to make each page compelling for the readers to get absorbed in the book.
quotes.author: Chetan Bhagat

quotes.text: I'm a bachelor in the old sense of the word, meaning I flirt, I have very many close relationships, but then I come home and like to read my book.
quotes.author: William Ivey Long

quotes.text: For myself, the only way I know how to make a book is to construct it like a collage: a bit of dialogue here, a scrap of narrative, an isolated description of a common object, an elaborate running metaphor which threads between the sequences and holds different narrative lines together.
quotes.author: Hilary Mantel

quotes.text: When you make a book or you make a movie, it is almost like hitting on somebody. It's not because you want to seduce people that you will seduce them; you can hit on somebody and it doesn't work. But when you hit on them and it works, then it's really cool.
quotes.author: Marjane Satrapi

quotes.text: 'The Sun Also Rises' by Ernest Hemingway is my favorite book. You feel manly reading it.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Olsen

quotes.text: A writer is, after all, only half his book. The other half is the reader and from the reader the writer learns.
quotes.author: P. L. Travers

quotes.text: With a book, you're guaranteed the audience has a certain skill level and that the audience has to make an ongoing effort to consume this product and that the project is being consumed by just one person at a time. I really want to play to that strength because it's one of the few advantages books still have.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: I told the brethren that the Book of Mormon was the most correct of any book on earth, and the keystone of our religion, and a man would get nearer to God by abiding by its precepts, than by any other book.
quotes.author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

quotes.text: There was a manifesto in the late '60s/early '70s, and it basically laid out what 'black art' was and that it should embrace black history and black culture. There were all these rules - I was shocked, when I found it in a book, that it even existed, that it would demarcate these artists.
quotes.author: Kara Walker

quotes.text: There's no way the writing staff of 'Game of Thrones' haven't read 'The Art of War.' There's definitely an influence on 'Game of Thrones' from this book in both a general way and on the character of Lord Baelish and his strategies.
quotes.author: Aidan Gillen

quotes.text: You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children.
quotes.author: Madeleine L'Engle

quotes.text: One man is as good as another until he has written a book.
quotes.author: Benjamin Jowett

quotes.text: Anyways, I am a nerd, bookworm, geek... whatever you want to call me. I'm the type of person that would rather sit down and read a good book than go out and party.
quotes.author: Jacqueline Emerson

quotes.text: Won't it be wonderful when black history and native American history and Jewish history and all of U.S. history is taught from one book. Just U.S. history.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: Preachers in pulpits talked about what a great message is in the book. No matter what you do, somebody always imputes meaning into your books.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: 'The Lorax' book was intended to be propaganda.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: I get asked to read new works a lot, in the hope that I will give a quotation and I will only give a 'puff' for a book I truly love.
quotes.author: Peter James

quotes.text: I think it may not be a coincidence that the rise of printing and book publication and literacy and the phenomenon of best sellers all preceded the humanitarian reforms of the Enlightenment.
quotes.author: Steven Pinker

quotes.text: You can look at my palm and see the storm coming. Read the book of my life and see I've overcome it.
quotes.author: Mary J. Blige

quotes.text: Finishing a good book is like leaving a good friend.
quotes.author: William Feather

quotes.text: I'm passionate and I travel the world not just as a tourist but to understand cultures... I've lived with Masai tribe... I travel the world and bring it back in the form of a research book that would become the starting point for the collection.
quotes.author: John Galliano

quotes.text: My people. I have given them a sense of individuality, integrity. I have not made them slaves of any god or any religion. Nor of any holy book or any priest. I have certainly not replaced their god. They are all a part of what I call my traveling circus.
quotes.author: Rajneesh

quotes.text: Our life is a book that writes itself and whose principal themes sometimes escape us. We are like characters in a novel who do not always understand what the author wants of them.
quotes.author: Julien Green

quotes.text: I have zero desire, just so you know, to be in the limelight. I don't think it's good for the country to have a former president criticize his successor. You're not going to see me giving my opinions in the public arena, until I start selling my book. I'm going to emerge then submerge.
quotes.author: George W. Bush

quotes.text: A classic is a book that doesn't have to be written again.
quotes.author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quotes.text: Oh, I just want what we all want: a comfortable couch, a nice beverage, a weekend of no distractions and a book that will stop time, lift me out of my quotidian existence and alter my thinking forever.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.text: I've made mistakes, I've misspoke, I am sure I will again sometime, but that happens, that's part of being human in my book. I'm OK with that. I've never done it maliciously, ever.
quotes.author: Curt Schilling

quotes.text: To me, a book is a book, an electronic device is not, and love of books was the reason I started writing.
quotes.author: Elmore Leonard

quotes.text: Read. Read. Read. Just don't read one type of book. Read different books by various authors so that you develop different styles.
quotes.author: R. L. Stine

quotes.text: For several days after my first book was published, I carried it about in my pocket and took surreptitious peeps at it to make sure the ink had not faded.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.text: There was a different ending to 'New Moon' originally. It was a much quieter book. It was very much all in Bella's head.
quotes.author: Stephenie Meyer

quotes.text: One of my earliest memories is of seeing my mother in her beach chair, reading a book under an umbrella by the water's edge while my sisters and I played beside her. Of all the life lessons she taught me, that is one of my favorites: to take time at a place I love, restore my spirit with books and the beach.
quotes.author: Luanne Rice

quotes.text: A book may be compared to your neighbor: if it be good, it cannot last too long; if bad, you cannot get rid of it too early.
quotes.author: Rupert Brooke

quotes.text: Everything is an open book. I don't speak on other people's hardship, but if it happened in my life or something that has been an experience on my particular journey, I'm going to talk about it. That's what my fan base appreciates the most. I'm universal. You can relate to the things I say or that I go through.
quotes.author: Kevin Hart

quotes.text: There is a great deal of difference between an eager man who wants to read a book and the tired man who wants a book to read.
quotes.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.text: A book should serve as the ax for the frozen sea within us.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: I have a giant baking book, so I close my eyes and pick a random page. Whatever it is, I try to bake it!
quotes.author: Nina Dobrev

quotes.text: To read a paper book is another experience: you can do it on a ship, on the branch of a tree, on your bed, even if there is a blackout.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: Religious fanatics want people to switch off their own minds, ignore the evidence, and blindly follow a holy book based upon private 'revelation'.
quotes.author: Richard Dawkins

quotes.text: A wild and crazy weekend involves sitting on the front porch, smoking a cigar, reading a book.
quotes.author: Robert M. Gates

quotes.text: While writing, I tend to repeat the same song, endlessly, for thousands of times. This helps me ignore any lyrics, and helps create a consistent mood for each book.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.text: My career is an open book, but my life is not.
quotes.author: Barry Bonds

quotes.text: To read a book, to think it over, and to write out notes is a useful exercise; a book which will not repay some hard thought is not worth publishing.
quotes.author: Maria Mitchell

quotes.text: As a child, I had the opportunity to meet the captain onboard a British Airways flight. It was so exciting to see the cockpit and controls. I was in awe of the captain, and he stamped my log book, which I still have to this day.
quotes.author: Orlando Bloom

quotes.text: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life; and the procedure, the process is its own reward.
quotes.author: Amelia Earhart

quotes.text: Film will only became an art when its materials are as inexpensive as pencil and paper.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: The current medical records system is this: Room after room after room in a hospital filled with paper files.
quotes.author: Timothy Murphy

quotes.text: Experience taught me a few things. One is to listen to your gut, no matter how good something sounds on paper. The second is that you're generally better off sticking with what you know. And the third is that sometimes your best investments are the ones you don't make.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.text: We are material creatures who spend much of our lives on material pursuits (even building a cathedral or writing a novel requires stone and mortar or paper and ink).
quotes.author: Virginia Postrel

quotes.text: I can say with a solid degree of authority that I am a selfish person. I spontaneously forget the names of more people than not, unless I want to make out with them. I will take the last square of toilet paper off the roll without thinking twice. I tip taxi drivers so poorly I'm amazed none of them have run over my foot while speeding off.
quotes.author: Sloane Crosley

quotes.text: My movie is born first in my head, dies on paper; is resuscitated by the living persons and real objects I use, which are killed on film but, placed in a certain order and projected on to a screen, come to life again like flowers in water.
quotes.author: Robert Bresson

quotes.text: Every story was being made up. My true friends weren't the ones speaking. It was people who never knew me, making up stories. Even my local paper put a $1,000 bounty out for information about my whereabouts.
quotes.author: Marla Maples

quotes.text: My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: I've never been a very prolific person, so when creativity flows, it flows. I find myself scribbling on little notepads and pieces of loose paper, which results in a very small portion of my writings to ever show up in true form.
quotes.author: Kurt Cobain

quotes.text: If you're the village blacksmith and a model T comes along, you better become a mechanic. People's lives are better when they get news online versus having to wait for the morning paper. It's a lot more efficient, a lot more real time, a lot less waste.
quotes.author: Marc Andreessen

quotes.text: At the age of four with paper hats and wooden swords we're all Generals. Only some of us never grow out of it.
quotes.author: Peter Ustinov

quotes.text: Everything I do is just really my intuition, and every time I go against my intuition, it's a mistake. Even though I may sit down and analyze and intellectualize something on paper, if I go against my gut feeling, it's wrong.
quotes.author: Tamara Mellon

quotes.text: Writing is easy: All you do is sit staring at a blank sheet of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead.
quotes.author: Gene Fowler

quotes.text: 'Hamlet' is one of the most dangerous things ever set down on paper. All the big, unknowable questions like what it is to be a human being; the difference between sanity and insanity; the meaning of life and death; what's real and not real. All these subjects can literally drive you mad.
quotes.author: Michael Sheen

quotes.text: To read a paper book is another experience: you can do it on a ship, on the branch of a tree, on your bed, even if there is a blackout.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: My daughter loves to do art stuff. As a father, I like to play with her. We break out the big pads of paper and the glitter and all the stuff. She likes to do what she likes to do. I want to do something, too. So I've just started using her same materials - a lot of crayons, a lot of sparkle, charcoal, pencils, markers and glue.
quotes.author: Stone Gossard

quotes.text: Numbers have life; they're not just symbols on paper.
quotes.author: Shakuntala Devi

quotes.text: Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.text: I soothe my conscience now with the thought that it is better for hard words to be on paper than that Mummy should carry them in her heart.
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.text: Ever since I was a girl, I have written about one to five pages every day - on napkins, on scrap paper, in notebooks and tablets, on the walls in my room as a teenager, and in orange paint on the cheap white plastic blinds in my room.
quotes.author: Roseanne Barr

quotes.text: I always wrote. I wrote from when I was 12. That was therapeutic for me in those days. I wrote things to get them out of feeling them, and onto paper. So writing in a way saved me, kept me company. I did the traditional thing with falling in love with words, reading books and underlining lines I liked and words I didn't know.
quotes.author: Carrie Fisher

quotes.text: If some great catastrophe is not announced every morning, we feel a certain void. Nothing in the paper today, we sigh.
quotes.author: Lord Acton

quotes.text: I made a circle with a smile for a mouth on yellow paper, because it was sunshiny and bright.
quotes.author: Harvey Ball

quotes.text: I could work in the shower if I had plastic paper.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.text: I was raised by my grandparents, and they always made sure that I had a pencil and some paper, whether we were in the car or at a restaurant. While they were enjoying a nice meal, I would be sitting there drawing funny pictures of the waitress.
quotes.author: Jarrett J. Krosoczka

quotes.text: Money, again, has often been a cause of the delusion of the multitudes. Sober nations have all at once become desperate gamblers, and risked almost their existence upon the turn of a piece of paper.
quotes.author: Charles Mackay

quotes.text: Computers are wasteful of paper and time. Once, we'd get documents with a few errors. Now, people make hundreds of copies until each sheet is flawless and memos are duplicated endlessly. Managers get swamped with emails.
quotes.author: Felix Dennis

quotes.text: You can only generate ideas when you put pencil to paper, brush to canvas... when you actually do something physical.
quotes.author: Twyla Tharp

quotes.text: God created paper for the purpose of drawing architecture on it. Everything else is, at least for me, an abuse of paper.
quotes.author: Alvar Aalto

quotes.text: It's that I don't like white paper backgrounds. A woman does not live in front of white paper. She lives on the street, in a motor car, in a hotel room.
quotes.author: Helmut Newton

quotes.text: I was teased if I brought my books home. I would take a paper bag to the library and put the books in the bag and bring them home. Not that I was that concerned about them teasing me - because I would hit them in a heartbeat. But I felt a little ashamed, having books.
quotes.author: Walter Dean Myers

quotes.text: I still love taking pictures with Polaroid film. For me, it offers the most beautiful way of capturing reality and transferring it onto a flat piece of paper.
quotes.author: Helena Christensen

quotes.text: Another time factor is output: proofing and printing. That is, getting your work out of the computer and onto paper and having it satisfy you. It can be time consuming and expensive.
quotes.author: Buffy Sainte-Marie

quotes.text: Dad wouldn't let me fool with his guitar much, because I'm left-handed, and I'd pick it up upside down. But I remember learning to sing 'Paper Doll,' the Mills Brothers song - this was during the war - and I remember my dad taking me down to one of those little record booths where you could make spoken letters to send home.
quotes.author: Don Everly

quotes.text: It was one of those evenings when men feel that truth, goodness and beauty are one. In the morning, when they commit their discovery to paper, when others read it written there, it looks wholly ridiculous.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.text: A lady is smarter than a gentleman, maybe, she can sew a fine seam, she can have a baby, she can use her intuition instead of her brain, but she can't fold a paper in a crowded train.
quotes.author: Phyllis McGinley

quotes.text: I wrapped my Christmas presents early this year, but I used the wrong paper. See, the paper I used said 'Happy Birthday' on it. I didn't want to waste it so I just wrote 'Jesus' on it.
quotes.author: Demetri Martin

quotes.text: When at last we are sure, You've been properly pilled, Then a few paper forms, Must be properly filled. So that you and your heirs, May be properly billed.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: All the best performers bring to their role something more, something different than what the author put on paper. That's what makes theatre live. That's why it persists.
quotes.author: Stephen Sondheim

quotes.text: Only government can take perfectly good paper, cover it with perfectly good ink and make the combination worthless.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.text: I always found the extraordinary loss of life in the First World War very moving. I remember learning about it as a very young child, as an eight- or nine-year-old, asking my teachers what poppies were for. Every year the teachers would suddenly wear these red paper flowers in their lapels, and I would say 'What does that mean?'
quotes.author: Tom Hiddleston

quotes.text: I get up, go and get a coffee, and go do the crossword - I'm loyal to one particular paper, the 'Guardian' - and that's my idea of a perfect morning.
quotes.author: Laura Marling

quotes.text: France is the country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.
quotes.author: Billy Wilder

quotes.text: Every other artist begins with a blank canvas, a piece of paper the photographer begins with the finished product.
quotes.author: Edward Steichen

quotes.text: I'm very much in the trenches, and I don't live in the lap of luxury. I come from a working-class military family. We watch the news and read the paper and vote, so there's always something to be upset about. I always have a certain amount of angst in my back pocket.
quotes.author: Pink

quotes.text: The worst thing you can do is censor yourself as the pencil hits the paper. You must not edit until you get it all on paper. If you can put everything down, stream-of-consciousness, you'll do yourself a service.
quotes.author: Stephen Sondheim

quotes.text: In some ways, it's better that Obama got elected than McCain. I'd rather be stabbed in the chest with an Obama steak knife than to have been slowly bled to death with McCain paper cuts. Say what you will, but Obama has brought about a patriotic and civic renaissance, the likes of which I have never seen.
quotes.author: Brad Thor

quotes.text: I am not that attached to material things. And the good thing is I can make choices. I have very few possessions. Luckily, as a man you don't need much... a few papers, a couple of books, and a few shirts, jackets, sweaters. It fits in a little thing, in a paper bag, so it's very easy.
quotes.author: Nicolas Berggruen

quotes.text: What I like most about directing is creating a world more so than anything. To me, the music is the wrapping paper on that world.
quotes.author: Matthew Gray Gubler

quotes.text: Mathematics is a game played according to certain simple rules with meaningless marks on paper.
quotes.author: David Hilbert

quotes.text: By 2025, we can expect the world to be completely digital. Paper books will be a thing of the past. Education will be delivered through analytics-based assessment tools and adaptive learning platforms.
quotes.author: Osman Rashid

quotes.text: Words mean more than what is set down on paper. It takes the human voice to infuse them with deeper meaning.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.text: For anything worth having one must pay the price; and the price is always work, patience, love, self-sacrifice - no paper currency, no promises to pay, but the gold of real service.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.text: Albert Camus's 'La Peste' - 'The Plague' - had an enormous impact on me when I read it in high school French class, and I chose my senior yearbook quote from it. In college, I wrote a philosophy class paper on Camus and Sartre, and again chose my yearbook quote from 'La Peste.'
quotes.author: Drew Gilpin Faust

quotes.text: Facts from paper are not the same as facts from people. The reliability of the people giving you the facts is as important as the facts themselves.
quotes.author: Harold S. Geneen

quotes.text: I don't think many people understand what racism is. The intellectuals use it like toilet paper; it's something they can use. It's not something they live.
quotes.author: Mark Fuhrman

quotes.text: I like the process of pencil and paper as opposed to a machine. I think the writing is better when it's done in handwriting.
quotes.author: Nelson DeMille

quotes.text: All my time not devoted to my master's service was spent either in prayer, or in making experiments in casting different things in moulds made of earth, in attempting to make paper, gunpowder, and many other experiments, that, although I could not perfect, yet convinced me of its practicability if I had the means.
quotes.author: Nat Turner

quotes.text: This paper will no doubt be found interesting by those who take an interest in it.
quotes.author: John Dalton

quotes.text: Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue, and abiding love.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: The way my brain processes information is quite odd. I mean, I have Attention Deficit Disorder and another learning disability I can't even spell. I don't even have a high school diploma. I'm smart, but you can't prove it on paper.
quotes.author: Ron White

quotes.text: I'm still a soldier, fighting with my pen and paper for peace till the day I cease.
quotes.author: Emmanuel Jal

quotes.text: Whenever I found out anything remarkable, I have thought it my duty to put down my discovery on paper, so that all ingenious people might be informed thereof.
quotes.author: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek

quotes.text: Learning lines is on my mind until I do know them. I'll read the paper or paint the house to keep from starting to memorize. I've never found an easy way.
quotes.author: Paul Lynde

quotes.text: I'd rather be a kid and play with paper planes, than be a man and play with a woman's heart.
quotes.author: Niall Horan

quotes.text: I have a loyalty that runs in my bloodstream, when I lock into someone or something, you can't get me away from it because I commit that thoroughly. That's in friendship, that's a deal, that's a commitment. Don't give me paper - I can get the same lawyer who drew it up to break it. But if you shake my hand, that's for life.
quotes.author: Jerry Lewis

quotes.text: What the world really needs is more love and less paper work.
quotes.author: Pearl Bailey

quotes.text: You control your future, your destiny. What you think about comes about. By recording your dreams and goals on paper, you set in motion the process of becoming the person you most want to be. Put your future in good hands - your own.
quotes.author: Mark Victor Hansen

quotes.text: I put a piece of paper under my pillow, and when I could not sleep I wrote in the dark.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: I think it would be cool if you were writing a ransom note on your computer, if the paper clip popped up and said, 'Looks like you're writing a ransom note. Need help? You should use more forceful language, you'll get more money.'
quotes.author: Demetri Martin

quotes.text: It's extremely difficult to get these jobs because you can't get a job on a ship unless you have seaman's paper's, and you can't get seaman's papers unless you have a job on a ship. There had to be a way to break through the circle, and he was the one who arranged it for me.
quotes.author: Paul Auster

quotes.text: You don't realize how hard it is to live on your own. But there's no mom to do your laundry, and make you dinner and to do things for you, and you don't think about little things like buying paper towels and salt.
quotes.author: Emma Roberts

quotes.text: When I see a white piece of paper, I feel I've got to draw. And drawing, for me, is the beginning of everything.
quotes.author: Ellsworth Kelly

quotes.text: We need to take command of the solar system to gain that wealth, and to escape the sea of paper our government is becoming, and for some decent chance of stopping a Dinosaur Killer asteroid.
quotes.author: Larry Niven

quotes.text: Christmas always rustled. It rustled every time, mysteriously, with silver and gold paper, tissue paper and a rich abundance of shiny paper, decorating and hiding everything and giving a feeling of reckless extravagance.
quotes.author: Tove Jansson

quotes.text: I did Playboy. There was an ad in the paper for playmates. Playboy called me and flew me to Los Angeles, and I was on the March cover of 1992.
quotes.author: Anna Nicole Smith

quotes.text: It is the advertiser who provides the paper for the subscriber. It is not to be disputed, that the publisher of a newspaper in this country, without a very exhaustive advertising support, would receive less reward for his labor than the humblest mechanic.
quotes.author: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.text: Advertising is the ability to sense, interpret... to put the very heart throbs of a business into type, paper and ink.
quotes.author: Leo Burnett

quotes.text: I think the currency of leadership is transparency. You've got to be truthful. I don't think you should be vulnerable every day, but there are moments where you've got to share your soul and conscience with people and show them who you are, and not be afraid of it.
quotes.author: Howard Schultz

quotes.text: It's not like I'm anti-China. I just think it's ridiculous that we allow them to do what they're doing to this country, with the manipulation of the currency, that you write about and understand, and all of the other things that they do.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.text: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency.
quotes.author: Vladimir Lenin

quotes.text: The only true currency in this bankrupt world is what you share with someone else when you're uncool.
quotes.author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

quotes.text: At its core, bitcoin is a smart currency designed by very forward-thinking engineers. It eliminates the need for banks, gets rid of credit card fees, currency exchange fees, money transfer fees, and reduces the need for lawyers in transitions... all good things.
quotes.author: Peter Diamandis

quotes.text: The times of Arab nationalism and unity are gone forever. These ideas which mobilized the masses are only a worthless currency. Libya has had to put up with too much from the Arabs for whom it has poured forth both blood and money.
quotes.author: Muammar al-Gaddafi

quotes.text: Roads, better harnesses for horses, time-keeping devices, financial instruments like a currency that was recognized everywhere in the kingdom, enforceable contracts - all of this made commerce more appealing than plunder.
quotes.author: Steven Pinker

quotes.text: I mean, I'm a conservative. I believe that, you know, if you borrow too much, you just build up debts for your children to pay off. You put pressure on interest rates. You put at risk your economy. That's the case in Britain. We're not a reserve currency, so we need to get on and deal with this issue.
quotes.author: David Cameron

quotes.text: Storytelling is my currency. It's my only worth. The only thing of value I have in this life is my ability to tell a story, whether in print, orating, writing it down or having people acting it out.
quotes.author: Kevin Smith

quotes.text: The most potentially transformative impact of social media is its ability to encourage brands to marry profit and purpose. The reason brands participate is that such outreach earns those companies social currency enabling them to start or participate in conversations that connect them to consumers in meaningful ways.
quotes.author: Simon Mainwaring

quotes.text: Until the control of the issue of currency and credit is restored to government and recognized as its most conspicuous and sacred responsibility, all talks of the sovereignty of Parliament and of democracy is idle and futile.
quotes.author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quotes.text: A weak currency is the sign of a weak economy, and a weak economy leads to a weak nation.
quotes.author: Ross Perot

quotes.text: Mitt - what I speak to Mitt Romney about is jobs. What I speak to Mitt Romney about is China, because he's got a great view on China and how they're trying to destroy our country by taking our jobs and making our product and manipulating their currency, so that it makes it almost impossible for our companies to compete.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.text: Flattery is a kind of bad money, to which our vanity gives us currency.
quotes.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.text: For anything worth having one must pay the price; and the price is always work, patience, love, self-sacrifice - no paper currency, no promises to pay, but the gold of real service.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.text: Money is my military, each dollar a soldier. I never send my money into battle unprepared and undefended. I send it to conquer and take currency prisoner and bring it back to me.
quotes.author: Kevin O'Leary

quotes.text: Say 'Toronto' or 'Ontario,' and the immediate thought associations are with a somewhat blander version of North America: a United States with a welfare regime and a more polite street etiquette, and the additionally reassuring visage of Queen Elizabeth on the currency.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.text: I think trust is primarily built through relationships, and it's important because it's the foundational currency that a leader has with his team or his followers.
quotes.author: Tom Rath

quotes.text: The first panacea for a mismanaged nation is inflation of the currency; the second is war. Both bring a temporary prosperity; both bring a permanent ruin. But both are the refuge of political and economic opportunists.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: Trust is a core currency of any relationship. Sometimes our need to control and micromanage everything erodes our confidence in ourselves and others. The truth: People are much more capable than we think. A hearty dose of trust is often what's needed to unlock the magic. Go ahead, have faith.
quotes.author: Kris Carr

quotes.text: Thoughts are mental energy; they're the currency that you have to attract what you desire. Learn to stop spending that currency on thoughts you don't want.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.text: Words are the coins making up the currency of sentences, and there are always too many small coins.
quotes.author: Jules Renard

quotes.text: You look at your bank account, and you see the currency of love and happiness is more important than the currency of money.
quotes.author: Richie Sambora

quotes.text: Time has always been used against us on a certain level. The invention of the clock made us accountable to the employer, gave us a standard measure and stopwatch management, and it also led to the requirement of interest-bearing currency to grow over time, the requirement of the expansion of our economy.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: There never has been a time in our history when work was so abundant or when wages were as high, whether measured by the currency in which they are paid or by their power to supply the necessaries and comforts of life.
quotes.author: Benjamin Harrison

quotes.text: It is proclaimed by the great leaders of that party, by its political conventions, by its ministers of the Gospel, and by every other means they have of giving currency and importance to the declaration, that it is its mission to abolish slavery in the Union.
quotes.author: John H. Reagan

quotes.text: Offendedness is just about the last shared moral currency in our country. And, I'm sorry, but it's really annoying. We don't discuss ideas or debate arguments, we try to figure out who is most offended.
quotes.author: Kevin DeYoung

quotes.text: Now that I am sixty, I see why the idea of elder wisdom has passed from currency.
quotes.author: John Updike

quotes.text: Like anything else that happens on its own, the act of writing is beyond currency. Money is great stuff to have, but when it comes to the act of creation, the best thing is not to think of money too much. It constipates the whole process.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: Every time I am tempted to buy some dopey thing, I hear my late father's voice: 'Do you really need that?' He was big on saving money and buying as much security as possible. He also encouraged charitable giving. So, I am responsible with currency.
quotes.author: Bill O'Reilly

quotes.text: Is a currency worth anything if no one wants it? We used to buy shoes in Italy. Remember?
quotes.author: Erica Jong

quotes.text: What happens often - although I'm not particularly a victim of this sort of thing - is that somebody will make a quote, or invent a remark and it gets printed, ends up on the 'net and it becomes currency. And some of them are so bizarre!
quotes.author: Robert Palmer

quotes.text: English businesses would face massive transaction costs if Scotland, their second biggest export market, used a different currency.
quotes.author: Nicola Sturgeon

quotes.text: Conversion and zealotry, just like revelation and apostasy, are flip sides of the same coin, the currency of a political culture having more in common with religion than rational discourse.
quotes.author: Norman Finkelstein

quotes.text: Mischief springs from the power which the moneyed interest derives from a paper currency which they are able to control, from the multitude of corporations with exclusive privileges... which are employed altogether for their benefit.
quotes.author: Andrew Jackson

quotes.text: The Unites States used to use law enforcement to aggressively target North Korea illicit activities - counterfeiting U.S. currency, drug-running, counterfeit cigarettes and pharmaceuticals - until diplomacy gutted those efforts. The effort should be reinvigorated.
quotes.author: Ed Royce

quotes.text: The only currency I value is the coin of the spirit. That's very important in my life.
quotes.author: Kinky Friedman

quotes.text: Small change, small wonders - these are the currency of my endurance and ultimately of my life.
quotes.author: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.text: I can't imagine it if beauty was the only currency I used as an actress. It just doesn't interest me.
quotes.author: Hayley Atwell

quotes.text: With superheroes and comics and fantasy and sci-fi being absolutely the popular currency in cinema, it's like people have said in endless magazines, it's the revenge of the geeks and all that. There's some truth in that.
quotes.author: Martin Freeman

quotes.text: Find the human in the technology. The currency marketers trade in has not changed even if the methods have. Emotion is what we exchange.
quotes.author: Simon Mainwaring

quotes.text: The euro currency both presupposes and promotes a fiction - that 'Europe' has somehow become, against the wishes of most Europeans, a political rather than a merely geographic expression.
quotes.author: George Will

quotes.text: Believe me, the next step is a currency crisis because there will be a rejection of the dollar, the rejection of the dollar is a big, big event, and then your personal liberties are going to be severely threatened.
quotes.author: Ron Paul

quotes.text: He who tampers with the currency robs labor of its bread.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.text: A currency serves three functions: providing a means of payment, a unit of account and a store of value. Gold may be a store of value for wealth, but it is not a means of payment. You cannot pay for your groceries with it. Nor is it a unit of account. Prices of goods and services, and of financial assets, are not denominated in gold terms.
quotes.author: Nouriel Roubini

quotes.text: What people fail to appreciate is that the currency of corruption in elective office is, not money, but votes.
quotes.author: James L. Buckley

quotes.text: On the Internet, inside information is currency, and there will always be counterfeiters among us.
quotes.author: J. Michael Straczynski

quotes.text: It's not so unusual to run out of someone else's currency.
quotes.author: Jeffrey Sachs

quotes.text: My view is that the bitcoin is in its very early days, and it is an artificial currency. But whether it is creating new money, whether it is sustainable, whether it would survive - I have many questions about it.
quotes.author: Uday Kotak

quotes.text: So if the euro, if Euroland is to become a reserve center, if the euro is to become a reserve currency, Euroland will have to have a deficit in its overall balance of payments.
quotes.author: Robert C. Solomon

quotes.text: Challenging unfairly subsidized products, fighting counterfeit goods and intellectual property theft and holding countries accountable for an unfair currency regime will help American companies remain competitive.
quotes.author: Virginia Foxx

quotes.text: The true currency of life is time, not money, and we've all got a limited stock of that.
quotes.author: Robert Harris

quotes.text: Music files and downloading have indeed changed the currency of music to a great degree.
quotes.author: Henry Rollins

quotes.text: Money is the worst currency that ever grew among mankind. This sacks cities, this drives men from their homes, this teaches and corrupts the worthiest minds to turn base deeds.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: In reality there is no such thing as an inflation of prices, relatively to gold. There is such a thing as a depreciated paper currency.
quotes.author: Lysander Spooner

quotes.text: The currency of universal values make brands innately sharable.
quotes.author: Simon Mainwaring

quotes.text: I do not understand where the backing of Bitcoin is coming from. There is no fundamental issue of capabilities of repaying it in anything which is universally acceptable, which is either intrinsic value of the currency or the credit or trust of the individual who is issuing the money, whether it's a government or an individual.
quotes.author: Alan Greenspan

quotes.text: A disordered currency is one of the greatest political evils.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.text: If the American government can't stand behind the dollar, the world's benchmark currency, then the global financial system will very likely enter a new era in which there is much less trade and much less economic growth. It would be, by most accounts, the largest self-imposed financial disaster in history.
quotes.author: Adam Davidson

quotes.text: But because we in the United States finance our current account deficit by borrowing in our own currency, we can move to a more competitive dollar without the adverse effects that followed currency declines in other countries.
quotes.author: Martin Feldstein

quotes.text: In the old days we were the challenger brand competing against the big banks, but today I go round the world and I sit with governors of central banks and finance ministers and, in some cases, prime ministers. They all know Travelex. We are regarded as the establishment - the world's largest retailer of foreign currency.
quotes.author: Lloyd Dorfman

quotes.text: Our fiat currency is under increasing stress with our large and growing trade deficits. We have a federal deficit that is calculated in the trillions when we take into account the net present value of the future Social Security and Medicaid obligations we are creating today.
quotes.author: George Noory

quotes.text: I remember being in the Ontario Legislature and the Liberals yelling over at me about the fact that the dollar was rising, and that was bad for business, and didn't I realize that. And I thought, 'What are you talking about?' The value of the currency in part, large part, reflects the world's view of the state of our economy.
quotes.author: Jim Flaherty

quotes.text: I am in favor of high wages and agree that the higher the wages, the stronger the evidence of prosperity, provided (and that is the important point) they are so naturally, by the effectiveness of industry, and not in consequence of an inflated currency or any artificial regulation.
quotes.author: John C. Calhoun

quotes.text: Common experience is the gold reserve which confers an exchange value on the currency which words are; without this reserve of shared experiences, all our pronouncements are checks drawn on insufficient funds.
quotes.author: Rene Daumal

quotes.text: War used to be something you could stand on the nearby hill and watch. Now we have total war; everybody's in it. We have total economics as well. Everything affects everybody. The Malaysian currency shakes, and people around the world are seriously affected.
quotes.author: Salman Rushdie

quotes.text: To pursue a career in Hollywood you have to have a personality bypass. Look at the top 20 stars in the world - there's probably only two actors among them. Hollywood's not about you as an actor. It's about your currency, what you 'bring to the table'. And I've never been one to jump through hoops for anyone.
quotes.author: Robert Carlyle

quotes.text: Bond investors want growth much like equity investors, and to the extent that too much austerity leads to recession or stagnation then credit spreads widen out - even if a country can print its own currency and write its own cheques.
quotes.author: Bill Gross

quotes.text: Favouring employment versus the financial markets is a decent policy; certainly not beneficial for the currency or the gilt market, but beneficial for the people.
quotes.author: Bill Gross

quotes.text: This legislation confronts the human truth that the need for clean water knows no borders, and proper management and intervention can be a currency for peace and international cooperation.
quotes.author: Bill Frist

quotes.text: I think people figure out early in their lives what currency they can work in.
quotes.author: Merrill Markoe

quotes.text: Growing up, I learned that if you are passionate about something, that you can move mountains. Passion is more precious than gold, and it's a currency that everyone craves. It's something that's hard to fake, and when it's real, everyone wants to be on that train. It's about giving people something that they can believe.
quotes.author: Stephanie Allain

quotes.text: Many have wondered if Greece's economy would get so bad that it would eventually break away from the Eurozone - a move that could encourage other countries to follow and therefore splinter the currency union.
quotes.author: Jens Nordvig

quotes.text: Salvation cannot be bought with the currency of obedience; it is purchased by the blood of the Son of God. Thinking that we can trade our good works for salvation is like buying a plane ticket and then supposing we own the airline. Or thinking that after paying rent for our home, we now hold title to the entire planet earth.
quotes.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

quotes.text: China's idea of fair trade is government subsidies of its textile and apparel exports to the United States, currency manipulation, and forgiveness of loans by its government banks.
quotes.author: Virginia Foxx

quotes.text: We know that advanced economies with stable governments that borrow in their own currency are capable of running up very high levels of debt without crisis.
quotes.author: Paul Krugman

quotes.text: There are a few things that people all around the world need to admit to themselves. Trade restraints slow economic growth, the euro is not a reserve currency, and scoreless sports ties are boring.
quotes.author: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.text: Bitcoin is mostly about anonymous transactions, and I don't think over time that's a good way to go. I'm a huge believe in digital currency... but doing it on an anonymous basis I think that leads to some abuses, so I'm not involved in Bitcoin.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.text: Britain is not in the single currency, and we're not going to be. But we all need the eurozone to have the right governance and structures to secure a successful currency for the long term.
quotes.author: David Cameron

quotes.text: To measure prices by a currency that is called by the same names as gold, but that is really inferior in value to gold, and then - because those prices are nominally higher than gold prices - to say that they are inflated, relatively to gold, is a perfect absurdity.
quotes.author: Lysander Spooner

quotes.text: In the digital universe, our personal history and its sense of narrative is succeeded by our social networking profile - a snapshot of the current moment. The information itself - our social graph of friends and likes - is a product being sold to market researchers in order to better predict and guide our futures.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: The greatest moments are those when you see the result pop up in a graph or in your statistics analysis - that moment you realise you know something no one else does and you get the pleasure of thinking about how to tell them.
quotes.author: Emily Oster

quotes.text: Every dance is a kind of fever chart, a graph of the heart.
quotes.author: Martha Graham

quotes.text: When producers want to know what the public wants, they graph it as curves. When they want to tell the public what to get, they say it in curves.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.text: I'm not interested in possible complexities. I regard song structure as a graph paper.
quotes.author: Brian Eno

quotes.text: One thing we seem to be missing is that just as we no longer search for the news, the news finds us today (e.g. this article found me) we will no longer search for products and services, rather we will look to our social graph to what products and services they like and don't like.
quotes.author: Erik Qualman

quotes.text: Fortunately, human forgetting follows a pattern. We forget exponentially. A graph of our likelihood of getting the correct answer on a quiz sweeps quickly downward over time and then levels off.
quotes.author: Gary Wolf

quotes.text: You can graph human evolution, which is mostly a straight line, but we do get better and change over time, and you can graph technological evolution, which is a line that's going straight up. They are going to intersect each other at some point, and that's happening now.
quotes.author: Daniel H. Wilson

quotes.text: The company that creates one global social graph will be very important going forward. It will be Facebook, with maybe 2-3 local social networks able to sustain competition long term.
quotes.author: Yuri Milner

quotes.text: The trouble is that the hockey stick graph become an icon and deniers reckoned if they could smash the icon, the whole concept of global warming would be destroyed with it.
quotes.author: Michael E. Mann

quotes.text: If Facebook gets your entire social graph, you don't necessarily want to share everything with your entire social graph. You might wanna parse that social graph. So there's a company called PASS that is a private social network that I personally use for my friends and my family.
quotes.author: Ashton Kutcher

quotes.text: Data-intensive graph problems abound in the Life Science drug discovery and development process.
quotes.author: Leroy Hood

quotes.text: One third of the economy goes through 'QuickBooks' in terms of businesses invoicing other businesses. Each invoice contains a connection between vendors, suppliers, and customers, and also the price of that connection. Representing the payment graph is huge opportunity and something no other company can do.
quotes.author: Aaron Patzer

quotes.text: A dead tree, cut into planks and read from one end to the other, is a kind of line graph, with dates down one side and height along the other, as if trees, like mathematicians, had found a way of turning time into form.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: Art and mass entertainment and propaganda, they can all be plotted on the same graph, but there is a difference.
quotes.author: David Mamet

quotes.text: Facebook isn't helping you make new connections, Facebook doesn't develop new relationships, Facebook is just trying to be the most accurate model of your social graph. There's a part of me that feels somewhat bored by all of this.
quotes.author: Sean Parker

quotes.text: So this is the only TV show in America where I am quite confident that you, the audience, will share my excitement when I tell you that coming up in our next segment, we have the best graph ever. Best graph ever.
quotes.author: Rachel Maddow

quotes.text: Think about spam filters; if email didn't come from someone that someone you know knows, that's an important signal, and one we could embed in the environment; we just don't. I just want the world to be filtered through my social graph.
quotes.author: Clay Shirky

quotes.text: Dad loved computer games, and I would sit beside him for hours with graph paper, drawing out plans to try and forecast the moves he should make while he worked the computer controller.
quotes.author: Rhianna Pratchett

quotes.text: I'm sure that you could go back and make a graph showing that all the killings of black males increased in times of economic difficulty. As a matter of fact, a black man was lynched last year.
quotes.author: Ishmael Reed

quotes.text: The power of Facebook is not only in the vast size of the connected audience, but also in the quality of the social ties and interactions that occur within the network. The Facebook social graph fuels our mantra 'Try it for free', 'Share it if you like it', 'Buy it if you love it.'
quotes.author: David Perry

quotes.text: I made three or four different fonts during 'Short Term 12' -' it was how I'd calm my mind between scenes. I have graph paper and gel pens, and I would do the alphabet: just do 'a' over and over again until I got it perfect and then go to 'b' and then 'c'.
quotes.author: Brie Larson

quotes.text: Open Graph is a language for structuring content and sharing that goes on in other apps, and we're continuing to build it out longer term. But we found we need to build more specific experiences around categories like music or movies. Where we've taken the time to build those specific experiences, stuff has gone quite well.
quotes.author: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.text: What people see is just your career graph and the films you do. But that's a very small aspect of my life.
quotes.author: Kangana Ranaut

quotes.text: I started getting Twitter followers after I started doing press for 'Fargo.' One of my best friends from college is a librarian, and she started tracking after each interview how many Twitter followers I got. She and her librarian friends were like, 'We're going to make a graph.' And I was like, 'Alright, nerds.'
quotes.author: Allison Tolman

quotes.text: I don't work for production houses. I only work for good scripts and roles. If you follow my career graph, you will find that I have not given a single flop yet in my career. I am proud of it.
quotes.author: Anushka Sharma

quotes.text: There is absolutely no planning and strategising involved in my career graph.
quotes.author: Juhi Chawla

quotes.text: The next wave of the social graph is empowering services like Airbnb and Lyft that give people the chance to have that physical interaction. People are more open to that because of Airbnb. Airbnb took couch surfing and took an additional step.
quotes.author: John Zimmer

quotes.text: The solution to transportation inefficiencies lies at the intersection of collaborative consumption and the social graph: Shifting transportation from ownership to access.
quotes.author: John Zimmer

quotes.text: Anytime you want to hear about graph partitioning, I will be glad to tell you what I know about graph partitioning. It remains a standard problem. I think it's an interesting problem, because it shows up in a variety of guises in real life.
quotes.author: Brian Kernighan

quotes.text: Facebook has stitched together your social graph. The idea of an interest graph is to bring together everyone that has shared interests. If I can isolate the people who are into mountain biking in Marin, in one place, the ability to put ads against that is really high.
quotes.author: Bill Gurley

quotes.text: Facebook is the social graph with the organizing principle around your friends and your social life. LinkedIn is the professional graph, organized around you, your job, your industry, your title and your function. At Chegg, we are building a student graph centered around you, as a student.
quotes.author: Dan Rosensweig

quotes.text: In the digital universe, our personal history and its sense of narrative is succeeded by our social networking profile - a snapshot of the current moment. The information itself - our social graph of friends and likes - is a product being sold to market researchers in order to better predict and guide our futures.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: The greatest moments are those when you see the result pop up in a graph or in your statistics analysis - that moment you realise you know something no one else does and you get the pleasure of thinking about how to tell them.
quotes.author: Emily Oster

quotes.text: Every dance is a kind of fever chart, a graph of the heart.
quotes.author: Martha Graham

quotes.text: When producers want to know what the public wants, they graph it as curves. When they want to tell the public what to get, they say it in curves.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.text: I'm not interested in possible complexities. I regard song structure as a graph paper.
quotes.author: Brian Eno

quotes.text: One thing we seem to be missing is that just as we no longer search for the news, the news finds us today (e.g. this article found me) we will no longer search for products and services, rather we will look to our social graph to what products and services they like and don't like.
quotes.author: Erik Qualman

quotes.text: Fortunately, human forgetting follows a pattern. We forget exponentially. A graph of our likelihood of getting the correct answer on a quiz sweeps quickly downward over time and then levels off.
quotes.author: Gary Wolf

quotes.text: You can graph human evolution, which is mostly a straight line, but we do get better and change over time, and you can graph technological evolution, which is a line that's going straight up. They are going to intersect each other at some point, and that's happening now.
quotes.author: Daniel H. Wilson

quotes.text: The company that creates one global social graph will be very important going forward. It will be Facebook, with maybe 2-3 local social networks able to sustain competition long term.
quotes.author: Yuri Milner

quotes.text: The trouble is that the hockey stick graph become an icon and deniers reckoned if they could smash the icon, the whole concept of global warming would be destroyed with it.
quotes.author: Michael E. Mann

quotes.text: If Facebook gets your entire social graph, you don't necessarily want to share everything with your entire social graph. You might wanna parse that social graph. So there's a company called PASS that is a private social network that I personally use for my friends and my family.
quotes.author: Ashton Kutcher

quotes.text: Data-intensive graph problems abound in the Life Science drug discovery and development process.
quotes.author: Leroy Hood

quotes.text: One third of the economy goes through 'QuickBooks' in terms of businesses invoicing other businesses. Each invoice contains a connection between vendors, suppliers, and customers, and also the price of that connection. Representing the payment graph is huge opportunity and something no other company can do.
quotes.author: Aaron Patzer

quotes.text: A dead tree, cut into planks and read from one end to the other, is a kind of line graph, with dates down one side and height along the other, as if trees, like mathematicians, had found a way of turning time into form.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: Art and mass entertainment and propaganda, they can all be plotted on the same graph, but there is a difference.
quotes.author: David Mamet

quotes.text: Facebook isn't helping you make new connections, Facebook doesn't develop new relationships, Facebook is just trying to be the most accurate model of your social graph. There's a part of me that feels somewhat bored by all of this.
quotes.author: Sean Parker

quotes.text: So this is the only TV show in America where I am quite confident that you, the audience, will share my excitement when I tell you that coming up in our next segment, we have the best graph ever. Best graph ever.
quotes.author: Rachel Maddow

quotes.text: Think about spam filters; if email didn't come from someone that someone you know knows, that's an important signal, and one we could embed in the environment; we just don't. I just want the world to be filtered through my social graph.
quotes.author: Clay Shirky

quotes.text: Dad loved computer games, and I would sit beside him for hours with graph paper, drawing out plans to try and forecast the moves he should make while he worked the computer controller.
quotes.author: Rhianna Pratchett

quotes.text: I'm sure that you could go back and make a graph showing that all the killings of black males increased in times of economic difficulty. As a matter of fact, a black man was lynched last year.
quotes.author: Ishmael Reed

quotes.text: In the digital universe, our personal history and its sense of narrative is succeeded by our social networking profile - a snapshot of the current moment. The information itself - our social graph of friends and likes - is a product being sold to market researchers in order to better predict and guide our futures.
quotes.author: Douglas Rushkoff

quotes.text: The greatest moments are those when you see the result pop up in a graph or in your statistics analysis - that moment you realise you know something no one else does and you get the pleasure of thinking about how to tell them.
quotes.author: Emily Oster

quotes.text: Every dance is a kind of fever chart, a graph of the heart.
quotes.author: Martha Graham

quotes.text: When producers want to know what the public wants, they graph it as curves. When they want to tell the public what to get, they say it in curves.
quotes.author: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.text: I'm not interested in possible complexities. I regard song structure as a graph paper.
quotes.author: Brian Eno

quotes.author: Erik Qualman

quotes.text: Fortunately, human forgetting follows a pattern. We forget exponentially. A graph of our likelihood of getting the correct answer on a quiz sweeps quickly downward over time and then levels off.
quotes.author: Gary Wolf

quotes.text: You can graph human evolution, which is mostly a straight line, but we do get better and change over time, and you can graph technological evolution, which is a line that's going straight up. They are going to intersect each other at some point, and that's happening now.
quotes.author: Daniel H. Wilson

quotes.text: The company that creates one global social graph will be very important going forward. It will be Facebook, with maybe 2-3 local social networks able to sustain competition long term.
quotes.author: Yuri Milner

quotes.text: The trouble is that the hockey stick graph become an icon and deniers reckoned if they could smash the icon, the whole concept of global warming would be destroyed with it.
quotes.author: Michael E. Mann

quotes.text: If Facebook gets your entire social graph, you don't necessarily want to share everything with your entire social graph. You might wanna parse that social graph. So there's a company called PASS that is a private social network that I personally use for my friends and my family.
quotes.author: Ashton Kutcher

quotes.text: Data-intensive graph problems abound in the Life Science drug discovery and development process.
quotes.author: Leroy Hood

quotes.text: One third of the economy goes through 'QuickBooks' in terms of businesses invoicing other businesses. Each invoice contains a connection between vendors, suppliers, and customers, and also the price of that connection. Representing the payment graph is huge opportunity and something no other company can do.
quotes.author: Aaron Patzer

quotes.text: A dead tree, cut into planks and read from one end to the other, is a kind of line graph, with dates down one side and height along the other, as if trees, like mathematicians, had found a way of turning time into form.
quotes.author: Alice Oswald

quotes.text: Art and mass entertainment and propaganda, they can all be plotted on the same graph, but there is a difference.
quotes.author: David Mamet
